original: @1b # // rgya gar skad du //
analyzed: @1b # // rgya gar skad du //
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: shr'i badzra d'a ki n'a ma ma h'a ta natra r'a dza sya bi bri tti /
analyzed: shr'i badzra d'a ki n'a ma ma h'a ta natra r'a dza sya bi bri tti /
translated: Śrī-vajraḍākinī-nāma-mahātantra-rāja-vivṛtti.

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhes bya ba'i rnam par bshad pa /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhes bya ba'i rnam par bshad pa /
translated: The Explanation of the Great Tantra King Called the Glorious Vajra Ḍāka.

original: bcom ldan 'das thugs rje chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thugs rje chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed One, the Greatly Compassionate Noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: mkha' las shar ba'i zla ba ltar //
analyzed: mkha' las shar ba'i zla ba ltar //
translated: Like the moon rising from the sky,

original: mi shes sel ba'i 'od byed cing //
analyzed: mi shes sel ba'i 'od byed cing //
translated: Emitting light to dispel ignorance,

original: dngos grub bdud rtsi 'dzag pa yi ;
analyzed: dngos grub bdud rtsi 'dzag pa yi ;
translated: And dripping the nectar of spiritual powers,

original: / rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i sku la 'dud //
analyzed: / rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i sku la 'dud //
translated: I bow to the body of the Vajra Ḍāka.

original: gser dang rin chen rang bzhin las //
analyzed: gser dang rin chen rang bzhin las //
translated: From the nature of gold and jewels,

original: bsgrubs pas ri rgyal lhun po ltar //
analyzed: bsgrubs pas ri rgyal lhun po ltar //
translated: Accomplishing like Mount Meru, the king of mountains,

original: rgyud 'di'i yan lag las byung ba //
analyzed: rgyud 'di'i yan lag las byung ba //
translated: Arising from the branches of this tantra,

original: thams cad snying po 'ba' zhig skus //
analyzed: thams cad snying po 'ba' zhig skus //
translated: The essence of all is solely the body.

original: rgyud 'di yi ni don chen rnams //
analyzed: rgyud 'di yi ni don chen rnams //
translated: The great meanings of this tantra,

original: gang yin gsal ba'i blo gros kyis //
analyzed: gang yin gsal ba'i blo gros kyis //
translated: Whatever they are, with clear intelligence,

original: glog ltar tshim byed ljags bskyod nas //
analyzed: glog ltar tshim byed ljags bskyod nas //
translated: Stirring the tongue like lightning,

original: skad cig gis ni gsal mdzad pa //
analyzed: skad cig gis ni gsal mdzad pa //
translated: I will clarify here

original: gang yin de 'dir bdag gis ni //
analyzed: gang yin de 'dir bdag gis ni //
translated: whatever I have understood

original: bla mas ji ltar bstan pa rnams //🔽blo yis ji ltar dran pa bzhin //
analyzed: bla mas ji ltar bstan pa rnams // blo yis ji ltar dran pa bzhin //
translated: of the teachings of the guru.🔽I will express it clearly🔽according to my memory

original: gsal bar bya phyir brjod par bya //🔽rgyud du sbas pa'i don chen rnams //🔽man ngag las rnyed ma lus par //
analyzed: gsal bar bya phyir brjod par bya // rgyud du sbas pa'i don chen rnams // man ngag las rnyed ma lus par //
translated: of what I have understood.

original: bdag gis bri bar mi nus @2a * //
analyzed: bdag gis bri bar mi nus @2a * //
translated: I am not able to write down🔽all the great hidden meanings of the tantras🔽that are found in the esoteric instructions,

original: kyang ; cung zad tsam zhig bri bar bya //
analyzed: kyang ; cung zad tsam zhig bri bar bya //
translated: but I will write a little.

original: 'dir brjod par bya ba la sogs pa ma mthong bar rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams su yang gang du yang 'jug par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dir brjod par bya ba la sogs pa ma mthong bar rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams su yang gang du yang 'jug par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Here, those who do not see what is to be expressed and so on will not engage in anything at all.

original: de dag kyang dang por tshig tu brjod pa ma gtogs par mngon du mi 'gyur pa dang / 'bras bu don du gnyer bas sgrub thabs la 'jug pa rnams kyang sgrub pa po bdag nyid kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu de dang / rjes su mthun pa'i thabs kyis bsgrub par bya ba yin te ;
analyzed: de dag kyang dang por tshig tu brjod pa ma gtogs par mngon du mi 'gyur pa dang / 'bras bu don du gnyer bas sgrub thabs la 'jug pa rnams kyang sgrub pa po bdag nyid kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu de dang / rjes su mthun pa'i thabs kyis bsgrub par bya ba yin te ;
translated: Moreover, they will not manifest without first expressing it in words, and those who engage in the means of practice in pursuit of the result will accomplish the result that they themselves desire through a method that is in accord with it.

original: gzhan du na gal te de dag bdag nyid kyi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ma yin pa dang / nyams su blang bar mi nus pa ni mtho ris 'dod pa rnams ra skyes dkar po la brten nas bsgrub pa sangs rgyas pa snying rje can gyi 'dod pa'i thabs ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan du na gal te de dag bdag nyid kyi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ma yin pa dang / nyams su blang bar mi nus pa ni mtho ris 'dod pa rnams ra skyes dkar po la brten nas bsgrub pa sangs rgyas pa snying rje can gyi 'dod pa'i thabs ma yin pa dang /
translated: Otherwise, if those are not the result that is desired by oneself, and if it is not possible to practice, then the method of attaining heaven by relying on a white goat is not the method that is desired by the compassionate Buddhist.

original: gal te ra skyes dkar po bsad pa'i mchod pas mtho ris thob tu zin kyang snying rje can gyi mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ma yin pa la sogs pa de dag la brjod par bya ba la sogs pa'i khyad par tshig tu brjod pa ma gtogs par
analyzed: gal te ra skyes dkar po bsad pa'i mchod pas mtho ris thob tu zin kyang snying rje can gyi mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ma yin pa la sogs pa de dag la brjod par bya ba la sogs pa'i khyad par tshig tu brjod pa ma gtogs par
translated: If one were to attain heaven by means of the offering of killing a white goat, it would not be the result that is desired by the compassionate one.

original: 'jug par mi 'gyur bas gnas phun sum tshogs pa la sogs pa brjod pa'i sgo nas brjod par bya ba la sogs pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jug par mi 'gyur bas gnas phun sum tshogs pa la sogs pa brjod pa'i sgo nas brjod par bya ba la sogs pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the topic, etc., by means of the expression of the perfect place, etc.,

original: gsang ba mchog gi zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsang ba mchog gi zhes bya ba nas /
translated: the “supreme secret” and so on are expressed.

original: mkha' @2b 'gro kun dang mnyam sbyor ba'i //
analyzed: mkha' @2b 'gro kun dang mnyam sbyor ba'i //
translated: The “union with all dakinis”

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro bde ba'i mchog //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro bde ba'i mchog //
translated: The Vajra Dakini, Supreme Bliss,

original: ces bya ba ni bar gyi tshig rnams dang por sdud par byed pa rdo rje phag mos gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bar gyi tshig rnams dang por sdud par byed pa rdo rje phag mos gsungs te /
translated: is the one who first compiled the intermediate verses.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das gcig pu nyid gar mkhan ltar sems can rnams 'dul ba'i phyir 'chad pa po dang sdud par byed pa dang ; 'khor zhes bya ba dkyil 'khor pa dang / gtso bo zhes bya ba dkyil 'khor nyid dang / dngos grub dang sgrub thabs la sogs pa'i brjod par bya ba'i rang bzhin 'dzin par mdzad de /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das gcig pu nyid gar mkhan ltar sems can rnams 'dul ba'i phyir 'chad pa po dang sdud par byed pa dang ; 'khor zhes bya ba dkyil 'khor pa dang / gtso bo zhes bya ba dkyil 'khor nyid dang / dngos grub dang sgrub thabs la sogs pa'i brjod par bya ba'i rang bzhin 'dzin par mdzad de /
translated: The Bhagavat alone, like an actor, in order to tame sentient beings, is the one who explains, the one who compiles, and the retinue called the mandala, the principal one called the mandala itself, and the one who holds the nature of the topics to be expressed, such as siddhis and the means of achievement.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das nyid 'chad pa po la sogs par gnas mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das nyid 'chad pa po la sogs par gnas mod kyi /
translated: Thus, although the Bhagavat himself abides as the one who explains and so on,

original: las dang po pa 'jug pa'i phyir bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das ma'i gzugs su tha dad par bstan nas /
analyzed: las dang po pa 'jug pa'i phyir bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das ma'i gzugs su tha dad par bstan nas /
translated: in order to introduce beginners, he teaches himself as a separate form of Vajrayoginī.

original: gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Then he declares, “Dwelling in the supreme, sublime secret” and so on.

original: gsang ba mchog gis dgyes par bzhugs nas /
analyzed: gsang ba mchog gis dgyes par bzhugs nas /
translated: Dwelling in the supreme, sublime secret,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs zhes bya ba 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i brjod par bya ba la sogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis tshig gi gzhung rnams gsungs kyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs zhes bya ba 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i brjod par bya ba la sogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis tshig gi gzhung rnams gsungs kyi /
translated: The Bhagavat taught is to be connected with what will be stated below. The subject matter, etc. that were previously taught were taught by the Bhagavat himself in the form of the text.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje phag mo bdag nyid kyi rang bzo spong bar mdzad cing 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das las thos nas rgyud bsdus so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje phag mo bdag nyid kyi rang bzo spong bar mdzad cing 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das las thos nas rgyud bsdus so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The Bhagavatī Vajravārāhī is to be understood as rejecting her own composition, thinking, Having heard this from the Bhagavat, I compiled the tantra.

original: gsang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni thams cad la khyab pa'i chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: gsang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni thams cad la khyab pa'i chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: The word secret is the all-pervading dharmadhātu.

original: de las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'khrungs pas gsang ba ni chos kyi 'byung gnas so //
analyzed: de las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'khrungs pas gsang ba ni chos kyi 'byung gnas so //
translated: Since all tathāgatas are born from that, the secret is the source of phenomena.

original: der bzhugs pa ni der ri rab kyi steng du khang pa brtsegs par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: der bzhugs pa ni der ri rab kyi steng du khang pa brtsegs par gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding there means dwelling in the mansion on top of Mount Meru there.

original: ji lta bur gyur pa'i gsang ba zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa'i gsang ba zhe na /
translated: What kind of secret is it?

original: gsungs pa mchog ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa mchog ces bya ba ste /
translated: It is said, the supreme.

original: ye shes dam pa'i yul du gyur pas na mchog ge //
analyzed: ye shes dam pa'i yul du gyur pas na mchog ge //
translated: Since it is the object of the highest intuition, it is supreme.

original: dgyes pa zhes bya ba ni mchog tu bde ba bskyed pas yul du gyur pas so //
analyzed: dgyes pa zhes bya ba ni mchog tu bde ba bskyed pas yul du gyur pas so //
translated: Delight means that it is the object that generates the highest bliss.

original: thams cad bdag nyid ces bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid du gyur pas thams cad bdag nyid de gsang ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid ces bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid du gyur pas thams cad bdag nyid de gsang ba'o //
translated: All-nature means that it is the secret, since it is the nature of all the transcendent lords.

original: yang na me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa'i bdag nyid pas thams cad bdag nyid do //
analyzed: yang na me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa'i bdag nyid pas thams cad bdag nyid do //
translated: Or else, it is all-nature since it is the nature of the mirror-intuition, etc.

original: yang na thams cad kyi sgras ni rdo rje 'dzin pa bya la /
analyzed: yang na thams cad kyi sgras ni rdo rje 'dzin pa bya la /
translated: Or else, the word all refers to the vajra-holder,

original: de'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /🔽de dag gis ni gnas phun sum @3a * //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste / de dag gis ni gnas phun sum @3a * //
translated: and that which is his nature is so called.

original: tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: By these [verses] he has taught the perfection of the site.

original: rtag tu bzhugs zhes bya bas ni ston pa phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: rtag tu bzhugs zhes bya bas ni ston pa phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par ston par mdzad do //
translated: By always abiding he teaches the perfection of the teacher.

original: sna tshogs de'i rang bzhin gyis thog ma med pa'i dus nas gar yang ma bzhud pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs de'i rang bzhin gyis thog ma med pa'i dus nas gar yang ma bzhud pa'o //
translated: It is varied because it is the nature of the five transcendent lords, and without beginning or end because it has not gone anywhere since beginningless time.

original: de yang chos kyi sku la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis rtag tu da ltar byung ba nyid du rang bzhin rgyud rgyun chags par 'dir bzhugs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang chos kyi sku la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis rtag tu da ltar byung ba nyid du rang bzhin rgyud rgyun chags par 'dir bzhugs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Moreover, the meaning of “always dwelling here” is that the Bhagavān is always present in the present, with the nature of the dharmakāya, etc., and so forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: In what way is the Bhagavān?

original: mkha' 'gro kun dngos zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro kun dngos zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “the reality of all dakinis,” etc.

original: mkha' 'gro kun gyi sgras ni rab tu gtum mo la sogs pa'i lha mo la bya la de rnams kyi rang bzhin gang la yong ba de mkha' 'gro kun gyi dngos so //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro kun gyi sgras ni rab tu gtum mo la sogs pa'i lha mo la bya la de rnams kyi rang bzhin gang la yong ba de mkha' 'gro kun gyi dngos so //
translated: The word “all dakinis” refers to the goddesses Caṇḍālī, etc., and the reality of those is the reality of all dakinis.

original: 'dis 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis mkha' 'gro ma kun gyi 'khor gyis bskor ba la gsungs so zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis mkha' 'gro ma kun gyi 'khor gyis bskor ba la gsungs so zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This teaches that the Bhagavān spoke to the retinue of all dakinis.

original: des ni 'khor phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni 'khor phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the perfection of retinue.

original: bcom ldan 'das de nyid sems can gyi don la nus pa dang ldan pas na sems dpa' yin la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de nyid sems can gyi don la nus pa dang ldan pas na sems dpa' yin la /
translated: The Bhagavān is a hero because he is capable of benefiting sentient beings.

original: mi shes pa'i ri bo bcom pas na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i ri bo bcom pas na rdo rje'o //
translated: He is a vajra because he has destroyed the mountain of ignorance.

original: mi shes pa yang 'dir phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyis shes bya rnams la gzung ba la sogs par mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba'i shes bya'i sgrab pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa yang 'dir phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyis shes bya rnams la gzung ba la sogs par mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba'i shes bya'i sgrab pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Ignorance here is the obscuration of the knowable, which is the clinging to the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields as objects, etc.

original: des na gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni rdo rje ste shes rab bo //
analyzed: des na gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni rdo rje ste shes rab bo //
translated: Thus, the non-dual intuition is the vajra, which is wisdom.

original: mkha' 'gro zhes bya ba'i sprul pa rnams kyis nam mkha' kun du khyab par 'gro bas na mkha' 'gro'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro zhes bya ba'i sprul pa rnams kyis nam mkha' kun du khyab par 'gro bas na mkha' 'gro'o //
translated: The dakinis are the emanations, and since they move through the sky, they are dakinis.

original: sbrul pa yang mkha' 'gro ma'i gzugs kyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: sbrul pa yang mkha' 'gro ma'i gzugs kyi dngos po'o //
translated: The emanations are the entities in the form of dakinis.

original: de ltar na rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhes bya bas thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid du bcom ldan 'das bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar na rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhes bya bas thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid du bcom ldan 'das bstan te /
translated: Thus, by the words “vajra dakini,” the Lord is shown to have the nature of wisdom and means.

original: rdo rje yang yin la mkha' 'gro yang yin pas na /
analyzed: rdo rje yang yin la mkha' 'gro yang yin pas na /
translated: Since he is a vajra and a dakini,

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ste snying rje dang stong pa dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ste snying rje dang stong pa dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: he is a vajra dakini, which means that he has the nature of the spirit of enlightenment, which is the indivisibility of compassion and emptiness.

original: bcom ldan 'das de nyid bde ba'i rang bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir mchog ces gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de nyid bde ba'i rang bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir mchog ces gsungs te /
translated: The word “supreme” is used to show that the Bhagavān is the very nature of bliss.

original: bde ba ni zag pa med pa'i bde ba chen po ste /
analyzed: bde ba ni zag pa med pa'i bde ba chen po ste /
translated: Bliss is the great, uncontaminated bliss.

original: de yang bsgrub par bya ba'i dam pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de yang bsgrub par bya ba'i dam pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: It is also the “highest thing to be accomplished.”

original: 'dir 'gro ba rigs drug po rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba ni bde ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'dir 'gro ba rigs drug po rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba ni bde ba nyid yin te /
translated: Here, the thing to be accomplished by the six classes of beings is bliss.

original: de yang byis pa rnams kyi ni zag pa dang @3b bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang byis pa rnams kyi ni zag pa dang @3b bcas pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, for the childish it is contaminated,

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi ni zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi ni zag pa med pa'o //
translated: but for the āryas it is uncontaminated.

original: de lta mod kyi bde ba'i don du thabs sna tshogs don du gnyer bas bde ba las gzhan ba'i bsgrub par bya ba gzhan yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi bde ba'i don du thabs sna tshogs don du gnyer bas bde ba las gzhan ba'i bsgrub par bya ba gzhan yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Nevertheless, since they pursue various means for the sake of bliss, there is nothing to be accomplished other than bliss.🔽To the extent that something is not bliss, to that extent it is not naturally pure.

original: ji snyed du bde ba min pa de snyed rang bzhin rnam par dag pa yin yang byis pa rnams ji ltar snang bzhin pa la mngon par zhen bas zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ji snyed du bde ba min pa de snyed rang bzhin rnam par dag pa yin yang byis pa rnams ji ltar snang bzhin pa la mngon par zhen bas zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Even though it is naturally pure, because childish beings cling to appearances just as they appear, it is called “contaminated.”

original: bde ba de'i rang bzhin nyid 'di ni zhes bya'o //🔽de yang / bde bas bde ba bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: bde ba de'i rang bzhin nyid 'di ni zhes bya'o // de yang / bde bas bde ba bsgrub par bya //
translated: The nature of that bliss is this.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: And that is stated:🔽Bliss is to be accomplished by bliss.

original: bde bas zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bde bas zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Bliss is the Vajra Holder.

original: bde ba zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'o //🔽de ltar na rtag tu bzhugs zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bde ba zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'o // de ltar na rtag tu bzhugs zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Bliss is the undefiled.

original: bde ba'i mchog ces bya ba'i bar 'dis ston pa po'i khyad par bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba'i mchog ces bya ba'i bar 'dis ston pa po'i khyad par bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the passage from “always present” up to “supreme bliss” teaches the excellence of the teacher’s own and others’ aims.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa nyid de ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa nyid de ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: This is the excellence of one’s own and others’ aims. What is it like?

original: rang byung zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rang byung zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said to be “self-arisen.”

original: rang zhes pa gdul bya rnams kyi rang bzhin de dang de gdul bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang zhes pa gdul bya rnams kyi rang bzhin de dang de gdul bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Self means the nature of those to be trained. It is arisen for the sake of training them.

original: byung zhes pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa sprul pa'i gzugs su byung zhing gsal bar mdzad pas na rang byung ngo //
analyzed: byung zhes pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa sprul pa'i gzugs su byung zhing gsal bar mdzad pas na rang byung ngo //
translated: Arisen means that it arises and manifests in the form of emanations such as Vairocana. Thus it is self-arisen.

original: de yang sems can gcig bu de nyid ni //
analyzed: de yang sems can gcig bu de nyid ni //
translated: Moreover, that very single sentient being

original: rnam pa lnga ru mtshon pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ru mtshon pa yin // zhes gsungs te /
translated: is illustrated in five ways.

original: sems zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'o //
analyzed: sems zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'o //
translated: The mind is the Great Vajradhara.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni de nyid skal ba phun sum tshogs ba drug dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni de nyid skal ba phun sum tshogs ba drug dang ldan pas so //
translated: The Blessed One is so called because he is endowed with the six perfections of good fortune.

original: lhag pa ni lha gcig pu nyid ces bya ba la lus lhag par byin gyis brlabs pas na lhag pa yin la /
analyzed: lhag pa ni lha gcig pu nyid ces bya ba la lus lhag par byin gyis brlabs pas na lhag pa yin la /
translated: The rest is as follows: The one deity is the deity, because the body is blessed as superior.

original: ci rang gi rkyen can du byas pas gsal zhing rig pa dang sprul pa rgyas par byed pas na lha ste /
analyzed: ci rang gi rkyen can du byas pas gsal zhing rig pa dang sprul pa rgyas par byed pas na lha ste /
translated: It is a deity because it is clear and aware by being conditioned by itself and it expands emanations.

original: zhal dang phyag la sogs pa'i rnam par byung ba kun rdzob kyi bden par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhal dang phyag la sogs pa'i rnam par byung ba kun rdzob kyi bden par shes par bya'o //
translated: The appearance of faces, arms, and so forth should be understood as conventional truth.

original: gcig pu nyid ces bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin don dam pa'i bden pas te /
analyzed: gcig pu nyid ces bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin don dam pa'i bden pas te /
translated: The one is the ultimate truth, which is the nature of the dharmadhatu.

original: de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bla mar gyur pas lhag pa'i don nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bla mar gyur pas lhag pa'i don nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, the nature of the inseparability of the conventional and the ultimate is to be seen as the supreme meaning, since it is the guru of all the Tathāgatas.

original: yang na mkha' 'gro kun gyi tshig gis rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: yang na mkha' 'gro kun gyi tshig gis rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa la bya ste /
translated: Or else, the word “all” refers to Vairocana and so forth.

original: de nyid kyis ni rang byung ngo //🔽de yang rang ste rang dang gzhan gyi don phun @4a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni rang byung ngo // de yang rang ste rang dang gzhan gyi don phun @4a * //
translated: He is self-arisen,

original: sum tshogs pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i gzugs su byung zhing bden pa gnyis kyi tshul du //
analyzed: sum tshogs pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i gzugs su byung zhing bden pa gnyis kyi tshul du //
translated: and he is also self, that is, he is arisen in the form of Vairocana and so forth, which is the perfection of one’s own and others’ aims,

original: bcom ldan 'das ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ston par mdzad do //
translated: and the Bhagavān teaches in the manner of the two truths.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bskyed pa'i rim pa'i tshul bstan par bzhed nas 'byung gnas spra tshul zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bskyed pa'i rim pa'i tshul bstan par bzhed nas 'byung gnas spra tshul zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, the Bhagavān, intending to teach the method of the creation stage, declares the manner of the emanation of the source, and so forth.

original: 'dir dngos po thams cad rnam par phye nas bstan pas na 'byung gnas te stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i sems so //
analyzed: 'dir dngos po thams cad rnam par phye nas bstan pas na 'byung gnas te stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i sems so //
translated: Here, since it is taught by analyzing all things, it is the source, the mind of the inseparability of emptiness and compassion.

original: 'byung gnas las zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i don gyi lnga pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung gnas las zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i don gyi lnga pa ste /
translated: The fifth case, the genitive, is expressed as “of the source,” meaning the cause.

original: byang chub kyi sems brtan par byas pa las des 'byung rnams zhes bya par 'brel to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems brtan par byas pa las des 'byung rnams zhes bya par 'brel to //
translated: From the stabilization of the mind of enlightenment, “the elements that arise from that” are connected.

original: de ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ci zhig ce na /
translated: What are they?

original: sgra tshul zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sgra tshul zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “sound, mode, and so on.”

original: sgra ni sgrar grag pa'i rang bzhin gang dag yin pa rnams te /
analyzed: sgra ni sgrar grag pa'i rang bzhin gang dag yin pa rnams te /
translated: Sound is that which is naturally heard as sound,

original: aa la sogs pa dang / ka la sogs pa dang / gzhan yang sngags rnams so //
analyzed: aa la sogs pa dang / ka la sogs pa dang / gzhan yang sngags rnams so //
translated: such as the vowels and consonants, and also the mantras.

original: dam tshig ni zla ba gnyis so //
analyzed: dam tshig ni zla ba gnyis so //
translated: The pledge is the two moons.

original: spyod pa ni sa bon no //
analyzed: spyod pa ni sa bon no //
translated: The conduct is the seed.

original: spyod yul ni mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: spyod yul ni mtshan ma'o //
translated: The object field is the sign.

original: de dag nges par 'byung zhes bya bar sbyar te //
analyzed: de dag nges par 'byung zhes bya bar sbyar te //
translated: They are connected with “arise from that.”

original: rnam pa sna tshogs kyi tshul gyis des par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs kyi tshul gyis des par 'byung ba ste /
translated: They arise in various modes,

original: bsgom pa dang bzlas pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa dang bzlas pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: up to “meditation and recitation.”

original: 'dis 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dis 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what it teaches.

original: sangs rgyas dang bla ma'i mchod pa sngon du 'gro bas 'di ltar /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang bla ma'i mchod pa sngon du 'gro bas 'di ltar /
translated: Having first made offerings to the Buddha and the guru, one should do this.

original: 'gro kun sems kyi sprul pa ste //
analyzed: 'gro kun sems kyi sprul pa ste //
translated: All beings are emanations of mind;

original: sems las gzhan du yod ma yin //
analyzed: sems las gzhan du yod ma yin //
translated: they do not exist apart from mind.

original: zhes bya ba 'di'i don yid la byas pas chos thams cad bdag med par bsgoms la /🔽aa nu tpanna sarba dharma: pra kri ti pra bh'a sva da:sarba dha rmma:/
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di'i don yid la byas pas chos thams cad bdag med par bsgoms la / aa nu tpanna sarba dharma: pra kri ti pra bh'a sva da:sarba dha rmma:/
translated: Having contemplated the meaning of this, one should meditate on the selflessness of all phenomena.

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod nas /
translated: Reciting the mantra “anutpannāḥ sarvadharmāḥ, prakṛtiparinirvṛtāḥ sarvadharmāḥ,”

original: sems de nyid zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par bsgoms la /
analyzed: sems de nyid zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par bsgoms la /
translated: one should meditate on that very mind in the aspect of a moon disc.

original: aom tsitta pra ti be dham ka ro mi /
analyzed: aom tsitta pra ti be dham ka ro mi /
translated: Reciting the mantra “oṃ cittaprativedhaṃ karomi,”

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod par bya'o //
translated: one should recite the mantra.

original: de nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor der sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan aa la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis zhugs par bsgoms la yang 'od zer gyis bskul te /
analyzed: de nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor der sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan aa la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis zhugs par bsgoms la yang 'od zer gyis bskul te /
translated: Then, in that moon disc, one should meditate on the qualities of all the buddhas in the form of the letters a and so forth entering into it.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs rnams skar mda' 'phro ba'i tshul du zhugs par bsgoms nas slar yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa bsgoms te /🔽aom po dhi tsatti autpa da y'a mi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs rnams skar mda' 'phro ba'i tshul du zhugs par bsgoms nas slar yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa bsgoms te / aom po dhi tsatti autpa da y'a mi /
translated: Having meditated on the assembly of Tathagatas entering like a shooting star, again meditate on a second moon disk.

original: zhes bya'i sngags brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya'i sngags brjod par bya'o //
translated: Recite the mantra:🔽Om bodhicitta utpadyâmi.

original: de nas der ka la sogs pa'i yi ge de bzhin @4b bsams la /
analyzed: de nas der ka la sogs pa'i yi ge de bzhin @4b bsams la /
translated: Then, having contemplated the letters ka and so forth in the same way,

original: de'i steng du bdag nyid sa bon las mtshan ma'i gzugs su bsgoms te /🔽aom tishtha badzra /
analyzed: de'i steng du bdag nyid sa bon las mtshan ma'i gzugs su bsgoms te / aom tishtha badzra /
translated: on top of that, meditate on one's own seed as the form of a symbol.🔽Recite:

original: zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Om tistha vajra.

original: de nas slar yang spro ba dang bsdu ba sngon du 'gro bas /🔽aom badzra a'a tma ko& ham /
analyzed: de nas slar yang spro ba dang bsdu ba sngon du 'gro bas / aom badzra a'a tma ko& ham /
translated: Then, again, having previously emanated and reabsorbed,🔽recite the pride mantra:

original: zhes bya ba'i nga rgyal bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i nga rgyal bya ste /
translated: Om vajra-atmako 'ham.

original: zla ba la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa las rang gi lhar bsgoms la /
analyzed: zla ba la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa las rang gi lhar bsgoms la /
translated: Having meditated on one's own deity from the transformation of the moon and so forth,🔽recite:

original: aom ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta sta th'a a'a ham /
analyzed: aom ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta sta th'a a'a ham /
translated: Om yatha sarva-tathagata-stuttha-ahm.

original: zhes brjod pa 'di ni mngon par byang chub pa lngas bcom ldan 'das kyi skur bsgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa 'di ni mngon par byang chub pa lngas bcom ldan 'das kyi skur bsgrub pa bstan to //
translated: This statement teaches the accomplishment of the Bhagavat's body by means of the five manifest enlightenments.

original: 'jig rten gsum du rnyed par dka' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum du rnyed par dka' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Difficult to find in the three worlds, etc.

original: rnyed dka' ba zhes bya ba ni de lta bur gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: rnyed dka' ba zhes bya ba ni de lta bur gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: Difficult to find means the Bhagavat who is such.

original: gang nas she na /
analyzed: gang nas she na /
translated: Where?

original: 'jig rten gsum nas te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum nas te /
translated: In the three worlds,

original: seng ge dang 'phrog byed dang / dbyig gi snying po zhes bya ba ming gi rnam grangs gzhan 'dod pa la sogs pa dag las /
analyzed: seng ge dang 'phrog byed dang / dbyig gi snying po zhes bya ba ming gi rnam grangs gzhan 'dod pa la sogs pa dag las /
translated: in the other names of the lion, the thief, and the essence of wealth, in the desires, etc.

original: de yang seng ge 'dod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de yang seng ge 'dod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: And that is the lion of desire.

original: 'phrog byed sems zhes bya bar grags //
analyzed: 'phrog byed sems zhes bya bar grags //
translated: The thief is known as the mind.

original: tshangs pa grol ba rab tu bshad //
analyzed: tshangs pa grol ba rab tu bshad //
translated: Brahma is said to be liberation.

original: 'di dag 'jig rten gsum zhes brjod //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di dag 'jig rten gsum zhes brjod // ces gsungs so //
translated: These are called the three worlds.

original: pho'i don la ma ning gi rtags su gsungs pa ni lung ste /
analyzed: pho'i don la ma ning gi rtags su gsungs pa ni lung ste /
translated: The statement of the neuter sign for the meaning of male is the scripture.

original: 'dzem pa med pas so //
analyzed: 'dzem pa med pas so //
translated: Because of the absence of shame.

original: yang na / bud med chags pa skyes pa sdang // gnyis ka spangs pa gti mug go //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa phyed po 'di dang sbyar te /
analyzed: yang na / bud med chags pa skyes pa sdang // gnyis ka spangs pa gti mug go // zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa phyed po 'di dang sbyar te /
translated: and the abandonment of both is confusion.”

original: 'di'i don ni //🔽chags pa rnam dag bud med de //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni // chags pa rnam dag bud med de //
translated: The meaning of this is explained as follows:🔽“Women are pure objects of attachment,

original: sdang ba de bzhin skyes pa yin //
analyzed: sdang ba de bzhin skyes pa yin //
translated: men are objects of aversion,

original: gnyis ka spangs pa gti mug go //🔽zhes bya bas bshad la /
analyzed: gnyis ka spangs pa gti mug go // zhes bya bas bshad la /
translated: and the abandonment of both is confusion.”

original: de lta bu'i khyad par can gyi sems ni 'dod pa yin te /🔽de yang / chags sdang gti mug ldan pa yi //🔽sems ni 'dod par rab tu bshad //
analyzed: de lta bu'i khyad par can gyi sems ni 'dod pa yin te / de yang / chags sdang gti mug ldan pa yi // sems ni 'dod par rab tu bshad //
translated: Such a special mind is desire.

original: ces gsungs la /
analyzed: ces gsungs la /
translated: And it is said:🔽“A mind endowed with attachment, aversion, and confusion🔽is well known as desire.”

original: de lta bu'i khyad par can gyi sems ni blta bar bya bas na 'jig rten no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i khyad par can gyi sems ni blta bar bya bas na 'jig rten no //
translated: Such a special mind is the world, because it is that which sees.

original: gnyis pa ni 'dis sems can gyi don la blta zhing dmigs pas na 'jig rten te snying rje'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'dis sems can gyi don la blta zhing dmigs pas na 'jig rten te snying rje'o //
translated: The second is the world as the object of seeing, because it is that which sees and observes the welfare of sentient beings. It is compassion.

original: gsum pa ni bcom zhing zhig pas na 'jig rten te chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: gsum pa ni bcom zhing zhig pas na 'jig rten te chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The third is the world as destruction, because it is destroyed and disintegrates. It is the dharma-dhātu.

original: ji ltar na bcom pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bcom pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it destroyed?

original: 'dir chos thams cad gcig dang du ma dang bral bas ngo bo nyid med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir chos thams cad gcig dang du ma dang bral bas ngo bo nyid med par gyur pa'o //
translated: Here, all phenomena are devoid of intrinsic reality because they are free from being one or many.

original: de'i tshe 'jig rten gsum po de dag nyid rnyed par dka' ba'o zhes gong du 'dud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'jig rten gsum po de dag nyid rnyed par dka' ba'o zhes gong du 'dud pa'o //
translated: At that time, those three worlds are difficult to attain, as stated above.

original: @5a * // 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das rang rig pa tsam du bstan te //
analyzed: @5a * // 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das rang rig pa tsam du bstan te //
translated: This shows the Blessed One as mere self-awareness.🔽And that is stated:

original: de yang / rtag tu 'dod pa bsten par bya //
analyzed: de yang / rtag tu 'dod pa bsten par bya //
translated: Always rely on desire.

original: chu yi mchog ni 'thungs nas su //
analyzed: chu yi mchog ni 'thungs nas su //
translated: Having drunk the supreme water,

original: chos min pas ni chos bstan bya //
analyzed: chos min pas ni chos bstan bya //
translated: teach the Dharma with non-Dharma.

original: skyes pa bud med brtul zhugs yin //
analyzed: skyes pa bud med brtul zhugs yin //
translated: The vow of a man is a woman.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: yang na rim pa gzhan du bsgyur ba'i bdun pa ste /
analyzed: yang na rim pa gzhan du bsgyur ba'i bdun pa ste /
translated: Or, in another sequence, the seventh:

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams bcom pas na 'jig rten te /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams bcom pas na 'jig rten te /
translated: The world is that which has conquered the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: sku rdo rje la sogs pa gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi bcom ldan 'das de nyid 'jig rten no //
analyzed: sku rdo rje la sogs pa gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi bcom ldan 'das de nyid 'jig rten no //
translated: That very Blessed One, whose nature is the three vajras beginning with the vajra body, is the world.

original: rnyed dka' pa ni sla bar rnyed pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed dka' pa ni sla bar rnyed pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Difficult to attain means not easily attained.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul bcom pa ni rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa yin la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul bcom pa ni rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa yin la /
translated: The object such as form is destroyed, that is, completely abandoned.

original: des ji ltar na sku la sogs pa rdo rje lta bur thob par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des ji ltar na sku la sogs pa rdo rje lta bur thob par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that one attains the vajra-like body, etc.?

original: smras pa / 'dir bcom pa ni sbyang ba byas pa yin gyi //
analyzed: smras pa / 'dir bcom pa ni sbyang ba byas pa yin gyi //
translated: It is said: Here, destruction is the purification,

original: rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa ma yin te /
translated: not the complete abandonment.

original: de bas na dka' ba'i sgras dgag pa ma yin pa'i dka' ba nyid la bya bar blta'o //
analyzed: de bas na dka' ba'i sgras dgag pa ma yin pa'i dka' ba nyid la bya bar blta'o //
translated: Therefore, the word “difficult” should be seen as referring to the difficulty of the non-negation.

original: thog ma dbus mthar yang dag gnas //
analyzed: thog ma dbus mthar yang dag gnas //
translated: It abides in the beginning, middle, and end.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: thog ma la sogs pa'i sgras skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa gcig dang / gnyis dang / mang po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: thog ma la sogs pa'i sgras skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa gcig dang / gnyis dang / mang po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang du 'jug pa ste /
translated: the words “beginning, etc.” refer to the characteristics of arising, enduring, and ceasing, whether singly, doubly, or in the plural, etc.

original: de dag rang bzhin gyis rtag pas na gnas skabs gsum po de dag mthar gtugs shing bstan par gnas pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag rang bzhin gyis rtag pas na gnas skabs gsum po de dag mthar gtugs shing bstan par gnas pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Since those are essentially permanent, they are said to abide in the ultimate, having reached the end of those three states.

original: yang dag gnas zhes bya ba ni thog ma la sogs pa de dag yang dag pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag gnas zhes bya ba ni thog ma la sogs pa de dag yang dag pa ste /
translated: The phrase “in the perfect state” refers to those beginning and so forth that are perfect,

original: rang bzhin gyis brtan par ston pa'i tshig gi phrad do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis brtan par ston pa'i tshig gi phrad do //
translated: that is, naturally firm.

original: thams cad du khyad par du bya ba'i bcom ldan 'das de nyid dbu ma'i don rtogs pas khyad par du gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir 'dod chags ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: thams cad du khyad par du bya ba'i bcom ldan 'das de nyid dbu ma'i don rtogs pas khyad par du gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir 'dod chags ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the Blessed One, who is to be distinguished from all others, is distinguished by his realization of the meaning of the middle way, the root text declares, “He is neither passion nor dispassion,” and so forth.

original: de la 'dod chags ni 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags ni 'khor ba'o //
translated: Here, passion refers to saṃsāra,

original: chags bral ni mya ngan las 'das ba ste /
analyzed: chags bral ni mya ngan las 'das ba ste /
translated: while dispassion refers to nirvāṇa.

original: de dag mi dmigs so zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag mi dmigs so zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “he is neither” should be applied to both of them.

original: dbu ma zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang / chags bral las grol ba yang dngos por dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbu ma zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang / chags bral las grol ba yang dngos por dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The term “middle way” means that neither passion nor dispassion can be apprehended as a real entity.

original: de dag gis bcom ldan 'das dbu ma'i lam thugs su chud par bstan te /
analyzed: de dag gis bcom ldan 'das dbu ma'i lam thugs su chud par bstan te /
translated: These passages demonstrate that the Blessed One has realized the middle way.

original: de lta bu'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid ni brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid ni brjod par bya'o //
translated: It is this kind of Blessed One, the one who is Vajradhara, that is to be described.

original: da ni bcom @5b ldan 'das kyis ji ltar thugs su chud pa'i de kho na nyid kyi shes rab rgyud 'di la gtso bo yin pa dang / de nyid bud med kyi gzugs kyis khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir bud med kun gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni bcom @5b ldan 'das kyis ji ltar thugs su chud pa'i de kho na nyid kyi shes rab rgyud 'di la gtso bo yin pa dang / de nyid bud med kyi gzugs kyis khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir bud med kun gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the wisdom of reality, which the Lord has realized, as the principal matter of this tantra, and in order to realize that very [wisdom] through the form of a woman, [the Bhagavān] declares, “all women,” and so forth.

original: bud med kun ni lha mo thams cad do //
analyzed: bud med kun ni lha mo thams cad do //
translated: “ All women” are all goddesses.

original: de dag gi sgyu ma ni rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de dag gi sgyu ma ni rang bzhin te /
translated: Their “illusion” is their nature.

original: rang bzhin der sprul ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin der sprul ba'o //
translated: That nature is emanated.

original: de dag nyid kyis brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i 'gro ba kun la 'debs pas na brgya ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyis brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i 'gro ba kun la 'debs pas na brgya ste /
translated: They are “a hundred” because they are planted in all the moving and unmoving world.

original: rigs kyis na mang po la gcig gi tshig tu byas pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyis na mang po la gcig gi tshig tu byas pa yin no //
translated: The suffix “-tva” [in śat-tva] is used in the sense of a multitude.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rab tu grags par zad do //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rab tu grags par zad do //
translated: “ This” is well known.

original: de dag gis bcom ldan 'das de nyid bde bas bde ba chen po sgrub cing rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bud med kyi gzugs su sprul par ston to //
analyzed: de dag gis bcom ldan 'das de nyid bde bas bde ba chen po sgrub cing rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bud med kyi gzugs su sprul par ston to //
translated: They demonstrate that very Lord, through the form of a woman, in order to accomplish and realize great bliss through bliss.

original: bud med kun gyi sgyu ma'i phyag rgya de nyid kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i tshul gyi phyag rgya dbyer med pa ni gnyis med de de nyid phul du byung ba'i ye shes pas na ye shes mchog go //
analyzed: bud med kun gyi sgyu ma'i phyag rgya de nyid kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i tshul gyi phyag rgya dbyer med pa ni gnyis med de de nyid phul du byung ba'i ye shes pas na ye shes mchog go //
translated: The illusory seal of all women is the indivisible seal of the relative and ultimate, which is nondual. Since that is the supreme intuition, it is the supreme intuition.

original: rnyed dang bde ba kun mos pas //
analyzed: rnyed dang bde ba kun mos pas //
translated: By the devotion of all gain and bliss,

original: zhes bya ba la rnyed pa la sogs pas 'grub par 'gyur zhes bar sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rnyed pa la sogs pas 'grub par 'gyur zhes bar sbyar te /
translated: one will accomplish it.

original: ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How will one accomplish it?🔽By the devotion of all,

original: kun mos pas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: kun mos pas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said.

original: kun ni phung po'o //
analyzed: kun ni phung po'o //
translated: All refers to the aggregates.

original: de rnams de kho na nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin du /
analyzed: de rnams de kho na nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin du /
translated: Those are the nature of the intuition of reality.

original: rnyed pa de ni rnyed pa kun te /
analyzed: rnyed pa de ni rnyed pa kun te /
translated: That gain is the gain of all.

original: des yid bde bar gyur pa de ni bde la'o //
analyzed: des yid bde bar gyur pa de ni bde la'o //
translated: By that, the mental bliss is the bliss.

original: mos pa ni phul du byung ba ste /
analyzed: mos pa ni phul du byung ba ste /
translated: Devotion is the supreme.

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi snyoms par zhugs pas kun du bcings pa'i rgyu las gang thob pa'i bla ma'i yang bla mar 'gyur ba'i bde ba chen pos 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi snyoms par zhugs pas kun du bcings pa'i rgyu las gang thob pa'i bla ma'i yang bla mar 'gyur ba'i bde ba chen pos 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that one should attain the great bliss that is the guru of the guru, which is attained from the cause of the complete binding of the union of wisdom and means.

original: su zhig ce na /
analyzed: su zhig ce na /
translated: Who?

original: dan par spyod pa zhes bya ba la smad bas na ngan pa ste nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dan par spyod pa zhes bya ba la smad bas na ngan pa ste nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: Bad conduct is bad, that is, the afflictions.

original: de dag bod pa ni ngan par sbyod pa ste /
analyzed: de dag bod pa ni ngan par sbyod pa ste /
translated: The one who has that is of bad conduct.

original: sgrub pa po gang gi rang bzhin nyon mongs pa bod ba yin kyang de dag la rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis don dam pa'i ye shes kyi dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa po gang gi rang bzhin nyon mongs pa bod ba yin kyang de dag la rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis don dam pa'i ye shes kyi dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Even though the nature of the practitioner is bad conduct, the yoginīs will grant the spiritual power of ultimate wisdom to them.

original: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rnal 'byor ma rnams la yang de dag gis don dam pa'i ye shes ster bar 'gyur ro zhes blta bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rnal 'byor ma rnams la yang de dag gis don dam pa'i ye shes ster bar 'gyur ro zhes blta bar bya ba ste /
translated: The word also should be viewed as meaning that they will also grant ultimate wisdom to the yoginīs.

original: de ltar na lam 'de skyes pa dang / bud med dag kyang tshegs med par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de ltar na lam 'de skyes pa dang / bud med dag kyang tshegs med par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Thus, it is considered that the path is accomplished without difficulty by men and women.

original: @6a * // lha mo rnams kyi tha snyad gzhan gyi sgo nas de kho na nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir nam mkha' kun du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: @6a * // lha mo rnams kyi tha snyad gzhan gyi sgo nas de kho na nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir nam mkha' kun du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach reality by means of another convention of the goddesses, [the Bhagavān] declares, the sky, etc.

original: de la kun ni dngos grub kyi rdzas thams cad la bya la de rnams kyis skabs 'byed pas na nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: de la kun ni dngos grub kyi rdzas thams cad la bya la de rnams kyis skabs 'byed pas na nam mkha' ste /
translated: There, the sky is the opening of all the substances of powers, and it is the sky because they open it.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba drug go //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba drug go //
translated: The sky-farers are the six wheel-holders such as Vairochana.

original: rgyu ba ni de rnams dang lhan cig tu spyod pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu ba ni de rnams dang lhan cig tu spyod pa ste /
translated: The movements are the conduct together with them.

original: de rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba la de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba la de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is to be accomplished by them is so called.

original: rigs kyis na gcig gi tshig tu blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: rigs kyis na gcig gi tshig tu blta bar bya ste /
translated: The suffix -i should be seen as a singular particle.

original: 'di dag nyid grub mthar 'dren pas na dngos grub yin la des na mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: 'di dag nyid grub mthar 'dren pas na dngos grub yin la des na mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: Since they lead to the culmination of attainment, they are powers, and thus they are dakinis.

original: yang na mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya ba ni gang dag gi rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyis khyab par 'gro ba'i dang tshul can de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: yang na mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya ba ni gang dag gi rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyis khyab par 'gro ba'i dang tshul can de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Or, “dakini” is so called because of the mode of going of those whose nature is pervaded by emptiness.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i par du'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i par du'o //
translated: Up to “the nature of the perfection of wisdom.”

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: de ni nam mkha' 'gro ma zhes //
analyzed: de ni nam mkha' 'gro ma zhes //
translated: She is called a sky-goer,

original: khams las 'dir ni brtags pa'o //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: khams las 'dir ni brtags pa'o // zhes gsungs te /
translated: imagined here from the elements.

original: des na nam mkhar 'gro ma zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid du bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na nam mkhar 'gro ma zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid du bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, “sky-goer” is to be taken as having the nature of emptiness.

original: de yang gzung ba la sogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa las bzlog ste /
analyzed: de yang gzung ba la sogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa las bzlog ste /
translated: Moreover, it is to be taken as the reversal of the clinging to apprehended objects, etc.

original: yang dag par 'gro ba de la de skad ces bya ba ni mkha' 'gro ma zhes grags pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par 'gro ba de la de skad ces bya ba ni mkha' 'gro ma zhes grags pa ste /
translated: That correct going is so called, and is known as a dakini.

original: rnam par sgra bshad pa bsgyur ba med pas grags pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: rnam par sgra bshad pa bsgyur ba med pas grags pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: It is a well-known term, since it is a transformation of the etymological explanation.

original: kha cig ni brda 'di ni tha mal pa'i bud med rnams kyi yin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni brda 'di ni tha mal pa'i bud med rnams kyi yin te /
translated: Some say this sign is of ordinary women,

original: de'i tshe rab tu grags zhes bya ba la rab tu zhes pa ni de lta nyid du grags zhes bya ba thabs dang bcas pas dngos grub tu 'gro ba de la de skad ces bya ste /🔽des na / mkha' 'gro ma zhes rab tu grags //
analyzed: de'i tshe rab tu grags zhes bya ba la rab tu zhes pa ni de lta nyid du grags zhes bya ba thabs dang bcas pas dngos grub tu 'gro ba de la de skad ces bya ste / des na / mkha' 'gro ma zhes rab tu grags //
translated: At that time, “well known” means “well known just as it is” by means of the method, and that is what is called “accomplishment.”🔽Therefore, it is the thought that

original: zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes zer ro //
translated: she is well known as a dakini.

original: sna tshogs kun du zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa phyogs bcu kun na gnas pa'i chos rnams la phyag rgyas 'debs pas na sna tshogs kun du phyag rgya ste lha mo rnams so //
analyzed: sna tshogs kun du zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa phyogs bcu kun na gnas pa'i chos rnams la phyag rgyas 'debs pas na sna tshogs kun du phyag rgya ste lha mo rnams so //
translated: “Various” means “all,” and “seals” means “seals all phenomena that exist in the ten directions, such as the aggregates.”

original: des 'di skad du rab tu gtum mo la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams /
analyzed: des 'di skad du rab tu gtum mo la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams /
translated: Thus, the goddesses are the various all-seals.🔽This teaches that the goddesses such as Caṇḍālī

original: 'khor los sgyur ba drug gi rim gyis blta bar bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba drug gi rim gyis blta bar bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: should be viewed in the sequence of the six wheel-turning goddesses.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni spags pa ste /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni spags pa ste /
translated: “Indeed” means “surely.”

original: tha mal pa'i bu mo rnams lha mo'i gzugs kyis khyad par du bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i bu mo rnams lha mo'i gzugs kyis khyad par du bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The ordinary girls are distinguished by the form of the goddesses.

original: thabs rnams ma gtogs par mkha' @6b 'gro ma rnams kyis 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir sna tshogs kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: thabs rnams ma gtogs par mkha' @6b 'gro ma rnams kyis 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir sna tshogs kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach that without the means, the dakinis will not be accomplished, he says the various all, etc.

original: kun gyis zhes bya ba ni cho ga khyad par can rnams kyis rnal 'byor pa 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: kun gyis zhes bya ba ni cho ga khyad par can rnams kyis rnal 'byor pa 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: All means the yogi will be accomplished by the special rites.

original: ji lta bu zhig gis she na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: sna tshogs kyis te /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyis te /
translated: By the various.

original: gzugs la sogs pa nye bar spyod pa sna tshogs kyis rnal 'byor pa lus dang sems bde ba chen por 'grub ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nye bar spyod pa sna tshogs kyis rnal 'byor pa lus dang sems bde ba chen por 'grub ba'o //
translated: By the various enjoyments of form, etc., the yogi will be accomplished in the great bliss of body and mind.

original: ji lta bur gyur nas she na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur nas she na /
translated: In what way?

original: mkha' 'gro kun dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro kun dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: By the union with all the dakinis, etc.

original: mkha' 'gro ma kun ni 'khor los sgyur ba drug gi dkyil 'khor pa'i lha mo rnams so //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma kun ni 'khor los sgyur ba drug gi dkyil 'khor pa'i lha mo rnams so //
translated: All dakinis are the goddesses of the mandala of the six charioteers.

original: mnyam par sbyor ba ni de rnams dang lhan cig yang dag par sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: mnyam par sbyor ba ni de rnams dang lhan cig yang dag par sbyor ba ste /
translated: Union is the true union with them.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro gang la mnyam par sbyor pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro gang la mnyam par sbyor pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He who is united with the Vajra dakini is so-called.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ni nye par mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ni nye par mtshon pa ste /
translated: The Vajra dakini is an example,

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa la sogs pa gzhan yang rang rang gi 'khor gyi mkha' 'gro ma'i tshogs dang lhan cig tu 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa la sogs pa gzhan yang rang rang gi 'khor gyi mkha' 'gro ma'i tshogs dang lhan cig tu 'grub pa ste /
translated: and the Vajra Holder and others are also accomplished together with the host of their own retinue dakinis,

original: bdag nyid rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and they are perfected.

original: da ni phyi rol du dmigs pa la sogs pa bya ba'i rgyud kyi cho gas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub grub pa med pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni phyi rol du dmigs pa la sogs pa bya ba'i rgyud kyi cho gas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub grub pa med pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that there is no accomplishment of the Great Seal through the ritual of Action Tantra, which has external observation, etc.,

original: de nyid med sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid med sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “without the mind of reality,” and so on.

original: de kho na nyid ni don dam par stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni don dam par stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Reality is the nature of the inseparability of emptiness and compassion in the ultimate sense.

original: de med pa ni de las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: de med pa ni de las bzlog pa ste /
translated: Without that is the opposite of that,

original: gzung ba la sogs par mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba la sogs par mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: which is the adherence to the object, etc.

original: sems ni gnas te gang la spyod yul de yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sems ni gnas te gang la spyod yul de yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The mind is the abode, and he who has that sphere is so-called.

original: rnal 'byor ni ting nge 'dzin te sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni ting nge 'dzin te sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: Yoga is meditative concentration, the one-pointed mind.

original: de ltar na rnal 'byor pa gang rnams kyi sems la de kho na nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin med pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rnal 'byor pa gang rnams kyi sems la de kho na nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin med pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is said of those yogis whose minds lack the meditative concentration of reality.

original: lha ni 'dod pa'i lha ste /
analyzed: lha ni 'dod pa'i lha ste /
translated: The god is the god of the desire realm.

original: de dmigs pa ni sems kyis bkod pa'o //
analyzed: de dmigs pa ni sems kyis bkod pa'o //
translated: His image is the mental creation.

original: byed pa ni der 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa ni der 'dod pa'o //
translated: The action is the desire for that.

original: kun du gzugs pa brnyan zhes bya ba la rang gi gzugs dang 'dra ba gzhan ni gzugs brnyan te /
analyzed: kun du gzugs pa brnyan zhes bya ba la rang gi gzugs dang 'dra ba gzhan ni gzugs brnyan te /
translated: The reflection is the other that is similar to one's own form.

original: de'i rang bzhin gyi rnal 'byor zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyi rnal 'byor zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The yoga of that nature is to be supplied.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: lugs ma la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lugs ma la sogs pa ste /
translated: The statue, etc.

original: lugs ma dang bris pa dang brdungs ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lugs ma dang bris pa dang brdungs ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: The statue, the painting, the bas-relief, etc.

original: skye ba min zhes bya ba ni de dag gis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'grub par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba min zhes bya ba ni de dag gis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'grub par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The non-arising is that they do not accomplish the Great Seal.

original: 'o na @7a * //
analyzed: 'o na @7a * //
translated: Well then,

original: gang gis 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: by what are they accomplished?

original: byang chub sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse states, the spirit of enlightenment, etc.

original: rang gi lha'i gzugs kyis phyag rgya chen po rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi lha'i gzugs kyis phyag rgya chen po rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: By means of one's own deity-form, the Great Seal is perfected.

original: de nyid gsungs par byang chub sems zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs par byang chub sems zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That itself is stated in the line, the mind called enlightenment spirit.

original: stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i sems ni byang chub sems so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i sems ni byang chub sems so //
translated: The mind of nondual emptiness and compassion is the enlightenment spirit.

original: de nyid lhar sbyor ba'i thabs chen po ste /
analyzed: de nyid lhar sbyor ba'i thabs chen po ste /
translated: That itself is the great means of deity yoga.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems chen rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems chen rnal 'byor ro //
translated: This is the yoga of the great enlightenment spirit.

original: der gtso bor gyur pas na dbang phyug ste gnyis su med pa'i ye shes yin la lhag par dbang bas na gtso bo'o //
analyzed: der gtso bor gyur pas na dbang phyug ste gnyis su med pa'i ye shes yin la lhag par dbang bas na gtso bo'o //
translated: Since it is the principal one, it is the lord, which is nondual intuition. Since it is especially powerful, it is the chief.

original: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rang nyid ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rang nyid ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: One's own is stated.

original: bdag nyid kho na stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin gyi lha'i gzugs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag nyid kho na stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin gyi lha'i gzugs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One's own deity-form, which is the nature of the enlightenment spirit of nondual emptiness and compassion, is to be perfected. This is the meaning of the verse.

original: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub kyi sems sngon du 'gro ba'i lha'i gzugs bsgom par bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub kyi sems sngon du 'gro ba'i lha'i gzugs bsgom par bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that one should cultivate the deity-form preceded by the enlightenment spirit.

original: de nyid gsal par bstan pa'i phyir byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid gsal par bstan pa'i phyir byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to clearly demonstrate just that, he declares, “vajra of enlightenment,” etc.

original: ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid pas na rdo rje yang yin la /
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid pas na rdo rje yang yin la /
translated: Since he is the nature of the five intuitions, he is a vajra, and

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyang yin te /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyang yin te /
translated: he is also all the Buddhas, Vairochana, etc.

original: de rnams ni me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams ni me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the nature of the enlightenment intuition, the mirror-like intuition, etc.

original: 'gro ba'i rtsa lag ces bya ba ni rtsa lag ltar bstan pa dang g-yo ba sna tshogs la khyab par sprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rtsa lag ces bya ba ni rtsa lag ltar bstan pa dang g-yo ba sna tshogs la khyab par sprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis 'gro ba ste /
translated: “ Kinsman of the world” means that he is a kinsman, as it were, and he is the world, since he pervades the various migrations with various emanations.

original: de nyid mchod par bya zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de nyid mchod par bya zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: This is connected with “he is to be worshipped.”

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das nyid rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i gzugs de dang des bdag dang gzhan gyi don la nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das nyid rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i gzugs de dang des bdag dang gzhan gyi don la nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Therefore” means that the Lord himself, by means of that form of Vairochana, etc., is capable of the aims of self and other.

original: 'bad pa thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni yun ring du gus pa dang bcas pas goms pas so //
analyzed: 'bad pa thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni yun ring du gus pa dang bcas pas goms pas so //
translated: By all efforts means by long-term cultivation with devotion.

original: mchod par bya zhes bya ba ni mngon du bya pa'o //
analyzed: mchod par bya zhes bya ba ni mngon du bya pa'o //
translated: Worship means to actualize.

original: de dag gis ni 'di skad du de lta bur gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das ni brjod par bya ba yin la brjod par bya ba shes nas mngon sum du byed pa ni dgos pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'di skad du de lta bur gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das ni brjod par bya ba yin la brjod par bya ba shes nas mngon sum du byed pa ni dgos pa yin te /
translated: They teach this: the Blessed One, who is such, is to be expressed; and having understood what is to be expressed, its actualization is the purpose.

original: de mngon sum du byas pa las bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i dngos grub ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de mngon sum du byas pa las bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i dngos grub ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: From that actualization, the power of the perfection of one's own and others' goals is the ultimate purpose.

original: de nyid gsal bar @7b bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar @7b bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clearly teach just that, he says:

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: One's own and so on.

original: dngos po thams cad rtogs pas na sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad rtogs pas na sangs rgyas so //
translated: Buddha means realizing all things.

original: phyin ci ma log par grub pas na dpa' bo ste /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par grub pas na dpa' bo ste /
translated: Hero means accomplishing without error.

original: gang gi ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: gang gi ci zhig ce na /
translated: What of whom?

original: rang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: One's own and so on.

original: de ltar na bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar na bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the meaning is that one should accomplish oneself by oneself.

original: des ni bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: des ni bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the perfection of one's own aim,

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa gsungs pa 'di yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa gsungs pa 'di yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he states the perfection of others' aims, saying by this... and so on.

original: brjod par bya ba la sogs pa mngon sum du byas pa 'di yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba la sogs pa mngon sum du byas pa 'di yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This refers to the actualization of the object of expression and so on.

original: gsang pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don 'di dag gi khyad par gzhan ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi le'u bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis pa las gsal bar ston par mdzad la de nyid du bdag gis kyang slar bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gsang pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don 'di dag gi khyad par gzhan ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi le'u bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis pa las gsal bar ston par mdzad la de nyid du bdag gis kyang slar bshad par bya'o //
translated: The other distinctions of these meanings such as secret and so on are clearly taught by the Blessed One himself in the forty-second chapter, and I will explain them again there.

original: brjod par bya ba la sogs pa de dag ni bcom ldan 'das nyid mngon par bzhed pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir sdud pa pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba la sogs pa de dag ni bcom ldan 'das nyid mngon par bzhed pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir sdud pa pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to show that those objects of expression and so on are indeed the intention of the Blessed One himself, he says the compiler... and so on.

original: brjod par bya ba la sogs pa de skad ces gsungs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba la sogs pa de skad ces gsungs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: Thus have I spoken about the topics to be expressed and so forth.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
translated: The one called Vajrasattva, the Tathagata,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'chad pa po phyin ci ma log pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'chad pa po phyin ci ma log pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid du ston to //
translated: Here, the one who explains is shown to be the very Vajradhara who possesses unerring wisdom.

original: da ni rgyud kyi brjod par bya ba'i don gyi rab tu dbye ba shes rab kyi cha bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rgyud kyi brjod par bya ba'i don gyi rab tu dbye ba shes rab kyi cha bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the division of the meaning to be expressed in the tantra, the part of wisdom,

original: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said all and so forth.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni gang gi mtshan nyid rang bzhin med pa'i dang tshul can de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni gang gi mtshan nyid rang bzhin med pa'i dang tshul can de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Space is so-called because it has the characteristic of being devoid of inherent nature.

original: gang dag gi zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag gi zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: thams cad ces bya ba ste phung po la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ste phung po la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: It is all the aggregates and so forth.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' thogs par byed pa'i reg bya dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid tsam yin pas na mtshan nyid med pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' thogs par byed pa'i reg bya dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid tsam yin pas na mtshan nyid med pa yin te /
translated: Just as space is characterized by being free from the tangible object of obstruction, it is without characteristics.

original: ming tsam du kun du btags pa ltar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ming tsam du kun du btags pa ltar blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should view them as mere names, as they are imagined.

original: de yang phung po la sogs pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang phung po la sogs pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, it is not only the aggregates, etc.

original: gzhan khams gsum pa ma lus pa yang yin te /
analyzed: gzhan khams gsum pa ma lus pa yang yin te /
translated: but also the entire three realms,

original: chos gang dag ma lus shing lhag ma med pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos gang dag ma lus shing lhag ma med pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: because those dharmas are said to be without remainder.

original: 'i zhes bya ba ni dang po'i don gyis drug pa'i rkyen can no //🔽ci ste phung po la sogs pa ngo bo med @8a * //
analyzed: 'i zhes bya ba ni dang po'i don gyis drug pa'i rkyen can no // ci ste phung po la sogs pa ngo bo med @8a * //
translated: The suffix “ta” is a sixth case, ablative, marker.

original: pa yin na /
analyzed: pa yin na /
translated: But if the aggregates, etc. are essenceless,

original: ji ltar don byed par 'gyur zhe na /🔽'gro kun sgyu ma lta bu yin //
analyzed: ji ltar don byed par 'gyur zhe na / 'gro kun sgyu ma lta bu yin //
translated: how can they perform a function?

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The verse states: The entire world is like an illusion.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma ngo bo nyid med kyang gzugs su snang zhing don byed par snang ba ltar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma ngo bo nyid med kyang gzugs su snang zhing don byed par snang ba ltar blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should view it as like an illusion, which, although essenceless, appears as form and appears to perform a function.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir mthong ba dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir mthong ba dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to make this clear, the verse states: What is seen, etc.

original: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba tsam mo //
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba tsam mo //
translated: “What is seen” is mere experience.

original: de ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is that?

original: reg pa'i dngos zhes bya ste /
analyzed: reg pa'i dngos zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called the “thing of contact.”

original: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i 'gro ba ji ltar grags pa rnams dbang po rnams kyis gzung bar gyur pas na reg pa ste /
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i 'gro ba ji ltar grags pa rnams dbang po rnams kyis gzung bar gyur pas na reg pa ste /
translated: Since the world of the stable and the moving is apprehended by the senses, it is contact.

original: de dag gi rnam pa'i dbye ba thams cad snang mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag gi rnam pa'i dbye ba thams cad snang mod kyi /
translated: All the varieties of their appearances are indeed seen.

original: gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i sbyor bas spyad na dmigs su med pa yin te /
analyzed: gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i sbyor bas spyad na dmigs su med pa yin te /
translated: But when one practices with the argument of the absence of one and many, they are not perceived.

original: ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: What are they like?

original: sgyu ma ji bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sgyu ma ji bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are like illusions.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma gcig dang du mar snang yang de kho na nyid du ma yin pa ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma gcig dang du mar snang yang de kho na nyid du ma yin pa ltar /
translated: Just as an illusion appears as one and many, but is not so in reality,

original: 'gro ba'i dngos po rnams kyang rang bzhin med par dgongs so //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i dngos po rnams kyang rang bzhin med par dgongs so //
translated: so the entities of the world are considered to be essenceless.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
