translated: As to “by whom,” etc.

original: blun po zhes bya ba ni shes bya'i sgrib pa dang ldan pa rnams te /
analyzed: blun po zhes bya ba ni shes bya'i sgrib pa dang ldan pa rnams te /
translated: “Fools” are those who have the obscurations of the knowable.

original: de dag gang gis zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i cha phra mo tsam gyis te /
analyzed: de dag gang gis zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i cha phra mo tsam gyis te /
translated: “By whom” means by the mere subtle part of an entity.🔽“By that” means by the subtle part of an entity.

original: des 'ching ba ni sdug bsngal gyis 'ching bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des 'ching ba ni sdug bsngal gyis 'ching bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “By that” means by that, one is bound, one is bound by suffering.

original: des zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i cha phra mo tsam des zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i cha phra mo tsam des zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The it is the mere subtle part of the entity.

original: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: The wise are free from the obscurations of the knowable.

original: shin tu phra ba'i cha la mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu phra ba'i cha la mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
translated: They do not cling to the extremely subtle part.

original: gsal ba mang po nyid kyis na mang po'i tshig go //
analyzed: gsal ba mang po nyid kyis na mang po'i tshig go //
translated: The word many is because of the many manifestations.

original: rnam par rol zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi don gyi phyir de'i rang bzhin yongs su shes bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gzugs su sprul te rtse bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rol zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi don gyi phyir de'i rang bzhin yongs su shes bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gzugs su sprul te rtse bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: The play is that, for the sake of sentient beings, having understood its nature, he creates various forms and plays.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: 'dir te chos kyi dbyings su'o //
analyzed: 'dir te chos kyi dbyings su'o //
translated: Here, in the dharmadhatu.

original: phyag rgya'i sbyor ba 'di yis ni //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i sbyor ba 'di yis ni //
translated: By this seal-practice,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: 'di yis zhes bya ba bstan ma thag pa'i stong pa nyid kyi phyag rgya 'dis so //
analyzed: 'di yis zhes bya ba bstan ma thag pa'i stong pa nyid kyi phyag rgya 'dis so //
translated: by this means by this seal of emptiness that was just taught.

original: phyag dang zhal la sogs pa'i kun rdzob kyi phyag rgya dang mnyam par sbyor ba gang la yod pa de la 'di skad ces bya'o /
analyzed: phyag dang zhal la sogs pa'i kun rdzob kyi phyag rgya dang mnyam par sbyor ba gang la yod pa de la 'di skad ces bya'o /
translated: One who has the union with the conventional seal of the hands, face, etc. is called thus.

original: rnal 'byor pa des ci zhig bya zhe na /🔽sa gsum ma lus bza' par bya //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa des ci zhig bya zhe na / sa gsum ma lus bza' par bya //
translated: What does that yogin do?

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He should eat the three worlds without exception.

original: sku la sogs pa'i tha mal pa'i gzugs bzlog par bya @8b zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i tha mal pa'i gzugs bzlog par bya @8b zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he should turn away from the ordinary form of the body, etc.

original: stong pa nyid kyi bsam gtan 'ba' zhig gis ji ltar yang byang chub 'grub pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi bsam gtan 'ba' zhig gis ji ltar yang byang chub 'grub pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that enlightenment is not accomplished in any way by the mere contemplation of emptiness, he says

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: elsewhere, etc.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig gis so //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig gis so //
translated: Elsewhere means by the mere emptiness.

original: sbyor ba ma tshang ba zhes bya ba ni snang ba las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ma tshang ba zhes bya ba ni snang ba las 'das pa'o //
translated: Incomplete union means transcending appearance.

original: 'da' zhes bya ba ni bdag gi don tsam yang med par mya ngan las 'da' pa'o //
analyzed: 'da' zhes bya ba ni bdag gi don tsam yang med par mya ngan las 'da' pa'o //
translated: Transcending means transcending nirvana without even the mere benefit of self.

original: ji lta bur zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur zhe na /
translated: How?

original: mar me lta bur te /
analyzed: mar me lta bur te /
translated: Like a lamp.

original: ji ltar mar me mar gyis rgyun gyis nam mkha'i ngos su gsal zhing 'bar ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar mar me mar gyis rgyun gyis nam mkha'i ngos su gsal zhing 'bar ba la /
translated: Just as a lamp, burning with a stream of oil, illuminates the surface of the sky,

original: gang gi tshe mar gyi rgyun zad pa de'i tshe de nyid du zad cing gtugs par gyur pa bdag nyid kyang mi snang na gzhan snang bar byed pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mar gyi rgyun zad pa de'i tshe de nyid du zad cing gtugs par gyur pa bdag nyid kyang mi snang na gzhan snang bar byed pa lta ci smos te /
translated: and when the stream of oil is exhausted, it is extinguished right there, and its own nature does not appear, let alone it illuminates another,

original: de bzhin du stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig gi ting nge 'dzin yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig gi ting nge 'dzin yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: in the same way, one should see the meditative concentration of emptiness alone.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i sbyor ba de nyid 'khor los sgyur ba drug gi bye brag gis bstan pa'i phyir gzugs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i sbyor ba de nyid 'khor los sgyur ba drug gi bye brag gis bstan pa'i phyir gzugs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach just that illusion-like union by way of the distinctions of the six wheel-turning [bodhisattvas], [the Bhagavān] declares form, etc.

original: gzugs ni 'dir dbang po lnga'i don rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs ni 'dir dbang po lnga'i don rnams so //
translated: Here, form is the objects of the five sense faculties.

original: tshor ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: tshor ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Feeling is the nature of the experience of pleasure, etc.

original: rdo rje nyi ma ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: Vajrasūrya is Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: 'du shes ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'du shes ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Discrimination is the nature of the apprehension of signs.

original: padma gar dbang gi snang ba mtha' yang so //
analyzed: padma gar dbang gi snang ba mtha' yang so //
translated: Padmanarteśvara is Amitābha.

original: 'du byed ni chags pa dang / sdang ba dang gti mug gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'du byed ni chags pa dang / sdang ba dang gti mug gi bdag nyid do //
translated: Formation is the nature of attachment, aversion, and delusion.

original: rdo rje rgyal po ni don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rgyal po ni don yod grub pa'o //
translated: Vajrarāja is Amoghasiddhi.

original: rnam shes ni rnam par rig pa yin la rdo rje sems dpa' ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam shes ni rnam par rig pa yin la rdo rje sems dpa' ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is the awareness, and Vajrasattva is Akshobhya.

original: nye bar bsdu pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: nye bar bsdu pa gsungs pa /
translated: The summary is stated

original: 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: in the line beginning with “these.”

original: dngos kun zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga po rnams te /
analyzed: dngos kun zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga po rnams te /
translated: “All things” refers to the five aggregates.

original: de dag rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lngar byas pa 'di dag rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rang bzhin du grags pa ste rab tu grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lngar byas pa 'di dag rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rang bzhin du grags pa ste rab tu grub pa yin no //
translated: These are made into the five Tathagatas, Vairochana, etc., and are known as the nature of Vajradaka, that is, are well established.

original: yang dag chen po zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag chen po zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa ste /
translated: “Great reality” is non-erroneous.

original: lhan cig skyes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is “innate.”

original: bde ba thams cad ni kun du dga' ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba thams cad ni kun du dga' ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “All bliss” is the bliss of ecstasy, etc.

original: sgyu ma chen mo'i rang bzhin ni sgyu 'phrul chen mo'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: sgyu ma chen mo'i rang bzhin ni sgyu 'phrul chen mo'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The nature of the Great Illusion is the nature of the Great Illusion.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis nyon mongs pa dang bral bas chags bral yin la /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis nyon mongs pa dang bral bas chags bral yin la /
translated: He is free from attachment, since he is free from afflictions by his very nature.

original: sems can rnams mchod cing 'chos pas na chags pa'o //🔽ltung byed ma ni snying rje dang @9a * //
analyzed: sems can rnams mchod cing 'chos pas na chags pa'o // ltung byed ma ni snying rje dang @9a * //
translated: He is attached, since he worships and embraces sentient beings.

original: sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin gyi lha mo spyan ma ste sems can 'dul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin gyi lha mo spyan ma ste sems can 'dul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who causes downfall is the goddess Locana, whose nature is the earth element, out of compassion for sentient beings.

original: gsod byed ma ni byams pa dang chu'i khams kyi bdag nyid kyi m'a ma k'i ste /
analyzed: gsod byed ma ni byams pa dang chu'i khams kyi bdag nyid kyi m'a ma k'i ste /
translated: The one who kills is the goddess Mamaki, whose nature is the water element and loving kindness,

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin med par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin med par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since she causes all phenomena to be devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: 'gugs ma ni dga' ba dang me'i khams kyi rang bzhin gos dkar mo ste /
analyzed: 'gugs ma ni dga' ba dang me'i khams kyi rang bzhin gos dkar mo ste /
translated: The one who attracts is the goddess Pandara, whose nature is the fire element and joy,

original: bde ba chen por 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba chen por 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since she leads to great bliss.

original: gar dbang ni btang snyom dang rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin sgrol ma ste 'gugs pa dang / nyon mongs pa skem pa'i phrin las gnyis mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gar dbang ni btang snyom dang rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin sgrol ma ste 'gugs pa dang / nyon mongs pa skem pa'i phrin las gnyis mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The lord of dance is the goddess Tara, whose nature is the wind element and equanimity, since she performs the two deeds of attracting and drying up the afflictions.

original: sgyu mche zhes bya ba ni padma'i dra ba can te /
analyzed: sgyu mche zhes bya ba ni padma'i dra ba can te /
translated: The one called illusion is the goddess Maya, who has a net of lotuses.

original: rang nyid 'gro zhes bya ba rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i sku dang lhan cig tu nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i phyir ro //🔽de nyid kyis na /
analyzed: rang nyid 'gro zhes bya ba rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i sku dang lhan cig tu nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i phyir ro // de nyid kyis na /
translated: One goes means that one goes into the sky together with the body of the Vajra dakini.

original: sangs rgyas kun dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: For that very reason, it is said, all buddhas and so forth.

original: 'byung ba lnga zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba lnga zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The five elements and so forth are easy to understand.

original: rdo rje gtso mo gnas zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das dang lhan cig dbyer med par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje gtso mo gnas zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das dang lhan cig dbyer med par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The abode of the chief of the vajras means that one abides inseparably with the Bhagavat.

original: mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to explain the consecration of the eyes and so forth, it is said:

original: mig gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mig gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The two eyes and so forth.

original: kha zhes bya ba ni lce ste lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: kha zhes bya ba ni lce ste lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The mouth is the tongue. The rest is easy to understand.

original: skye mched thams cad mnyam sbyor ba //
analyzed: skye mched thams cad mnyam sbyor ba //
translated: The union of all the sense bases

original: zhes bya ba la gang du skye mched thams cad mnyam par sbyor ba de ni skye mched thams cad mnyam par sbyor ba ste yid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gang du skye mched thams cad mnyam par sbyor ba de ni skye mched thams cad mnyam par sbyor ba ste yid do //
translated: means that where all the sense bases are united, that is the union of all the sense bases, which is the mind.

original: bdun pa'i don gyis na dang po'i tshig tu bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: bdun pa'i don gyis na dang po'i tshig tu bstan pa yin te /
translated: By the meaning of the seventh [case], it is taught as the first word.

original: der rdo rje mkha' 'gro blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: der rdo rje mkha' 'gro blta bar bya'o //
translated: There one should see the Vajra dakini.

original: gzugs 'di thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs 'di thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: All these forms are the aggregates, etc.

original: stong pa'i tshul gyi mig gis zhes bya ba ni der dmigs pa'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: stong pa'i tshul gyi mig gis zhes bya ba ni der dmigs pa'i sems kyis so //
translated: With the eye of the mode of emptiness means with the mind that observes that.

original: dogs pa med par ni gnyis med par ro //
analyzed: dogs pa med par ni gnyis med par ro //
translated: Without hesitation means without duality.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni gzung ba la sogs pa'i rtog pa dang bral ba ste mig ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni gzung ba la sogs pa'i rtog pa dang bral ba ste mig ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: Non-conceptually means free from the concepts of object, etc.

original: nye bar bsdu ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba gsungs pa /
translated: The summary is stated:

original: nam mkha'i tshul zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i tshul zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The mode of space, etc.

original: der rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i bskyed pa'i rim pas lus bskyed pa der phung po la sogs pa stong pa nyid du nyams su myong bas phyin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: der rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i bskyed pa'i rim pas lus bskyed pa der phung po la sogs pa stong pa nyid du nyams su myong bas phyin gyis brlabs te /
translated: There, in the generation stage of the Vajra dakini, having generated the body, one should consecrate it with the experience of the emptiness of the aggregates, etc.

original: lha'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rim gyis byang chub bsgrub par bya zhes bya bar @9b dgongs so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sdud pa po bdag nyid kyi rang bzo sbong bar mdzad do //
analyzed: lha'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rim gyis byang chub bsgrub par bya zhes bya bar @9b dgongs so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sdud pa po bdag nyid kyi rang bzo sbong bar mdzad do //
translated: Thus, the compiler himself removes his own fabrication.

original: da ni bsam gtan gyi go rims bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bsam gtan gyi go rims bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the sequence of meditation,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, Then, and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la thams cad ni byang chub la sems shing 'dod pa rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la thams cad ni byang chub la sems shing 'dod pa rnams te /
translated: With respect to all tathāgatas, all refers to those who aspire to enlightenment.

original: de rnams de bzhin nyid du gshegs shing 'gro ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams de bzhin nyid du gshegs shing 'gro ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: They are called tathāgatas because they go and come in suchness.

original: thogs pa med pa ni ye shes tsam gyi bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa ni ye shes tsam gyi bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: Unimpeded means by the nature of mere gnosis.

original: gdon mi za ba ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdon mi za ba ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Assured means because it has a result.

original: dam tshig ni smon lam ste /
analyzed: dam tshig ni smon lam ste /
translated: Commitment means aspiration.🔽

original: der dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin de nyid ma lus pa'i 'gro ba thams cad la bde ba chen po bsgrub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba chen po yin la /
analyzed: der dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin de nyid ma lus pa'i 'gro ba thams cad la bde ba chen po bsgrub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba chen po yin la /
translated: Since that meditative stabilization observing that is the cause for accomplishing great bliss for all transmigrating beings without exception, it is great bliss.

original: de'i khyad par ni rim pas te /
analyzed: de'i khyad par ni rim pas te /
translated: Its distinction is gradual.

original: de la snyoms par zhugs nas 'di skad ces gsungs so zhes bya ba ni smon lam la thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la snyoms par zhugs nas 'di skad ces gsungs so zhes bya ba ni smon lam la thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad nas /
translated: Having entered into meditative equipoise on that, he spoke thus refers to having one-pointedly focused on the aspiration prayer.

original: 'og nas 'byung ba 'di skad ces gsungs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba 'di skad ces gsungs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he spoke thus as will be explained below.

original: ji srid ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ji srid ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As long as refers to the cycle of existence.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'gro ba nas 'gro ba gzhan dag tu rgyun du 'jug pas na 'khor ba ste phung po lnga yin la /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'gro ba nas 'gro ba gzhan dag tu rgyun du 'jug pas na 'khor ba ste phung po lnga yin la /
translated: The cycle of existence is the five aggregates, since it is the continuous engagement in one transmigration after another through the power of karma and afflictions.

original: gnas der gnas pa ni sems can rnams kyi don gyi phyir de las gar yang mi 'gro zhing der gnas par dam 'cha' ba'o //
analyzed: gnas der gnas pa ni sems can rnams kyi don gyi phyir de las gar yang mi 'gro zhing der gnas par dam 'cha' ba'o //
translated: Abiding in that refers to not going anywhere else from that, but rather abiding there for the sake of sentient beings.

original: su zhig ce na nam mkha' mchog ste byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: su zhig ce na nam mkha' mchog ste byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: Who? The supreme sky, the bodhisattva.

original: de nyid gsungs pa de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That is stated by “thus” and so forth.

original: mi skyo zhes bya ba ni phyir mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: mi skyo zhes bya ba ni phyir mi ldog pa'o //
translated: “ Not weary” means not turning back.

original: brtson 'grus ni byang chub nyams su len pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni byang chub nyams su len pa'o //
translated: “ Effort” is taking up enlightenment.

original: nam mkha'i gnas kyi mthar thug ces bya ba la nam mkha' nyid gnas pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i gnas kyi mthar thug ces bya ba la nam mkha' nyid gnas pa ste /
translated: “ The end of the realm of space” is the realm of space itself.

original: de'i gnas gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i gnas gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba ste /
translated: That which has a realm there is so called.

original: phung po lnga yin pa de'i mthar gtugs pa ni ji srid gnas kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga yin pa de'i mthar gtugs pa ni ji srid gnas kyi bar du'o //
translated: The end of the five aggregates is as long as they last.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar mdzad ce na /
translated: Why do it that way?

original: smon lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te sems can gyi don ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: smon lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te sems can gyi don ni dgos pa'o //
translated: “ Aspiration” and so forth are stated. The benefit of sentient beings is the purpose.

original: de nyid kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyang gang zhe na /
translated: And what is that?

original: 'dod chags thams cad ces bya ba dang sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dod chags thams cad ces bya ba dang sbyar te /
translated: It is connected with “all attachments”.

original: 'dod chags thams cad rnams par dag pa nyid sems can rnams kyi don te dgos pa yin la de bya'o @10a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags thams cad rnams par dag pa nyid sems can rnams kyi don te dgos pa yin la de bya'o @10a * //
translated: The purification of all attachments is the benefit of sentient beings, the purpose. That is to be done.

original: zhes smon lam gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes smon lam gdab par bya'o //
translated: One should make an aspiration prayer.

original: de yang ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: And how is that done?

original: rtog pa rgyas par sbyin pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa rgyas par sbyin pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The giving of the extensive thought, and so forth.

original: rtog pa 'joms par byed pas na rtog pa ste lam gyi bdag nyid kyi chos yin la rgyas pa ni tshogs te /
analyzed: rtog pa 'joms par byed pas na rtog pa ste lam gyi bdag nyid kyi chos yin la rgyas pa ni tshogs te /
translated: Since it conquers thought, it is the thought, which is the Dharma of the nature of the path. The extensive is the collection.

original: sbyin pa ni de dag bstan pa'i sgo nas so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni de dag bstan pa'i sgo nas so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: It is the giving of those, by means of their teaching, so it is considered.

original: ci zhig spyin par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig spyin par bya zhe na /
translated: What is given?

original: thog ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thog ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The beginning, and so forth.

original: thog ma la sogs pa med pa'i chos kyi lam thams cad de /
analyzed: thog ma la sogs pa med pa'i chos kyi lam thams cad de /
translated: The Dharma of the path is without beginning, and so forth.

original: de yang bshad pas sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang bshad pas sbyin par bya'o //
translated: And that is given by explanation.

original: chos bshad pa'i sngon du byung ba'i gtam rnams gsungs pa /
analyzed: chos bshad pa'i sngon du byung ba'i gtam rnams gsungs pa /
translated: The stories that occur prior to the explanation of the Dharma are stated:

original: 'das pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: In the past, and so forth.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro skye ba'i lo rgyus so //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro skye ba'i lo rgyus so //
translated: The story of the birth of Vajradaka.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' chen po ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro yin la /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' chen po ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro yin la /
translated: The great Vajrasattva is Vajradaka,

original: bde ba chen ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: bde ba chen ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: and the great bliss is Vajrasattva.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: de las sems can thams cad 'byung bas na sems can thams cad 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de las sems can thams cad 'byung bas na sems can thams cad 'byung ba ste /
translated: Since all sentient beings arise from that, it is the source of all sentient beings.

original: de dag gis ni dkyil 'khor ba'i lha rnams bskyed pa bstan te //
analyzed: de dag gis ni dkyil 'khor ba'i lha rnams bskyed pa bstan te //
translated: Thus, it shows the generation of the deities of the mandala.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di skad du mchod pa dang sdig pa bshad pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas gzhal yas khang brtsegs pa dang gdan dgod pa'i mthar zla ba dang mtshan ma la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa las /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di skad du mchod pa dang sdig pa bshad pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas gzhal yas khang brtsegs pa dang gdan dgod pa'i mthar zla ba dang mtshan ma la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: Then, etc. shows that, having gone through the preliminaries of offering, confessing evil, etc., at the end of arranging the celestial mansion, the seats, the moon, the sign, etc.,

original: aom ma h'a zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i glus bskul bar bsgoms la /🔽bdag nyid rdo rje mkha' 'gro'am /
analyzed: aom ma h'a zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i glus bskul bar bsgoms la / bdag nyid rdo rje mkha' 'gro'am /
translated: one should meditate on the urging with the song of Oṃ, Mahā, etc.🔽One should meditate on oneself as Vajraḍāka or

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs su bsgom par bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs su bsgom par bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: as Vajrasattva.

original: kha cig na re mngon par byang chub pa lnga las byung ba'i rdo rje sems dpa' zhu ba las bskul nas /
analyzed: kha cig na re mngon par byang chub pa lnga las byung ba'i rdo rje sems dpa' zhu ba las bskul nas /
translated: Some say that one should melt the Vajrasattva arisen from the five manifest enlightenments, urge him,

original: bdag nyid rdo rje mkha' 'gror ldang bar bya'o zhe zer ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid rdo rje mkha' 'gror ldang bar bya'o zhe zer ro //
translated: and arise as Vajraḍāka.

original: dkyil 'khor chen po sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the yoga of the great mandala,

original: zhes bya ba la rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor ni dkyil 'khor chen po ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor ni dkyil 'khor chen po ste /
translated: The vajrasattva mandala is the great mandala,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi rim pa du ma dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi rim pa du ma dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has many stages of mandalas.

original: sbyor ba ni de'i rim pa ste des bri ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni de'i rim pa ste des bri ba'o //
translated: The application is the stage of that, and the drawing is by that.

original: de la thog ma kho nar rang gi snying gar dbyangs yig dang po las byung ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la yi ge h'um bsgoms la /
analyzed: de la thog ma kho nar rang gi snying gar dbyangs yig dang po las byung ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la yi ge h'um bsgoms la /
translated: Therein, first of all, one should visualize the letter hūṃ on a moon disk arisen from the first vowel [a], in one's heart.

original: de'i 'od zer gyis bla ma dang rdo rje sems dpa' mdun du snang bar byas te /
analyzed: de'i 'od zer gyis bla ma dang rdo rje sems dpa' mdun du snang bar byas te /
translated: Then, by the light rays from that, one should visualize the guru and Vajrasattva in front,

original: me @10b tog la sogs pas yang dag par mchod nas /
analyzed: me @10b tog la sogs pas yang dag par mchod nas /
translated: and having made offerings with flowers and so forth,

original: sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi yid kyis bsgoms te /
analyzed: sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi yid kyis bsgoms te /
translated: one should meditate mentally on the four Brahma abodes, preceded by confession of sins and so forth.

original: a'a dya nutpa nna sarbba dha rma: pra kri ti pa ri shuddha: sarbba dha rma: zhes brjod pas chos thams cad bdag med par byas la rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sems de nyid zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par bsgoms nas /🔽aom tsitta pra ti be dham ka ro mi /
analyzed: a'a dya nutpa nna sarbba dha rma: pra kri ti pa ri shuddha: sarbba dha rma: zhes brjod pas chos thams cad bdag med par byas la rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sems de nyid zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par bsgoms nas / aom tsitta pra ti be dham ka ro mi /
translated: Having made all phenomena selfless by reciting ādyanutpannāḥ sarvadharmāḥ prakrtipariśuddhāḥ sarvadharmāḥ, one should meditate on that very mind of natural luminosity in the form of a moon disk.

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags yid kyis brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags yid kyis brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should mentally recite the mantra oṃ cittaprativedhaṃ karomi.

original: de nas yang der zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa bsgoms la /🔽aom bo dhi tsitta autp'a da y'a mi /
analyzed: de nas yang der zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa bsgoms la / aom bo dhi tsitta autp'a da y'a mi /
translated: Then, having meditated on a second moon disk there,

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod par bya ste /🔽de la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang por ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yon tan /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod par bya ste / de la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang por ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yon tan /
translated: one should recite the mantra oṃ bodhicittam utpādayāmi.

original: aa la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis gzhugs par bya la /
analyzed: aa la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis gzhugs par bya la /
translated: In that, one should visualize the qualities of all the tathāgatas abiding in the form of the letters a and so forth in the first moon disk,

original: de bzhin du gnyis par ni ka la sogs pa zhugs par bsgom mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis par ni ka la sogs pa zhugs par bsgom mo //
translated: and likewise, in the second, one should meditate on the letters ka and so forth abiding.

original: de nas de'i steng du sa bon h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje dkar po de nyid kyi lte bar byin gyis brlabs pa bsams la /🔽aom tishtha badzra /
analyzed: de nas de'i steng du sa bon h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje dkar po de nyid kyi lte bar byin gyis brlabs pa bsams la / aom tishtha badzra /
translated: Then, on top of that, one should imagine that a white vajra arises from the seed syllable hūṃ, and that it is consecrated in the center of that.

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: One should consecrate it with the mantra “Oṃ tiṣṭha vajra,”

original: bdag nyid rdo rje'i ngo po nyid du bsgoms la /🔽aom badzra a'a tma ko& ham /
analyzed: bdag nyid rdo rje'i ngo po nyid du bsgoms la / aom badzra a'a tma ko& ham /
translated: and meditate on oneself as having the nature of a vajra.

original: zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should recite “Oṃ vajra ātmāko ’haṃ.”

original: de thams cad yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das bsgom pa ni zla ba'i mdog can 'dzum pa dang bcas shing nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'od dang ldan pa sangs rgyas lnga'i dbu rgyan can /
analyzed: de thams cad yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das bsgom pa ni zla ba'i mdog can 'dzum pa dang bcas shing nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'od dang ldan pa sangs rgyas lnga'i dbu rgyan can /
translated: One should meditate on the Bhagavān arising from the complete transformation of all of that, having the color of the moon, smiling, endowed with the radiance of a solar maṇḍala, with a crown of the five buddhas,

original: rgyan thams cad pa spyan gsum dang ral pa'i cod pan dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad pa spyan gsum dang ral pa'i cod pan dang ldan pa /
translated: adorned with all the ornaments, with three eyes, and with a topknot and diadem.

original: rtsa ba dang g-yas pa dang rgyab dang g-yon pa'i zhal dkar po dang / sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po'i mdog can te /
analyzed: rtsa ba dang g-yas pa dang rgyab dang g-yon pa'i zhal dkar po dang / sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po'i mdog can te /
translated: His root face, right face, rear face, and left face are white, blue, yellow, and red, respectively.

original: tsa ba'i zhal zhi ba'i nyams dang ldan pa /
analyzed: tsa ba'i zhal zhi ba'i nyams dang ldan pa /
translated: His cat face has a peaceful expression.

original: zhal gzhan rnams par 'gyur ba dang ldan pas sum cu rtsa gsum pa 'jigs par mdzad pa /🔽g-yas na rdo rje dang ral gri //
analyzed: zhal gzhan rnams par 'gyur ba dang ldan pas sum cu rtsa gsum pa 'jigs par mdzad pa / g-yas na rdo rje dang ral gri //
translated: The other faces are wrathful, terrifying the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.🔽He has a vajra and a sword in his right hands,

original: g-yon na dril bu dang thod pa ste /
analyzed: g-yon na dril bu dang thod pa ste /
translated: and a bell and a skull cup in his left hands.

original: zla ba'i steng gi thod pa la phyed krung bcas pa'i gar gyis bzhugs pa /
analyzed: zla ba'i steng gi thod pa la phyed krung bcas pa'i gar gyis bzhugs pa /
translated: He stands in the half-dance posture on a skull cup on a moon.

original: 'og nas 'byung ba'i gzhal yas khang na gnas pa'i dkyil 'khor pa'i lha dang bcas par bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs su skad cig tsam gyis bsgom par bya ste /🔽der @11a * //
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba'i gzhal yas khang na gnas pa'i dkyil 'khor pa'i lha dang bcas par bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs su skad cig tsam gyis bsgom par bya ste / der @11a * //
translated: In an instant, you should meditate on yourself in the form of Vajrasattva, together with the deities of the mandala who reside in the celestial mansion that will be described below.

original: yang sngar bstan pa'i bdag med pa'i rjes su h'um las byung ba'i nyi ma la gnas pa'i rdo rje'i lte bar des byin gyis brlabs par bsams la /
analyzed: yang sngar bstan pa'i bdag med pa'i rjes su h'um las byung ba'i nyi ma la gnas pa'i rdo rje'i lte bar des byin gyis brlabs par bsams la /
translated: Again, as previously explained, after the absence of an intrinsic nature, imagine that a sun arises from hūṃ, and on that a vajra marked with hūṃ.

original: de'i 'od kyis rdo rje rab la sogs pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'od kyis rdo rje rab la sogs pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Meditate that light from that vajra and so forth.

original: der h'um sum h'um las ri rab de'i steng du chos kyi 'byung gnas /
analyzed: der h'um sum h'um las ri rab de'i steng du chos kyi 'byung gnas /
translated: On that, from hūṃ suṃ hūṃ, is a Meru mountain, on top of which is a source of phenomena.

original: der sna tshogs padma dang rdo rje'i steng du yi ge bhr'um yongs su gyur pa las rnam par snang mdzad de las byung ba /
analyzed: der sna tshogs padma dang rdo rje'i steng du yi ge bhr'um yongs su gyur pa las rnam par snang mdzad de las byung ba /
translated: There, upon a variegated lotus and vajra, is the syllable bhrūṃ, which completely transforms into Vairocana.

original: gru bzhi la sogs pa'i yon tan dang yang dag par ldan pa /
analyzed: gru bzhi la sogs pa'i yon tan dang yang dag par ldan pa /
translated: He arises from that, and is endowed with the qualities of having four sides and so forth.

original: so so'i thod pa'i gdan gyis mnan par khang pa brtsegs ma bsams te /
analyzed: so so'i thod pa'i gdan gyis mnan par khang pa brtsegs ma bsams te /
translated: He is imagined to be the mansion, which is pressed down by the individual skull seats.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pas de'i dbus su /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pas de'i dbus su /
translated: The vajra-mind practitioner should imagine him in the center.

original: padma'i steng gi zla bar gnas pa'i thod pa la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bltas la /
analyzed: padma'i steng gi zla bar gnas pa'i thod pa la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bltas la /
translated: He is on a lotus and moon, in a skull cup, and he looks at the moon mandala.

original: der aa la sogs pa'i dbyangs kyi yi ge dang / sangs rgyas thams cad bcug nas /🔽aom tsitta pra ti be dham ka ro mi /
analyzed: der aa la sogs pa'i dbyangs kyi yi ge dang / sangs rgyas thams cad bcug nas / aom tsitta pra ti be dham ka ro mi /
translated: All buddhas are placed there, the vowels such as a,

original: zhes bya bas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: and one should bless them with oṃ citta-prativedhaṃ karohi.

original: de nyid du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa bsams la /🔽aom bo dhi tsitta autpa da y'a mi /
analyzed: de nyid du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa bsams la / aom bo dhi tsitta autpa da y'a mi /
translated: One should imagine a second moon mandala there,

original: zhes bya bas byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: and bless it with oṃ bodhicitta-utpādayāmi.

original: der h'um gi sa bon las byung ba'i rdo rje lte bar h'um gis byin gyis brlabs par bsgoms nas /
analyzed: der h'um gi sa bon las byung ba'i rdo rje lte bar h'um gis byin gyis brlabs par bsgoms nas /
translated: There, one should meditate on a vajra arisen from the seed syllable hūṃ, consecrated with hūṃ in the center.

original: aom tishtha badzra /
analyzed: aom tishtha badzra /
translated: “Oṃ, be firm, vajra!”

original: zhes byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: zhes byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: One should consecrate it with this.

original: bdag nyid rdo rje tsam du mos nas /🔽aom badzra a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: bdag nyid rdo rje tsam du mos nas / aom badzra a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Having imagined oneself as just a vajra,

original: zhes bya bas byin gyis brlab bo //🔽de nas / aom ma h'a su kha badzra satva dza h'um bam ho: su ra stvam /
analyzed: zhes bya bas byin gyis brlab bo // de nas / aom ma h'a su kha badzra satva dza h'um bam ho: su ra stvam /
translated: one should consecrate it with “Oṃ, vajra-being, I am!”

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis bskul nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis bskul nas /
translated: Then, having incited it with the mantra “Oṃ, great bliss, vajra being, jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ, be firm!”

original: rang gi sems kyi rtog pa tsam gyis langs te /
analyzed: rang gi sems kyi rtog pa tsam gyis langs te /
translated: one should arise through mere imagination of one’s mind.

original: sngar bstan pa'i gzugs can gyi rdo rje sems dpa'i skur bskyed la /🔽aom ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta sta th'a aa ham /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i gzugs can gyi rdo rje sems dpa'i skur bskyed la / aom ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta sta th'a aa ham /
translated: One should generate the form of Vajrasattva as previously described.

original: zhes bya bas byin gyis brlab bo //
analyzed: zhes bya bas byin gyis brlab bo //
translated: One should consecrate it with “Oṃ, I am the state of all tathāgatas!”

original: de ltar mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lngas rdzogs par bskyed la /
analyzed: de ltar mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lngas rdzogs par bskyed la /
translated: Having generated the complete form through the five manifest enlightenments in this way,

original: aom ha / zhes bya ba 'dis snying gar rdo rje sems dpa' bsgom mo //
analyzed: aom ha / zhes bya ba 'dis snying gar rdo rje sems dpa' bsgom mo //
translated: one should meditate on Vajrasattva at the heart with “Oṃ, haṃ!”

original: de bzhin du na ma: hi zhes bya bas mgo bor rnam par snang mdzad /🔽sv'a h'a hu /
analyzed: de bzhin du na ma: hi zhes bya bas mgo bor rnam par snang mdzad / sv'a h'a hu /
translated: Likewise, one should imagine that with “namaḥ hīḥ” at the head is Vairocana,

original: zhes bya bas khar padma gar gyi dbang phyug / boo shada he /
analyzed: zhes bya bas khar padma gar gyi dbang phyug / boo shada he /
translated: with “svāhā huḥ” at the mouth is Padmanarteśvara,

original: zhes bya bas phrag pa gnyis su he ru ka / h'um h'um ho //
analyzed: zhes bya bas phrag pa gnyis su he ru ka / h'um h'um ho //
translated: with “vauṣaṭ he” at the two shoulders is Heruka,

original: zhes bya bas mig gnyis su rdo rje nyi ma /
analyzed: zhes bya bas mig gnyis su rdo rje nyi ma /
translated: with “hūṃ hūṃ hoḥ” at the two eyes is Vajrasūrya,

original: phat ham / zhes bya bas yan lag thams cad la mtshon char rta mchog @11b bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: phat ham / zhes bya bas yan lag thams cad la mtshon char rta mchog @11b bsam par bya ste /
translated: and with “phaṭ haṃ” at all the limbs is Hayagrīva as the weapon.

original: de dag gi mdog dang phyag mtshan la sogs pa ni 'di nyid kyi dkyil 'khor du bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mdog dang phyag mtshan la sogs pa ni 'di nyid kyi dkyil 'khor du bstan par bya'o //
translated: One should understand their colors, hand implements, and so on, in the maṇḍala of this very [Vajrapañjara].

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,

original: aom bam / zhes bya bas lte bar rdo rje phag mo /
analyzed: aom bam / zhes bya bas lte bar rdo rje phag mo /
translated: with “oṃ vaṃ” at the navel is Vajravārāhī,

original: aom ham yom gyis snying gar gshin rje ma /
analyzed: aom ham yom gyis snying gar gshin rje ma /
translated: with “oṃ haṃ yoṃ” at the heart is Yamāntaka,

original: aom hrim mom gyis khar rmongs byed ma /🔽aom hrem hrim gis spyi bor skyod byed ma /
analyzed: aom hrim mom gyis khar rmongs byed ma / aom hrem hrim gis spyi bor skyod byed ma /
translated: with “oṃ hriṃ moṃ” at the mouth is Moharā,🔽with “oṃ hreṃ hreṃ” at the crown is Khaṇḍarohā,

original: aom h'um h'um gis spyi gtsug tu skrag byed ma /
analyzed: aom h'um h'um gis spyi gtsug tu skrag byed ma /
translated: and with “oṃ hūṃ hūṃ” at the head is Vajravetālī.

original: aom phat phat kyis yan lag thams cad la mtshon char gtum mo bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: aom phat phat kyis yan lag thams cad la mtshon char gtum mo bsam par bya ste /
translated: One should imagine the weapon-like fierce fire in all the limbs with the syllable oṃ and the syllable phaṭ.

original: de dag gi mdog la sogs pa yang le'u gzhan las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mdog la sogs pa yang le'u gzhan las shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know their color and so forth from another chapter.

original: de bzhin du gzugs kyi phung po ni rnam par snang mdzad /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyi phung po ni rnam par snang mdzad /
translated: Similarly, the form aggregate is Vairocana,

original: tshor ba ni rdo rje nyi ma /
analyzed: tshor ba ni rdo rje nyi ma /
translated: feeling is Vajrasūrya,

original: 'du shes ni padma gar gyi dbang phyug 'du byed ni rta mchog rnam par shes pa ni rdo rje sems dpa'/
analyzed: 'du shes ni padma gar gyi dbang phyug 'du byed ni rta mchog rnam par shes pa ni rdo rje sems dpa'/
translated: perception is Padmanarteśvara, conditioning factors are Hayagrīva, and consciousness is Vajrasattva.

original: de dag thams cad ni dpal he ru ka mig la ni gti mug rdo rje /
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni dpal he ru ka mig la ni gti mug rdo rje /
translated: All of them are Śrī Heruka. Mohavajrā is in the eyes,

original: rna ba la zhe sdang rdo rje /🔽sna la ser sna rdo rje /
analyzed: rna ba la zhe sdang rdo rje / sna la ser sna rdo rje /
translated: Dveṣavajrā is in the ears,🔽Iravavajrā is in the nose,

original: lce la 'dod chags rdo rje /
analyzed: lce la 'dod chags rdo rje /
translated: Rāgavajrā is in the tongue,

original: lus la phrag dog rdo rje /
analyzed: lus la phrag dog rdo rje /
translated: Īrṣyavajrā is in the body,

original: skye mched thams cad la rdo rje sems dpa'/
analyzed: skye mched thams cad la rdo rje sems dpa'/
translated: and Vajrasattva is in all the sense bases.

original: yang na rnam par shes pa ni he ru ka skye mched kun ni rdo rje sems dpar ro //
analyzed: yang na rnam par shes pa ni he ru ka skye mched kun ni rdo rje sems dpar ro //
translated: Alternatively, consciousness is Heruka, and all the sense bases are Vajrasattva.

original: sa ni spyan ma /
analyzed: sa ni spyan ma /
translated: Earth is Locanā,

original: chu ni m'a ma k'i /
analyzed: chu ni m'a ma k'i /
translated: water is Māmakī,

original: me ni gos dkar mo //
analyzed: me ni gos dkar mo //
translated: fire is Pāṇḍaravāsinī,

original: rlung ni sgrol ma /
analyzed: rlung ni sgrol ma /
translated: and wind is Tārā.

original: nam mkha' ni padma'i dra ba can du bsam mo ;
analyzed: nam mkha' ni padma'i dra ba can du bsam mo ;
translated: The sky is imagined to be filled with a net of lotuses.

original: / de dag gi mdog la sogs pa yang dkyil 'khor 'di nyid du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: / de dag gi mdog la sogs pa yang dkyil 'khor 'di nyid du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Their colors and so forth should be described in this very mandala.

original: padma'i dra ba can ni m'a ma k'i bzhin no //
analyzed: padma'i dra ba can ni m'a ma k'i bzhin no //
translated: The one filled with a net of lotuses is like Māmakī.

original: de ltar go cha la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs nas /
analyzed: de ltar go cha la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs nas /
translated: Having thus consecrated oneself with the armor and so forth,

original: rang gi lus kyi 'od las spros pa'i mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bkug nas /
analyzed: rang gi lus kyi 'od las spros pa'i mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bkug nas /
translated: the ḍākinīs emanated from the light of one’s body summon the tathāgatas.

original: de dag gi sku las byung ba'i lha mo lag na bum pa thogs pa rnams kyis bdag la dbang bskur bas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lngas ral pa'i cod pan la brgyan par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi sku las byung ba'i lha mo lag na bum pa thogs pa rnams kyis bdag la dbang bskur bas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lngas ral pa'i cod pan la brgyan par bya'o //
translated: Goddesses holding vases that emerge from their bodies confer empowerment upon oneself, and one should be adorned with the five buddhas such as Akṣobhya on the crown of the head.

original: de nas shar la sogs pa'i gnas rnams su rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i lha'i tshogs bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas shar la sogs pa'i gnas rnams su rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i lha'i tshogs bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Then, one should meditate on the hosts of deities such as Vairocana in the eastern and other directions.

original: de la shar phyogs kyi thod pa'i zla ba'i bhr'um las byung ba'i kha dog dkar zhing zhi ba g-yas la sogs pa'i phyag bzhis 'khor lo dang dril bu dang thod pa dang zhags pa bsnams pa'i rnam par snang mdzad bsgom mo //
analyzed: de la shar phyogs kyi thod pa'i zla ba'i bhr'um las byung ba'i kha dog dkar zhing zhi ba g-yas la sogs pa'i phyag bzhis 'khor lo dang dril bu dang thod pa dang zhags pa bsnams pa'i rnam par snang mdzad bsgom mo //
translated: In the skull moon in the east, one should visualize Vairocana, white in color, peaceful, and with four faces, holding a wheel, a bell, a skull, and a noose in his right hands, and so on.

original: @12a * // de bzhin du lho phyogs kyi thod pa'i zla bar aom las byung ba'i rin chen 'byung ldan /
analyzed: @12a * // de bzhin du lho phyogs kyi thod pa'i zla bar aom las byung ba'i rin chen 'byung ldan /
translated: In the skull moon in the south, Ratnasaṃbhava arises from oṃ,

original: kha dog ser po /
analyzed: kha dog ser po /
translated: yellow in color,

original: g-yas pa la sogs pa'i phyag bzhis rin po che dang lcags kyu dang thod pa dang zhags pa bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa la sogs pa'i phyag bzhis rin po che dang lcags kyu dang thod pa dang zhags pa bsnams pa'o //
translated: and holding a jewel, a goad, a skull, and a noose in his right hands, and so on.

original: de bzhin du 'og nas 'byung ba kun la thod pa dang zla ba'i gdan sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og nas 'byung ba kun la thod pa dang zla ba'i gdan sbyar ro //
translated: In the same way, all the following are to be combined with the skull and moon seat.

original: nub tu hri: las byung ba'i padma gar gyi dbang phyug kha dog dmar mo phyag bzhis mda' dang padma dang gzhu dang thod pa bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: nub tu hri: las byung ba'i padma gar gyi dbang phyug kha dog dmar mo phyag bzhis mda' dang padma dang gzhu dang thod pa bsnams pa'o //
translated: In the west, Padmanarteśvara arises from hriḥ, red in color, and holding an arrow, a lotus, a bow, and a skull in his four hands.

original: byang du kham las byung ba'i rta mchog kha dog ljang gu phyag bzhis rdo rje dang lcags kyu dang dril bu dang thod pa bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: byang du kham las byung ba'i rta mchog kha dog ljang gu phyag bzhis rdo rje dang lcags kyu dang dril bu dang thod pa bsnams pa'o //
translated: In the north, from khaṃ arises the supreme horse, green in color, with four faces, holding a vajra, iron hook, bell, and skull cup.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad ral pa'i cod pan can zhal gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad ral pa'i cod pan can zhal gcig pa'o //
translated: All of those tathāgatas have topknotted crowns and one face.

original: dbang ldan gyi mtshams su bh'um las byung ba'i spyan ma kha dog dkar mo zhal gcig spyan gsum ma ral pa'i thor tshugs thod pa'i phreng bas brgyan pa /
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi mtshams su bh'um las byung ba'i spyan ma kha dog dkar mo zhal gcig spyan gsum ma ral pa'i thor tshugs thod pa'i phreng bas brgyan pa /
translated: In the northeast, from bhrūṃ arises Locanā, white in color, with one face and three eyes, adorned with a topknot of hair and a garland of skulls.

original: phyag brgyad kyis 'khor lo dang / rdo rje dang / ral gri dang / mda' dang / thod pa dang / dril bu dang / zhags pa dang / gzhu bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: phyag brgyad kyis 'khor lo dang / rdo rje dang / ral gri dang / mda' dang / thod pa dang / dril bu dang / zhags pa dang / gzhu bsnams pa'o //
translated: She has eight hands, holding a wheel, vajra, sword, arrow, skull cup, bell, lasso, and bow.

original: me mtshams su h'um las byung ba'i m'a ma k'i mdog sngon mo zhal gcig spyan gsum pa cod pan thod pa'i phreng bas brgyan pa /
analyzed: me mtshams su h'um las byung ba'i m'a ma k'i mdog sngon mo zhal gcig spyan gsum pa cod pan thod pa'i phreng bas brgyan pa /
translated: In the southeast, from hūṃ arises Māmakī, blue in color, with one face and three eyes, adorned with a topknot of hair and a garland of skulls.

original: phyag bcu gnyis kyis mda' dang / ral gri dang / rdo rje dang / 'khor lo dang / rin po che dang / padma dang / gzhu dang / lcags kyu dang / dril bu dang / zhags pa dang / thod pa dang / kha tv'am ga bsnams pa'o //🔽bden bral du hr'i: las byung ba'i gos dkar mo mdog dmar mo zhal la sogs pa snga ma lta bu las phyag brgyad kyis mda' dang / padma dang / ral gri dang / rdo rje dang / gzhu dang / thod pa dang / zhags pa dang /
analyzed: phyag bcu gnyis kyis mda' dang / ral gri dang / rdo rje dang / 'khor lo dang / rin po che dang / padma dang / gzhu dang / lcags kyu dang / dril bu dang / zhags pa dang / thod pa dang / kha tv'am ga bsnams pa'o // bden bral du hr'i: las byung ba'i gos dkar mo mdog dmar mo zhal la sogs pa snga ma lta bu las phyag brgyad kyis mda' dang / padma dang / ral gri dang / rdo rje dang / gzhu dang / thod pa dang / zhags pa dang /
translated: She has twelve arms, holding an arrow, sword, vajra, wheel, jewel, lotus, bow, goad, bell, noose, skull, and khaṭvāṅga.🔽In the southwest, red Pāṇḍaravāsinī arises from hriḥ. She has three faces—red, black, and white—and four arms.

original: dril bu bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: dril bu bsnams pa'o //
translated: She holds an arrow, lotus, sword, vajra, bow, skull, noose, and bell.

original: rlung mtshams su t'am las byung ba'i sgrol ma kha dog ljang gu /
analyzed: rlung mtshams su t'am las byung ba'i sgrol ma kha dog ljang gu /
translated: In the northwest, green Tārā arises from taṃ.🔽She has three faces—green, black, and white—and four arms.

original: zhal la sogs pa snga ma lta bu las phyag brgyad kyis autpala dmar po dang / ral gri dang / lcags kyu dang / mda' dang / 'khor lo dang / zhags pa dang / thod pa dang / gzhu bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: zhal la sogs pa snga ma lta bu las phyag brgyad kyis autpala dmar po dang / ral gri dang / lcags kyu dang / mda' dang / 'khor lo dang / zhags pa dang / thod pa dang / gzhu bsnams pa'o //
translated: She holds a red lotus, sword, goad, arrow, wheel, noose, skull, and bow.

original: de nas rim pa gnyis pa'i shar du aom las byung ba'i rdo rje drag mo phyag bzhis mda' dang / @12b lcags kyu dang / gzhu dang / khu bas gang ba'i thod pa bsnams par bsam mo //🔽lho phyogs su aam las byung ba'i rdo rje gzugs phyag bzhis /
analyzed: de nas rim pa gnyis pa'i shar du aom las byung ba'i rdo rje drag mo phyag bzhis mda' dang / @12b lcags kyu dang / gzhu dang / khu bas gang ba'i thod pa bsnams par bsam mo // lho phyogs su aam las byung ba'i rdo rje gzugs phyag bzhis /
translated: Then, in the east of the second tier, imagine Vajravetālī arises from AOM. She has four arms and holds an arrow, a goad, a bow, and a skull-cup filled with semen.

analyzed: zhes pa ni pi wang ma'i'o //

original: aom a'a: aem ham sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom a'a: aem ham sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ āḥ eṃ haṃ svāhā.

original: zhes pa ni rda chen ma'i'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rda chen ma'i'o //
translated: This is for Mṛdaṅga.

original: aom a'a: aeem ham sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom a'a: aeem ham sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ āḥ aiṃ haṃ svāhā.

original: zhes pa ni rdza rnga ma'i'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdza rnga ma'i'o //
translated: This is for Muraja.

original: aom a'a: badzra aam ku sha dza: ham sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom a'a: badzra aam ku sha dza: ham sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ āḥ vajra aṅkuśa jaḥ haṃ svāhā.

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje lcags kyu ma'i'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje lcags kyu ma'i'o //
translated: This is for Vajrāṅkuśī.

original: aom a'a: badzra p'a sha h'um ham sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom a'a: badzra p'a sha h'um ham sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ āḥ vajra pāśa hūṃ haṃ svāhā.

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje zhags pa ma'i'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje zhags pa ma'i'o //
translated: This is for Vajrapāśī.

original: aom a'a: badzra shrim kha le bam ham sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom a'a: badzra shrim kha le bam ham sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ āḥ vajra śṛṅkhalā vaṃ haṃ svāhā.

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje lcags sgrog ma'i'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje lcags sgrog ma'i'o //
translated: This is for Vajrasphoṭā.

original: aom a'a: badzra ghante ho: ham sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom a'a: badzra ghante ho: ham sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ āḥ vajra ghaṇṭe hoḥ haṃ svāhā.

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje dril bu ma'i'o //🔽de dag gis dkyil 'khor la bstod nas /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje dril bu ma'i'o // de dag gis dkyil 'khor la bstod nas /
translated: This is for Vajraghaṇṭā.

original: bdud rtsi lngas mchod la gtum mo'i rnal 'byor bsgoms nas /
analyzed: bdud rtsi lngas mchod la gtum mo'i rnal 'byor bsgoms nas /
translated: Having praised the maṇḍala with those, make offerings with the five elixirs, meditate on the caṇḍālī yoga, and recite:

original: aom ma h'a su kha /
analyzed: aom ma h'a su kha /
translated: Oṃ mahāsukha.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags bzlas par bya ba 'di ni rdo rje sems dpa' bsgom pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags bzlas par bya ba 'di ni rdo rje sems dpa' bsgom pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: This mantra recitation, etc. is the rite of meditation on Vajrasattva.

original: 'od zer dmar po 'khrugs pa las //
analyzed: 'od zer dmar po 'khrugs pa las //
translated: From the disturbance of red light

original: zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i 'od dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i 'od dang ldan pa'o //
translated: means possessing the light of the sun.

original: sangs rgyas phreng bas mdzes pa ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas phreng bas mdzes pa ni //
translated: Adorned with a garland of Buddhas

original: zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lngas dbu brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lngas dbu brgyan pa'o //
translated: means crowned with the five Tathagatas, Akshobhya, etc.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: lha mo bzhi zhes bya ba ni spyan ma la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: lha mo bzhi zhes bya ba ni spyan ma la sogs pa yin la /
translated: The four goddesses are Locana, etc.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Buddhas are Vairochana, etc.

original: g-yas dkar min zhes bya ba ni dkar po las bzlog pa ste nag po'o //
analyzed: g-yas dkar min zhes bya ba ni dkar po las bzlog pa ste nag po'o //
translated: The right is not white means the opposite of white, i.e., black.

original: zhi ba ni zhi ba'i nyams dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: zhi ba ni zhi ba'i nyams dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Peaceful means possessing the experience of peace.

original: lhag ma ni bzhin rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni bzhin rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The rest is the transformation of the face.

original: de nyid kyis na /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na /
translated: And for that very reason,

original: sum cu gsum pa 'jig par mdzad //
analyzed: sum cu gsum pa 'jig par mdzad //
translated: he is the destroyer of the thirty-three.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: mkha' 'gro ma'i 'khor lo ni rdo rje drag mo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma'i 'khor lo ni rdo rje drag mo la sogs pa'o //
translated: The circle of dakinis is Vajravetali and so forth.

original: skyob pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus la sprul pa sna tshogs pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du mtshon par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang bdag nyid dbyer med par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: skyob pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus la sprul pa sna tshogs pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du mtshon par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang bdag nyid dbyer med par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The various protectors are the various emanations in one's body, which should be visualized as the Tathagata himself, and the Tathagata and oneself should be meditated on as inseparable.

original: @14b yang na skad cig tsam gyis ri rab kyi rtse mor rdo rje rin po che brtsegs pa'i khang bur bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpar bskyed pa'i rim pas bsgom par bya ba'o //
analyzed: @14b yang na skad cig tsam gyis ri rab kyi rtse mor rdo rje rin po che brtsegs pa'i khang bur bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpar bskyed pa'i rim pas bsgom par bya ba'o //
translated: Or else, in an instant, one should visualize oneself as the Blessed Vajrasattva on the peak of Mount Meru, in the palace of the vajra-jewel, by the process of generation.

original: ci de yang rang bzhin gyis grub pa zhig gam 'on te ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci de yang rang bzhin gyis grub pa zhig gam 'on te ma yin zhe na /
translated: But is that also naturally existent, or not?

original: 'dir de dag rang gi sems rnam par dag pa nyid kyis snang ba yin pas 'o ma la mar ltar grub pa bsgrub par bya'i /
analyzed: 'dir de dag rang gi sems rnam par dag pa nyid kyis snang ba yin pas 'o ma la mar ltar grub pa bsgrub par bya'i /
translated: Here, since those appearances are one's own mind, pure by nature, one should establish the existent, as butter in milk.

original: chu la mar ltar ma grub pa sgrub pa ni 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu la mar ltar ma grub pa sgrub pa ni 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is not possible to establish the nonexistent, as butter in water.

original: de yang chu'i rnyog ma nor bus sbyangs pa ltar bskyed pa'i rim pas bdag nyid sngon du sbyangs nas rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang chu'i rnyog ma nor bus sbyangs pa ltar bskyed pa'i rim pas bdag nyid sngon du sbyangs nas rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, just as the jewel purifies turbid water, one should purify oneself with the creation stage and then complete the perfection stage,

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is naturally pure.

original: gzhan du sbyad ba ma byas na yang 'khor ba nyid yin pas rnam par dag pa'i 'bras bu sprul par mi nus la rang bzhin gyis ma dag pa'ang chos 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du sbyad ba ma byas na yang 'khor ba nyid yin pas rnam par dag pa'i 'bras bu sprul par mi nus la rang bzhin gyis ma dag pa'ang chos 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one does not practice in this way, one is in cyclic existence, and so one cannot produce the emanation which is the result of purification.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rjes su mthun pa nyid kyis na dag pas rnam par dag pa bsgrub par bya'o zhes man ngag las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rjes su mthun pa nyid kyis na dag pas rnam par dag pa bsgrub par bya'o zhes man ngag las shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand from the instructions that the pure should be accomplished by the pure, because of the conformity of cause and effect.

original: rjes su mthun pa yang rjes su byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa yang rjes su byed pa yin te /
translated: And conformity is the conformity of the effect to the cause.

original: rgyu yang 'bras bur 'dod pa dang / rjes su mthun pa yin na s'a lu'i myu gu las s'a lu'i sa bon ltar gdon mi za bar skyed nus kyi /
analyzed: rgyu yang 'bras bur 'dod pa dang / rjes su mthun pa yin na s'a lu'i myu gu las s'a lu'i sa bon ltar gdon mi za bar skyed nus kyi /
translated: If the cause is accepted as the effect, and if there is conformity, then it is certainly capable of producing, like the rice seed of the rice sprout.

original: gzhan du ko tra ba'i myu gu las s'a lu'i sa bon ltar nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ko tra ba'i myu gu las s'a lu'i sa bon ltar nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, like a rice seed from a barley sprout, it would not have the potential.

original: 'bras bu yang rgyur 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun na skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang rgyur 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun na skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: And an effect arises in accordance with what is asserted as the cause.

original: gzhan du de dag ha chang thal ches par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du de dag ha chang thal ches par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, they would be too far-fetched.

original: de ltar na 'o ma'i yon tan dkar ba ltar rnam par grub pa de dag yang dang yang du goms pas glo bur ba'i dri ma bzlog ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o ma'i yon tan dkar ba ltar rnam par grub pa de dag yang dang yang du goms pas glo bur ba'i dri ma bzlog ste /
translated: Thus, like the white quality of milk, those accomplishments are repeatedly cultivated, and the adventitious stains are reversed.

original: gnyug ma de nyid gsal bar 'gyur bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gnyug ma de nyid gsal bar 'gyur bar dgongs so //
translated: The intention is that the intrinsic reality will be clarified.

original: rnal 'byor pas gang de ltar bsgrub ce na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas gang de ltar bsgrub ce na /
translated: What is that which the yogi/nī accomplishes in that way?

original: mkha' 'gro kun dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro kun dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is stated, “all ḍākinīs,” and so on.

original: skad cig tsam gyis ri rab kyi steng du gyur pa'i khang bu brtsegs par gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa spyan ma la sogs pa'i tshogs dang ldan par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skad cig tsam gyis ri rab kyi steng du gyur pa'i khang bu brtsegs par gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa spyan ma la sogs pa'i tshogs dang ldan par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that in an instant, one is in the celestial mansion on top of Mount Meru, together with the assembly of the Tathāgatas, such as Buddhalocanā, and so on.

original: bde pa'i mchog ces bya ba ni bde ba dam pa'i rnam pas khyad par du byas pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sdud pa po'i rang bzo spong ba'o //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba @15a * //
analyzed: bde pa'i mchog ces bya ba ni bde ba dam pa'i rnam pas khyad par du byas pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sdud pa po'i rang bzo spong ba'o // de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba @15a * //
translated: The phrase supreme bliss is qualified by the term ultimate, and so on.🔽 The phrase thus-gone

original: la ; de bzhin ni phyin ci ma log pa yin la de gsungs pas na gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: la ; de bzhin ni phyin ci ma log pa yin la de gsungs pas na gshegs pa ste /
translated: means that which is not erroneous, and that which is gone to is taught.

original: des gzung ba'i 'os su ston to //
analyzed: des gzung ba'i 'os su ston to //
translated: That is to say, it is taught as a fit object to be grasped.

original: da ni gnyis su med pa'i de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gnyis su med pa'i de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the reality that is nondual,

original: ma dang sring mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //🔽ba lang sha dang rta sha sogs //
analyzed: ma dang sring mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o // ba lang sha dang rta sha sogs //
translated: the text says, mother, sister, and so on.🔽The phrase beef, horse meat, and so on

original: zhes bya ba la sogs kyis ni glang po che dang mi dang khyi'i sha rnams dang gzhan rnam par snang mdzad la sogs ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs kyis ni glang po che dang mi dang khyi'i sha rnams dang gzhan rnam par snang mdzad la sogs ba gsungs te /
translated: refers to the meats of elephant, human, and dog, and the others are Vairocana and so on.

original: de dag gis mig gi dri ma dang bcas nas dam tshig gi rdzas bcu ru 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis mig gi dri ma dang bcas nas dam tshig gi rdzas bcu ru 'gyur ro //
translated: Those are the ten pledge substances, which are to be consumed with the eye of nonconceptuality.

original: dogs pa med ces bya ba ni yid gnyis spangs pa ste /
analyzed: dogs pa med ces bya ba ni yid gnyis spangs pa ste /
translated: The phrase without doubt means having abandoned doubt.

original: thugs kyi rdo rje smad mi bya //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs kyi rdo rje smad mi bya // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should not disparage the vajra of mind.

original: bza' bar bya zhes pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i cho ga bzhin du sbyangs te spyad pa'o //🔽'jig rten la rtag g-yon la spyod //
analyzed: bza' bar bya zhes pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i cho ga bzhin du sbyangs te spyad pa'o // 'jig rten la rtag g-yon la spyod //
translated: “One should eat” means that one should purify and practice according to the rite that will be taught below.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: One should always practice the left in the world.

original: g-yon gyi kun du spyod pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: g-yon gyi kun du spyod pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: This is called “the left” because it is the practice of the left.

original: lus kyi bya ba thams cad la g-yon du bzlog par bya ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi bya ba thams cad la g-yon du bzlog par bya ba'o //
translated: All physical actions should be done in the left.

original: de gang las she na /
analyzed: de gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: rgyu dang mi rgyu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyu dang mi rgyu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse says “from the moving and unmoving,” etc.

original: g-yon pa ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: g-yon pa ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The left is suchness.

original: de las byung ba ni 'gro ba ma lus pa rnams de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de las byung ba ni 'gro ba ma lus pa rnams de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Everything that arises from it is the nature of suchness, because all beings are of the nature of suchness.🔽As it is said:

original: ji skad du chos kyi dbyings ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: ji skad du chos kyi dbyings ni ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from the realm of phenomena

original: 'di ltar chos ni yod ma yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos ni yod ma yin // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there is no such thing as phenomena.

original: des na skye bos g-yon du 'gying ba dang bcas pas de nyid bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: des na skye bos g-yon du 'gying ba dang bcas pas de nyid bsten par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should rely on that very [left] with a swaying of the body.

original: g-yon gyis bza' zhing g-yon mchod bya //
analyzed: g-yon gyis bza' zhing g-yon mchod bya //
translated: One should eat with the left hand, and worship with the left.

original: zhes bya ba ni lha mo rnams la mchod pa dang bdag nyid bza' ba rnams g-yon pas bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lha mo rnams la mchod pa dang bdag nyid bza' ba rnams g-yon pas bya'o //
translated: This means that one should worship the goddesses and eat with the left hand.

original: de kho na nyid kyi g-yon pa bsten pa la dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir pho nya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi g-yon pa bsten pa la dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir pho nya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to remove doubt about relying on the left in reality, he declares the messenger, etc.

original: pho nya ni sngags la sogs pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: pho nya ni sngags la sogs pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: The messenger is one who is endowed with mantra, etc.🔽Or, it is said that the messenger is one who is born together, one who is born from a field, and one who is born from mantra.

original: yang na lhan cig skyes pa dang / zhing las skyes pa dang / sngags las skyes pa rnams su gang gsungs pa de dag ma gtogs pa ni gzhan tha mal pa ste /
analyzed: yang na lhan cig skyes pa dang / zhing las skyes pa dang / sngags las skyes pa rnams su gang gsungs pa de dag ma gtogs pa ni gzhan tha mal pa ste /
translated: One should not rely on any other ordinary messenger.

original: de dag la 'dod pas rmongs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag la 'dod pas rmongs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: One who is deluded by desire for them is one who is attached to desire.

original: 'dod pa la mngon par zhen pas bgrod na de dngos grub tu mi 'gyur ro //🔽pho nya mo rtag zhen thar pa //
analyzed: 'dod pa la mngon par zhen pas bgrod na de dngos grub tu mi 'gyur ro // pho nya mo rtag zhen thar pa //
translated: If one travels with attachment to desire, it will not be successful.🔽The messenger is always attached to liberation.

original: zhes bya ba la pho nyar gyur pa'i shes rab la rtag tu rnam @15b par rtog pa spangs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la pho nyar gyur pa'i shes rab la rtag tu rnam @15b par rtog pa spangs te /
translated: The messenger is the wisdom that is always free from conceptualization.

original: bde ba chen po 'dus pas gnas pa ni grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bde ba chen po 'dus pas gnas pa ni grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: The one who abides in the gathering of great bliss is liberated.

original: 'dod chags nyid kyis rnam par grol //
analyzed: 'dod chags nyid kyis rnam par grol //
translated: Liberation is by means of passion itself.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: ji lta bu zhig gis she na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig gis she na /
translated: By what kind of person?

original: sgrub po zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sgrub po zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The adept,

original: sgrub pa po ni phyag rgya chen po'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa po ni phyag rgya chen po'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: the practitioner of the great seal,🔽should make supreme effort,

original: mchog tu 'bad bya zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i don bya ba ste /
analyzed: mchog tu 'bad bya zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i don bya ba ste /
translated: which is the activity for the benefit of the world.

original: 'bad pa ni de'i mthar gtugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bad pa ni de'i mthar gtugs pa'o //
translated: Effort is the culmination of that.

original: brtul zhugs min spangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: brtul zhugs min spangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Abandoning non-vow, etc.

original: brtul zhugs min ni 'jig rten gyi bya ba rnams te de dag spangs pa'o //
analyzed: brtul zhugs min ni 'jig rten gyi bya ba rnams te de dag spangs pa'o //
translated: Non-vow is worldly activity, which is abandoned.

original: brtul zhugs rdzogs pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i dka' thub yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: brtul zhugs rdzogs pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i dka' thub yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Vow is the completion of the austerities that will be described below.

original: dam tshig ni rnal 'byor ma dang rnal 'byor pha 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: dam tshig ni rnal 'byor ma dang rnal 'byor pha 'dus pa ste /
translated: Commitment is the gathering of yoginis and yogis.

original: der de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la sogs pa la spyod pa ni gang zhig 'dod par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: der de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la sogs pa la spyod pa ni gang zhig 'dod par gyur pa ste /
translated: There, one who is desirous of the practice of the Tathagata family, etc.

original: de dang lhan cig tu ts'a ru zhes bya ba lhag mar gyur pa dang / mdzes par gyur pa rnams bza' ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu ts'a ru zhes bya ba lhag mar gyur pa dang / mdzes par gyur pa rnams bza' ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Together with that, the remainder, which is called “charu,” and the beautiful, are eaten. That is what it is called.

original: de dag kyang gang zhen /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhen /
translated: What are they?

original: rigs lnga zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rigs lnga zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “the five clans,” and so on.

original: bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang dmangs rigs dang / mtha' las skyes pa rnams so //
analyzed: bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang dmangs rigs dang / mtha' las skyes pa rnams so //
translated: The brahmin, the warrior, the merchant, the laborer, and the outcaste.

original: kun spyod ni mtshungs par gcig tu byas te spyod pa'o //
analyzed: kun spyod ni mtshungs par gcig tu byas te spyod pa'o //
translated: Conduct is the same, that is, the same conduct is done.

original: de nyid kyis ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni /
translated: By that very [conduct],

original: rigs gcig nyid du brtag par bya //
analyzed: rigs gcig nyid du brtag par bya //
translated: it should be considered as one clan.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said.

original: 'dir phung po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid la bye brag sna tshogs med cing gcig pa nyid de rigs zhes bya ba ni ming tsam du dgongs so //
analyzed: 'dir phung po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid la bye brag sna tshogs med cing gcig pa nyid de rigs zhes bya ba ni ming tsam du dgongs so //
translated: Here, the aggregates and so on are not various in their own nature, but are just one. Clan is considered to be just a name.

original: bdud rtsi lnga'i nges pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga'i nges pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the definition of the five nectars,

original: sbrang rtsi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sbrang rtsi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “honey,” and so on.

original: khu ba nyid du gyur pa dang / chags pa las byung bas na sbrang rtsi khrag ste snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: khu ba nyid du gyur pa dang / chags pa las byung bas na sbrang rtsi khrag ste snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: The “honey of blood” is the blood that arises from passion, and is Amitābha.

original: ga bur ni don yod grub pa ste /
analyzed: ga bur ni don yod grub pa ste /
translated: Camphor is Amoghasiddhi.

original: de dag lhan cig tu gyur pa'i sbrang rtsi khrag de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag lhan cig tu gyur pa'i sbrang rtsi khrag de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The “honey” of those united is called that.

original: tsandan ni rnam par snang mdzad ngo //
analyzed: tsandan ni rnam par snang mdzad ngo //
translated: “ Sandalwood” is Vairocana.

original: dmar po ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: dmar po ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: “ Red” is Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: rdo rje chu ni mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje chu ni mi bskyod pa ste /
translated: “ Vajra water” is Akṣobhya.

original: de dag bdud rtsi lngar ni 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag bdud rtsi lngar ni 'gyur //
translated: Those are the five nectars.

original: zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: This is the connection.

original: dngos grub thams cad ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub rnams te /
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub rnams te /
translated: “ All powers” are mundane and supramundane powers.

original: de dag sgrub par byed pa ni bdud rtsi rnams bsten @16a * //
analyzed: de dag sgrub par byed pa ni bdud rtsi rnams bsten @16a * //
translated: “ Accomplishing them” is practicing the nectars.

original: pas bgegs rnams nye bar zhi ste dngos grub nye bar 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: pas bgegs rnams nye bar zhi ste dngos grub nye bar 'grub pa'o //
translated: “ Obstacles are pacified” because powers are accomplished.

original: mthe bo srin lag ces bya ba ni go sla'o //
analyzed: mthe bo srin lag ces bya ba ni go sla'o //
translated: “ Thumb and ring finger” is easy to understand.

original: zhi ba'i btung ba bzhin myang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhi ba'i btung ba bzhin myang zhes bya ba la /
translated: “ Drink like a drink for peace” means🔽.

original: zhi ba ni zla ba ste byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: zhi ba ni zla ba ste byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: Peace is the moon, which is the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: btung ba ni bdag nyid kyis btung ba dang / de la yang sbyin pa ste snyoms par zhugs pa'i 'bad pa las byung ba padma'i gnas su longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: btung ba ni bdag nyid kyis btung ba dang / de la yang sbyin pa ste snyoms par zhugs pa'i 'bad pa las byung ba padma'i gnas su longs spyod pa'o //
