translated: Drinking is drinking oneself and giving it to others, which is the enjoyment in the lotus-home that arises from the effort of meditative concentration.

original: de ltar yang gsang ba'i mdzod las //
analyzed: de ltar yang gsang ba'i mdzod las //
translated: Thus, the Secret Treasury says:

original: rnal 'byor pa yis bdag nyid 'di //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yis bdag nyid 'di //
translated: This self of the yogi

original: bha ga'i dbus su bsgom byas la //🔽gang zhig bdud rtsi 'dzag pa'i rtsa //
analyzed: bha ga'i dbus su bsgom byas la // gang zhig bdud rtsi 'dzag pa'i rtsa //
translated: is to be meditated on in the middle of the bhaga.🔽One should see the channel

original: lus kyi dbus gnas blta bar bya //
analyzed: lus kyi dbus gnas blta bar bya //
translated: in the middle of the body, which is the dripping nectar.

original: yang na mi nus bag med pas //
analyzed: yang na mi nus bag med pas //
translated: Or, if one is unable to do that, because of carelessness,

original: las kyi phyag rgya khyad par can //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya khyad par can //
translated: one should make a special karmamudra

original: rang gi lha mor byas nas su //
analyzed: rang gi lha mor byas nas su //
translated: into one's own goddess.

original: 'bad pa las byung khu ba ni //
analyzed: 'bad pa las byung khu ba ni //
translated: The effort-born semen

original: btung zhing 'thung du gzhug pa yis //
analyzed: btung zhing 'thung du gzhug pa yis //
translated: is to be drunk and made drunk by her.

original: gdon mi za bar sangs rgyas 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar sangs rgyas 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: There is no doubt of Buddhahood.

original: 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The words these and so on are easy to understand.

original: las rnams kun la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yul rnams la nye bar spyod pa'i brtul zhugs bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: las rnams kun la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yul rnams la nye bar spyod pa'i brtul zhugs bstan pa yin te /
translated: The line in all actions and so forth teaches the observances for the enjoyment of objects.

original: las rnams kun ni drag po dang zhi ba rnams so //
analyzed: las rnams kun ni drag po dang zhi ba rnams so //
translated: All actions are the violent and peaceful ones.

original: thabs ni sgrub thabs te mngon par sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: thabs ni sgrub thabs te mngon par sbyang ba'o //
translated: Means are the means of practice, the means of accomplishment.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Without conceptualization and so forth.

original: bya ba thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems kyis nye bar spyod pa 'di ni sems kyi sgo nas brtul zhugs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems kyis nye bar spyod pa 'di ni sems kyi sgo nas brtul zhugs bstan pa'o //
translated: The enjoyment of all actions with a nonconceptual mind is taught as the observance of mind.

original: yang las rnams kun zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ngag gi sgo nas so //
analyzed: yang las rnams kun zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ngag gi sgo nas so //
translated: Again, in all actions and so forth teaches the observance of speech.

original: the tshom med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lus kyi sgo nas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lus kyi sgo nas bstan pa'o //
translated: Without doubt and so forth teaches the observance of body.

original: skra zla la sogs pa zhes bya ba la skra'i tshogs ni skra zla ste /
analyzed: skra zla la sogs pa zhes bya ba la skra'i tshogs ni skra zla ste /
translated: Hair, nails, and so forth means a collection of hair, a hair tuft.

original: sogs kyis ni sgyu ma la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs kyis ni sgyu ma la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: And so forth includes illusions and so forth.

original: rjes dngos kyi zhes bya ba la rjes kyi sgra ni 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: rjes dngos kyi zhes bya ba la rjes kyi sgra ni 'dra ba ste /
translated: The line the real thing means the real thing.

original: dper na lha sbyin gyi rjes su byed do zhes bya bas 'dra ba gzung ba yin te /
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin gyi rjes su byed do zhes bya bas 'dra ba gzung ba yin te /
translated: For example, when it is said that “it follows after Devadatta,” similarity is indicated.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i dngos po rnams la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i dngos po rnams la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Things that are similar to him are called that.

original: dper na rab rib kyis nyams pa'i mig gis med bzhin du yang nam mkha' la skra shad kyi tshogs mthong ba ltar gzung ba la sogs pa mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis dkrugs pa'i sems yul gyi dngos por snang ngo @16b zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dper na rab rib kyis nyams pa'i mig gis med bzhin du yang nam mkha' la skra shad kyi tshogs mthong ba ltar gzung ba la sogs pa mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis dkrugs pa'i sems yul gyi dngos por snang ngo @16b zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as, for example, the eye impaired by an optical disorder sees a mass of hair in space, although it does not exist, so too do objects appear as real things to a mind disturbed by the latent impressions of the adherence to the grasped and the such.

original: ci ste skra zla la sogs pa de kho na nyid du med pas don byed mi nus pa ltar yul rnams kyang snang du zin kyang de kho na nyid du med pa yin na /
analyzed: ci ste skra zla la sogs pa de kho na nyid du med pas don byed mi nus pa ltar yul rnams kyang snang du zin kyang de kho na nyid du med pa yin na /
translated: But if objects, like the hairs in the optical disorder, do not exist in reality and are therefore incapable of performing a function, then, even though they appear, they do not exist in reality.

original: ji ltar don byed par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar don byed par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can they perform a function?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, they cannot.

original: 'di ltar rmi lam na skyes pa dang bud med gnyis kyi 'dod pa nye bar spyod pa la gnyis sprod pa med bzhin du yang 'di ltar sad pa'i dus na khu ba 'byin pa'i bya ba byed pa yod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar rmi lam na skyes pa dang bud med gnyis kyi 'dod pa nye bar spyod pa la gnyis sprod pa med bzhin du yang 'di ltar sad pa'i dus na khu ba 'byin pa'i bya ba byed pa yod de /
translated: Thus, in a dream, even though there is no actual sexual union of a man and a woman, there is the activity of emission of semen at the time of waking.

original: de bzhin du 'di ltar yang bag chags kyis dkrugs pa'i dbang gis med bzhin du yang don byed pa la 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di ltar yang bag chags kyis dkrugs pa'i dbang gis med bzhin du yang don byed pa la 'gal ba med de /
translated: In the same way, even though there is no external object, there is no contradiction in the performance of an action by something that does not exist, because of the influence of the disturbance of habitual propensities.

original: 'di ltar gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i rigs pas gnod pa'i phyir de tsam gyis don dam par yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i rigs pas gnod pa'i phyir de tsam gyis don dam par yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because of the refutation by the reasoning of the absence of one and many, it is not ultimately existent.

original: de bas na bag chags kyis dkrugs pa'i sems tsam pa de nyid don du snang bar 'byung gi 'di la phyi rol don yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bag chags kyis dkrugs pa'i sems tsam pa de nyid don du snang bar 'byung gi 'di la phyi rol don yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that mind disturbed by habitual propensities itself appears as an object, but there is no external object here.

original: de yang slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis gsungs pa /
translated: Also, the master Vasubandhu says:

original: 'di dag rnam par rig tsam nyid //
analyzed: 'di dag rnam par rig tsam nyid //
translated: These are just representations,

original: yod pa ma yin don snad phyir //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin don snad phyir //
translated: because non-existent objects appear.

original: dper na rab rib can dag gis //
analyzed: dper na rab rib can dag gis //
translated: For example, those with eye disease

original: skra zla la sogs med mthong bzhin //
analyzed: skra zla la sogs med mthong bzhin //
translated: Just as one sees the moon’s reflection in water,

original: zhes bya ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang kye rgyal ba'i sras dag khams gsum pa 'di dag ni sems tsam mo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang kye rgyal ba'i sras dag khams gsum pa 'di dag ni sems tsam mo zhes gsungs so //
translated: and the Bhagavān has said, “O sons of the Conqueror, these three realms are mind only.”

original: sems dang rnam par rig pa ni rnam grangs te /
analyzed: sems dang rnam par rig pa ni rnam grangs te /
translated: Mind and consciousness are synonyms.

original: ji skad du sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa dang rnam par rig pa ni rnam grangs so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa dang rnam par rig pa ni rnam grangs so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As it is said, “Mind, mentality, consciousness, and cognitive awareness are synonyms.”

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa med na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa med na /
translated: If form and so on do not exist,

original: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo las gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo las gsungs she na /
translated: why did the Bhagavān say in the sūtras that they exist?

original: de dag don dam par med mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag don dam par med mod kyi /
translated: They do not exist ultimately,

original: skye bo rnams 'dul ba'i phyir gsungs par gzung ste /
analyzed: skye bo rnams 'dul ba'i phyir gsungs par gzung ste /
translated: but the Bhagavān said that they exist in order to guide sentient beings.

original: ji skad du yang /
analyzed: ji skad du yang /
translated: As it is said,

original: gzugs sogs skye mched yod par ni //
analyzed: gzugs sogs skye mched yod par ni //
translated: The existence of the sense bases of form and so on🔽was taught by the Buddha

original: des 'dul ba yi skye bo la //🔽dgongs pa'i dbang gis gsungs pa ste //🔽rdzus te byung ba'i sems can bzhin //
analyzed: des 'dul ba yi skye bo la // dgongs pa'i dbang gis gsungs pa ste // rdzus te byung ba'i sems can bzhin //
translated: to those who are to be guided by it,

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: just as the existence of spontaneously born beings.

original: de lta mod kyi 'dir cung zad cig dpyad par bya ste /🔽gzugs la sogs pa'i yul 'di dag rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs par dngos por yod na de ltar bye brag pa rnams kyis yan lag can gyi ngo bor btags pa rags pa gcig pu zhig @17a * //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'dir cung zad cig dpyad par bya ste / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul 'di dag rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs par dngos por yod na de ltar bye brag pa rnams kyis yan lag can gyi ngo bor btags pa rags pa gcig pu zhig @17a * //
translated: Still, we will analyze this a little.

original: gam phra ba du mar 'gyur grangs /
analyzed: gam phra ba du mar 'gyur grangs /
translated: If these objects such as form exist as things other than consciousness, then they would be either one gross object, as the Vaiśeṣikas imagine, or many subtle particles.

original: de dag ni 'gal ba'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i gsum pa ni mi srid do //
analyzed: de dag ni 'gal ba'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i gsum pa ni mi srid do //
translated: But these are mutually exclusive, so a third alternative is impossible.

original: de la yan lag can gcig bu ni yul ma yin te /
analyzed: de la yan lag can gcig bu ni yul ma yin te /
translated: A single whole is not an object,

original: yan lag las ma gtogs par yan lag can 'dzin pa ni ma mthong ste /
analyzed: yan lag las ma gtogs par yan lag can 'dzin pa ni ma mthong ste /
translated: because a whole is not seen apart from its parts.

original: 'di ltar bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa thams cad la lto dang mgrin pa la sogs pa dang / rgyu dang spun gyi snal ma las ma gtogs par bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i yan lag can dus thams cad du nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa thams cad la lto dang mgrin pa la sogs pa dang / rgyu dang spun gyi snal ma las ma gtogs par bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i yan lag can dus thams cad du nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, in all cases, such as a pot and a cloth, a pot and a cloth are not experienced as wholes at any time apart from such parts as a belly and a neck, and the warp and woof of cloth.

original: phra rab du ma yang yul ma yin te /
analyzed: phra rab du ma yang yul ma yin te /
translated: Also, many subtle atoms are not the object field because they are not the object field of the five sense consciousnesses.

original: de yang 'di ltar yul du gyur pa na rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun ma reg par nye ba'i mthu tsam gyis 'dzin pa bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis khas blangs pa lta bu zhig gam /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar yul du gyur pa na rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun ma reg par nye ba'i mthu tsam gyis 'dzin pa bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis khas blangs pa lta bu zhig gam /
translated: If they are the object field, then do the subtle atoms that are the object field apprehend each other through the mere power of proximity without mutual contact, as the Vaibhāṣikas assert?

original: de dag phan tshun reg ste 'dug pa zhig yul du 'gyur grang /
analyzed: de dag phan tshun reg ste 'dug pa zhig yul du 'gyur grang /
translated: Or do they exist in mutual contact and become the object field?

original: reg pa dang ma reg pa 'gal bas gsum pa ni mi srid do ;🔽/ de la phra mo phrag can rnams kyang yul ma yin te /
analyzed: reg pa dang ma reg pa 'gal bas gsum pa ni mi srid do ; / de la phra mo phrag can rnams kyang yul ma yin te /
translated: The third is impossible because contact and noncontact are mutually exclusive.

original: tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis de dag mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis de dag mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even those who have many subtle atoms are not the object field because those with limited vision do not apprehend them.

original: de dag pha rol po nyid kyis kyang khas blangs te /
analyzed: de dag pha rol po nyid kyis kyang khas blangs te /
translated: The opponent also asserts that

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni bsags pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa yin no ;🔽/ de dag 'dus pa'ang yul ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni bsags pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa yin no ; / de dag 'dus pa'ang yul ma yin te /
translated: the five collections of consciousness focus on the aggregate.

original: rdzas su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, their aggregation is not the object field because it does not substantially exist.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar rdul phra rab rdzas su ma grub pa'i phyir te /🔽gal te rdul phra rab rdzas su grub na ni de dag so so tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul phra rab rdzas su ma grub pa'i phyir te / gal te rdul phra rab rdzas su grub na ni de dag so so tha dad pa'am /
translated: Because subtle particles are not substantially established.🔽If subtle particles were substantially established, it is possible that they would be objects either individually or in aggregation.

original: 'dus pa zhig yul du 'gyur ba srid na de ma grub na dpyad pa de nyid ga la 'jug / de ltar yang /
analyzed: 'dus pa zhig yul du 'gyur ba srid na de ma grub na dpyad pa de nyid ga la 'jug / de ltar yang /
translated: But if they are not established, how could that analysis apply?🔽As it is said:

original: de ni gcig na'ang yul min la //
analyzed: de ni gcig na'ang yul min la //
translated: If it is one, it is not an object.

original: phra rab rdul du ma'ang min //
analyzed: phra rab rdul du ma'ang min //
translated: If it is many, it is not a subtle particle.

original: de dag 'dus pa'ang ma yin te //
analyzed: de dag 'dus pa'ang ma yin te //
translated: It is not an aggregation of those.

original: 'di ltar rdul phran mi 'grub phyir //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul phran mi 'grub phyir // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because subtle particles are not established.

original: de ji ltar mi 'grub ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar mi 'grub ce na /
translated: How are they not established?

original: 'di ltar rdul rnams 'dus pa ni phan tshun reg cing sbyar ba'i rnam grangs yin na dbus na gnas pa'i rdul la phyogs drug na gnas pa'i rdul rnams kyis sbyor bas na /🔽phyogs so so tha dad pa nas sbyor ram /🔽'on te phyogs gcig nas spyor /
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul rnams 'dus pa ni phan tshun reg cing sbyar ba'i rnam grangs yin na dbus na gnas pa'i rdul la phyogs drug na gnas pa'i rdul rnams kyis sbyor bas na / phyogs so so tha dad pa nas sbyor ram / 'on te phyogs gcig nas spyor /
translated: In this way, the aggregation of particles is a synonym for mutual contact and connection. If the particle in the middle is connected by particles located in the six directions,🔽are they connected from each of the different directions?🔽Or are they connected from one direction?

original: phyogs tha dad nas so zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs tha dad nas so zhe na /
translated: If it is from different directions,

original: de'i tshe dbus na gnas pa'i rdul sbyor ba po'i bye brag @17b gis sbyar bar bya ba cha drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe dbus na gnas pa'i rdul sbyor ba po'i bye brag @17b gis sbyar bar bya ba cha drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the central particle would have six parts due to the distinctions of the particles that combine with it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gcig gi go gang yin pa der gzhan mi 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gcig gi go gang yin pa der gzhan mi 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because another particle does not arise in the location of one particle.

original: 'di ltar dbus na 'dug pa'i rdul phra rab kyi phyogs kyi ngos la sbyar ba'i rdul phra rab gcig gis non pa gang yin pa der rdul phra rab gzhan gyi go skabs med pas phyogs gzhan du gnas par bya dgos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar dbus na 'dug pa'i rdul phra rab kyi phyogs kyi ngos la sbyar ba'i rdul phra rab gcig gis non pa gang yin pa der rdul phra rab gzhan gyi go skabs med pas phyogs gzhan du gnas par bya dgos so //
translated: Thus, the location of the side of a subtle particle situated in the center is occupied by one subtle particle that combines with it. Since there is no opportunity for another subtle particle to arise there, it must be situated in another direction.

original: des na cha drug tu grub pas rdzas su yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: des na cha drug tu grub pas rdzas su yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since it has six parts, how could it be substantially established?

original: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na yang gong bu thams cad rdul phra rab tsam du 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na yang gong bu thams cad rdul phra rab tsam du 'gyur te /
translated: If you assert the second position, then all composites would be the size of a subtle particle.

original: 'di ltar rdul gcig gi go gang yin pa der drug po rnams 'du ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul gcig gi go gang yin pa der drug po rnams 'du ba'i phyir te /
translated: Thus, the six would combine in the location of one particle because the six would combine in the location of one particle.

original: go gcig pas gong bu thams cad rdul tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: go gcig pas gong bu thams cad rdul tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they occupy the same location, all composites would be the size of a particle.

original: ga las she na phan tshun tha dad pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ga las she na phan tshun tha dad pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Why? Because they are not different from each other.

original: 'di ltar rdul phra rab thams cad tha dad pa med pa'i phyir gong bu ri rab la sogs pa gang yang snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul phra rab thams cad tha dad pa med pa'i phyir gong bu ri rab la sogs pa gang yang snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because all subtle particles are not different, no mass such as Mount Meru would appear.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: drug gis cig car sbyar ba na //
analyzed: drug gis cig car sbyar ba na //
translated: If six particles simultaneously contact one,

original: phra rab rdul cha drug tu 'gyur //
analyzed: phra rab rdul cha drug tu 'gyur //
translated: the subtle particle would have six parts.

original: drug po dag gi go gcig na //
analyzed: drug po dag gi go gcig na //
translated: If the six are in one place,

original: gong bu rdul phran tsam du 'gyur //
analyzed: gong bu rdul phran tsam du 'gyur //
translated: the mass would be the size of a single particle.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: yan lag can dang yan lag du ma'ang rung /🔽cig car yul nyid du dgag pa dang / chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa'i lta ba gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad kyi rtsa ba rdul phra rab la gtan tshigs kyi rtsa ba gcig dang du ma dang bral ba bsgrub pa'i phyir dbu ma rgyan gyi bstan bcos las gsungs pa /
analyzed: yan lag can dang yan lag du ma'ang rung / cig car yul nyid du dgag pa dang / chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa'i lta ba gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad kyi rtsa ba rdul phra rab la gtan tshigs kyi rtsa ba gcig dang du ma dang bral ba bsgrub pa'i phyir dbu ma rgyan gyi bstan bcos las gsungs pa /
translated: Whether it has parts or is partless,🔽the refutation of it as an object of the six consciousnesses is stated in the treatise Dispelling Objections, and the view that all phenomena are essenceless is set forth in the treatise The Essence of the Middle Way.

original: 'di ltab cung zad cig brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltab cung zad cig brjod par bya ste /
translated: In order to establish the root of all entities, the subtle particle, as free from being one or many, the root of reasoning, I will say a little about this.

original: de las ji skad du /
analyzed: de las ji skad du /
translated: In that regard, it is said:

original: sbyar ba dang ni bskor ba'am //
analyzed: sbyar ba dang ni bskor ba'am //
translated: Whether it is connected or not,

original: bar med rnam par gnas kyang rung //
analyzed: bar med rnam par gnas kyang rung //
translated: whether it is without interval or not,

original: dbus nas rdul phran rdul gcig la //
analyzed: dbus nas rdul phran rdul gcig la //
translated: in the middle, with respect to one atom,

original: bltas pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa //🔽rdul phran gzhan la blta ba yang //
analyzed: bltas pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa // rdul phran gzhan la blta ba yang //
translated: whatever is the nature of the view,🔽if it is said that the view of another atom

original: de nyid gal te yin brjod na //
analyzed: de nyid gal te yin brjod na //
translated: is just that,

original: de lta yin na ji ltar yang //
analyzed: de lta yin na ji ltar yang //
translated: then, in that case, how could

original: sa chu la sogs rgyas gyur ram //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sa chu la sogs rgyas gyur ram // zhes gsungs so //
translated: earth, water, and so on, expand?

original: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: phyogs bcu na rnam par gnas pa'i rdul phra mo rnams kyi dbus na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab gang yin pa de shar phyogs na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab la bltas pa'i cha de gnyis kyis phyogs lhag ma na @18a * //
analyzed: phyogs bcu na rnam par gnas pa'i rdul phra mo rnams kyi dbus na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab gang yin pa de shar phyogs na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab la bltas pa'i cha de gnyis kyis phyogs lhag ma na @18a * //
translated: With respect to the subtle atoms situated in the ten directions, whatever is the subtle atom situated in the middle, the part that is the view of the subtle atom situated in the east, by virtue of those two, the remaining directions,

original: gnas pa'i rdul phra rab rnams la bltas pa yang yin na ni de'i tshe cha de la bltas pa yin pa'i phyir shar phyogs na gnas pa'i rdul ltar phyogs lhag ma na gnas pa rnams don ji lta ba bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rdul phra rab rnams la bltas pa yang yin na ni de'i tshe cha de la bltas pa yin pa'i phyir shar phyogs na gnas pa'i rdul ltar phyogs lhag ma na gnas pa rnams don ji lta ba bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the case that the subtle particles that are located in one place are seen, then at that time, since it would be seeing a part, those located in other directions would not be seen as they are, like the subtle particles located in the east.

original: des na cha shas sna tshogs med pa'i phyir sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ji ltar rgyas par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na cha shas sna tshogs med pa'i phyir sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ji ltar rgyas par 'gyur /
translated: Thus, since there is no diversity of parts, how could the circle of the earth and so on expand?

original: 'on te gzhan la blta ba'i cha tha dad par 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan la blta ba'i cha tha dad par 'dod do zhe na /
translated: But if you assert that it is different in that it is seen by others,

original: blta bar bya ba'i grangs bzhin du lta ba po'i cha bcur gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: blta bar bya ba'i grangs bzhin du lta ba po'i cha bcur gyur pa yin no //
translated: then the seer would have ten parts, just as there are objects to be seen.

original: des na gcig nyid med pa la du ma'ang med do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: des na gcig nyid med pa la du ma'ang med do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Thus, since there is no singularity, there is also no multiplicity.

original: de ni de la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the latter depends on the former.

original: de ltar rdul phra rab rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi phyir yan lag can gyi rdzas la sogs pa phyi rol pas brtags pa dang / mig dang gzugs la sogs pa thams cad rang bzhin dang bral bas tshegs med par grub ste de yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar rdul phra rab rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi phyir yan lag can gyi rdzas la sogs pa phyi rol pas brtags pa dang / mig dang gzugs la sogs pa thams cad rang bzhin dang bral bas tshegs med par grub ste de yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, because the subtle particle has no intrinsic reality, all that is imputed by the non-Buddhist schools, such as the whole, substance, and so on, and all that is imputed by the Buddhist schools, such as the eye, form, and so on, are established without difficulty as being devoid of intrinsic reality.🔽As it has been said:

original: rdun  phran rang bzhin med grub pa //
analyzed: rdun  phran rang bzhin med grub pa //
translated: The subtle particle is established as having no intrinsic reality.

original: de phyir mig dang rdzas la sogs //
analyzed: de phyir mig dang rdzas la sogs //
translated: Therefore, the eye, substance, and so on,🔽all that is spoken of by ourselves and others,

original: bdag dang gzhan smras mad po dag / rang bzhin med par mngon pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan smras mad po dag / rang bzhin med par mngon pa yin // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: are clearly seen to be devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: 'di ltar mig dang gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga dang / dbang po lnga po rnams ni rdul phra rab bsags pa yin par brjod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig dang gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga dang / dbang po lnga po rnams ni rdul phra rab bsags pa yin par brjod la /
translated: Thus, the five objects such as the eye and form, and the five sense organs are said to be an aggregation of subtle particles.

original: de med na de dag kyang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de med na de dag kyang mi rung ngo //
translated: If they do not exist, they are not tenable.

original: 'di ltar mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung do zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la brten pa dang / dmigs pa rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga yang de med na ci la dmigs te skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung do zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la brten pa dang / dmigs pa rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga yang de med na ci la dmigs te skye bar 'gyur /
translated: Thus, in the statement, “The eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms,” the five sense consciousnesses that are the bases and the focal objects would not arise if they did not exist.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga med na de ma thag pa'i rkyen des mdon par bsgrub pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang mi 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga med na de ma thag pa'i rkyen des mdon par bsgrub pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang mi 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: If the five sense consciousnesses did not exist, the mental consciousness that is established by the immediately preceding condition would also be untenable.

original: de ltar tshogs drug po ma grub na rnam par shes pa de dag 'das ma thag pa'i yid kyang mi 'grub pa ste /🔽drug bo 'das ma thag pa yi //
analyzed: de ltar tshogs drug po ma grub na rnam par shes pa de dag 'das ma thag pa'i yid kyang mi 'grub pa ste / drug bo 'das ma thag pa yi //
translated: Thus, if the six collections are not established, the immediately preceding mental consciousness is also not established.🔽The consciousness that is the immediately preceding

original: rnam shes gang yin de yid do //🔽zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam shes gang yin de yid do // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: of the six is the mental faculty.

original: de ltar sems kyi rang bzhin ma grub na tshor ba la sogs pa'i sems las byung ba yang rang bzhin med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar sems kyi rang bzhin ma grub na tshor ba la sogs pa'i sems las byung ba yang rang bzhin med pa nyid de /
translated: Thus, if the nature of the mind is not established, the mental factors such as feeling also have no nature.

original: 'di ltar de dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pas de la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pas de la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is established and happy in the same way, it depends on that.

original: @18b de ltar gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ma grub na mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang rang bzhin med pa nyid de /
analyzed: @18b de ltar gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ma grub na mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang rang bzhin med pa nyid de /
translated: Thus, if form, mind, and mental factors are not established, the non-associated compositional factors also lack intrinsic nature,

original: de dag ni de dag gi gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni de dag gi gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the states of those.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yang 'byung ba chen po rnams la rag las pa'i phyir rang bzhin med par gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yang 'byung ba chen po rnams la rag las pa'i phyir rang bzhin med par gsal ba yin no //
translated: Non-indicative form is also clearly shown to lack intrinsic nature because it depends on the great elements.

original: de bzhin du rdul gnyis pa la sogs pa'i yan lag can gyi rdzas dang / gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams dang / 'degs pa dang sdud pa la sogs pa'i las rnams dang / spyi dad khyad par la sogs pa gzhan gyis brtags pa'i dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par gsal ba nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdul gnyis pa la sogs pa'i yan lag can gyi rdzas dang / gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams dang / 'degs pa dang sdud pa la sogs pa'i las rnams dang / spyi dad khyad par la sogs pa gzhan gyis brtags pa'i dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par gsal ba nyid de /
translated: In the same way, the substances of the second particle and so on that possess parts, the qualities such as form and sound, the actions such as lifting and contracting, and the other imputed things such as generality and particularity are clearly shown to lack intrinsic nature.

original: de dag ni des dngos dang rgyud de brtsams pa dang / brten pa dang nye bar brten pa la sogs pas dngos dang brgyud de 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni des dngos dang rgyud de brtsams pa dang / brten pa dang nye bar brten pa la sogs pas dngos dang brgyud de 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are related to the object and the continuum, directly and indirectly, because they are produced from it, they are supported by it, and they are closely related to it.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:🔽Its nature, its production, its qualities, its self,

original: de yi rang bzhin de brtsams dang // de yi yon tan de las bdag / de yi spyi dang khyad par yang //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin de brtsams dang // de yi yon tan de las bdag / de yi spyi dang khyad par yang //
translated: its universals and particulars,

original: de dag de dang ldan pa can //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag de dang ldan pa can // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are related to it.

original: gzhan gyis brtags pa'i nam mkha' dang dus dad phyogs dang yid la sogs pa rnams kyang gcig dang du ma dang 'gal ba nyid de ;
analyzed: gzhan gyis brtags pa'i nam mkha' dang dus dad phyogs dang yid la sogs pa rnams kyang gcig dang du ma dang 'gal ba nyid de ;
translated: The other imagined entities, such as space, time, direction, mind, and so on, are also contradictory with being one or many.

original: phyogs tha dad pa can gyi bum pa la sogs pa dang 'brel pa de dag gcig dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de gzhan dang 'brel pa can yang yin na de gcig pu'i bdag nyid yin pa bzhin du gzhan yang de dang tha dad pa ma🔽yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs tha dad pa can gyi bum pa la sogs pa dang 'brel pa de dag gcig dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de gzhan dang 'brel pa can yang yin na de gcig pu'i bdag nyid yin pa bzhin du gzhan yang de dang tha dad pa ma🔽yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The relation of those with a pot, etc., which have different directions, is that whatever is the nature of the relation with one is also the relation with another, and just as it is the nature of one, it is not different from the other.

original: 'on te phyogs tha dad na ni rang bzhin de nyid gzhan dang 'brel pa can yang ma yin par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te phyogs tha dad na ni rang bzhin de nyid gzhan dang 'brel pa can yang ma yin par yang 'gyur te /
translated: But if they are different, then that nature would not be related to the other.

original: de'i tshe gzhon bu du ma na 'dug pa'i rgya shug gi 'bras bu ltar gcig nyid ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe gzhon bu du ma na 'dug pa'i rgya shug gi 'bras bu ltar gcig nyid ma grub pa'o //
translated: At that time, like a jujube fruit in the mouth of a many-toothed animal, it would not be established as one.

original: de skad du yang /🔽tha dad phyogs dang 'brel pas na //
analyzed: de skad du yang / tha dad phyogs dang 'brel pas na //
translated: As it is said:🔽How could the pervaders, related to different directions,

original: khyab rnams gcig pur ga la 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: khyab rnams gcig pur ga la 'gyur // zhes gsungs te /
translated: be one?

original: de ltar gcig nyid med la des na du ma nyid dang yang 'gal te /
analyzed: de ltar gcig nyid med la des na du ma nyid dang yang 'gal te /
translated: Thus, since there is no oneness, there is also a contradiction with multiplicity,

original: de ni sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is the antecedent.

original: de yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang gsungs pa /
translated: That is also stated:

original: gang la gcig nyid yod min pa //
analyzed: gang la gcig nyid yod min pa //
translated: That which has no oneness

original: de la du ma nyid kyang med //🔽ces pa'o // kha cig gang zag ces bya ba skad cig ma dang @19a * //
analyzed: de la du ma nyid kyang med // ces pa'o // kha cig gang zag ces bya ba skad cig ma dang @19a * //
translated: has no multiplicity either.

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa gnyi gar bstan du med pa'i dngos bor khas len pa de dag la yang dngos po gnyis med par sla ba nyid de /
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa gnyi gar bstan du med pa'i dngos bor khas len pa de dag la yang dngos po gnyis med par sla ba nyid de /
translated: Some accept that the so-called person is an imperceptible entity that is neither momentary nor not momentary. For them, it is easy to understand that there are not two entities.

original: 'di ltar skad cig pa yin na ni snga ma zhig las rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan skye ba'i phyir du ma nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig pa yin na ni snga ma zhig las rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan skye ba'i phyir du ma nyid yin la /
translated: Thus, if it is momentary, it is multiple because it arises as different from the previous one.

original: skad cig pa ma yin na ni snga ma nyid ma zhig pa dang gzhan mi skye ba'i phyir gcig pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: skad cig pa ma yin na ni snga ma nyid ma zhig pa dang gzhan mi skye ba'i phyir gcig pa nyid yin no //
translated: If it is not momentary, it is singular because the previous one does not disintegrate and another does not arise.

original: de gnyi gar bstan du med pa ni rang nyid kyis gcig dang du ma dang bral bar smras pa yin no //🔽de yang / skad cig skad cig ma yin par //
analyzed: de gnyi gar bstan du med pa ni rang nyid kyis gcig dang du ma dang bral bar smras pa yin no // de yang / skad cig skad cig ma yin par //
translated: That both are imperceptible is to say that it is free from singularity and multiplicity by itself.🔽And that is stated:

original: gang zag bstan du mi rung bar //🔽gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang // bral ba nyid du gsal ba yin //
analyzed: gang zag bstan du mi rung bar // gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang // bral ba nyid du gsal ba yin //
translated: The person is not taught to be momentary or not momentary.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is clear that it is free from the nature of singularity and multiplicity.

original: de lta mod kyi rnam pa gzhan du dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi rnam pa gzhan du dpyad par bya ste /
translated: However, it should be analyzed in another way.

original: 'di ltar dngos po'i mtshan nyid la khyad par byed pa ni don byed nus pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po'i mtshan nyid la khyad par byed pa ni don byed nus pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the characteristic of an entity is to be able to perform a function.

original: pha rol pos khas blangs pa'i rtag pa'i dngos po thams cad la de mi srid do //
analyzed: pha rol pos khas blangs pa'i rtag pa'i dngos po thams cad la de mi srid do //
translated: That is not possible for any permanent entity accepted by the opponent.

original: yang dag par na rim dang cig car gyis don byed nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par na rim dang cig car gyis don byed nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in reality, it is not tenable that they function sequentially or all at once.

original: 'di ltar re zhig rgyu rim can ma yin pas rim gyis don byed par mi 'thad da //
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig rgyu rim can ma yin pas rim gyis don byed par mi 'thad da //
translated: In that case, it is not tenable that they function sequentially because the cause is not sequential.

original: rgyu nus pa thogs pa med par yod pa yang 'bras bu res 'ga' mi bskyed pa me srid la rgyu ma tshang pa med pa yang nges 'ga' de las mi 'byung ba mi srid pas ji ltar rim gyis don byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu nus pa thogs pa med par yod pa yang 'bras bu res 'ga' mi bskyed pa me srid la rgyu ma tshang pa med pa yang nges 'ga' de las mi 'byung ba mi srid pas ji ltar rim gyis don byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if the cause exists without impediment to its ability, it is impossible that it sometimes does not generate the effect. If the cause is complete and there is no deficiency, it is impossible that it sometimes does not arise. Thus, how could it function sequentially?

original: yang na ni bskyed par 'dod pa'i dus bzhin du gzhan du bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: yang na ni bskyed par 'dod pa'i dus bzhin du gzhan du bskyed pa'am /
translated: Either it generates the effect at one time, like the time when it is asserted to generate the effect,

original: yang na ni mi skyed par 'dod pa'i dus bzhin du gzhan du yang mi bskyed par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang na ni mi skyed par 'dod pa'i dus bzhin du gzhan du yang mi bskyed par blta bar bya ste /
translated: or it does not generate the effect at another time, like the time when it is asserted not to generate the effect.

original: dngos po rtag pa gzhan gyis bogs dbyung du med pa rnams ni de la ltos pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rtag pa gzhan gyis bogs dbyung du med pa rnams ni de la ltos pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is untenable that things that are permanent and cannot be enhanced by anything else depend on that.

original: cig car byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: cig car byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it function all at once.

original: de'i don byed pa'i rang bzhin de lta bu zhig rtag tu rjes su 'brang na 'bras bu bskyed pa dang mi 'bral ba'i phyir des bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu thams cad dus rtag tu skye ba'i phyir nam mkha'i khams su mi shong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i don byed pa'i rang bzhin de lta bu zhig rtag tu rjes su 'brang na 'bras bu bskyed pa dang mi 'bral ba'i phyir des bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu thams cad dus rtag tu skye ba'i phyir nam mkha'i khams su mi shong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If such a nature that performs a function always follows, then because it is inseparable from generating an effect, all effects that it generates would always arise, and the realm of space would not contain them.

original: ci ste mi 'brang na ni de nyid rtag pa nyid nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: ci ste mi 'brang na ni de nyid rtag pa nyid nyams pa yin no //
translated: But if it does not follow, then that very permanence is undermined.

original: de ltar don byed nus pa khyab par byed pa log na dngos po'i mtshan nyid khyab par bya ba yang ldog pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de ltar don byed nus pa khyab par byed pa log na dngos po'i mtshan nyid khyab par bya ba yang ldog pa kho na ste /
translated: In that case, if the pervader, the ability to perform a function, is refuted, then the characteristic of a thing, the pervaded, is also refuted.

original: gzhan du na des ma khyab par thal bang @19b 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na des ma khyab par thal bang @19b 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it follows that it is not pervaded by that.

original: tshul de ltar na rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i dngos po thams cad la gcig pa nyid med pas du ma nyid kyang med pa ste /
analyzed: tshul de ltar na rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i dngos po thams cad la gcig pa nyid med pas du ma nyid kyang med pa ste /
translated: In that case, since all things, permanent and impermanent, are not the same, they are also not multiple.

original: de ni de sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because multiplicity is preceded by that.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: dngos po gang gang rnams dpyad na /
analyzed: dngos po gang gang rnams dpyad na /
translated: Whatever things are analyzed,

original: de dang de la gcig nyid med //🔽gang la gcig nyid yod min pa //
analyzed: de dang de la gcig nyid med // gang la gcig nyid yod min pa //
translated: And in that and that, there is no singularity.

original: de la du ma nyid kyang med //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de la du ma nyid kyang med // ces gsungs so //
translated: And where there is no singularity,🔽There is also no multiplicity.

original: de gnyis las ma gtogs pa'i rnam pa gsum pa dag kyang mi srid de /
analyzed: de gnyis las ma gtogs pa'i rnam pa gsum pa dag kyang mi srid de /
translated: Apart from those two, a third alternative is also impossible.

original: de gnyis phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir dngos po'i rigs la khyab par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir dngos po'i rigs la khyab par byed pa yin no //
translated: Because those two are mutually exclusive, they pervade all types of entities.

original: de yang ji skad du /
analyzed: de yang ji skad du /
translated: And that is also stated:

original: gcig dang du ma ma gtogs par //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from one and many,

original: rnam pa gzhan dang ldan pa yi //🔽dngos po mi rung 'di gnyis ni //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan dang ldan pa yi // dngos po mi rung 'di gnyis ni //
translated: An entity with another nature🔽Is not possible,

original: phan tshun spangs te gnas phyir ro //🔽zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas phyir ro // zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because those two are mutually exclusive.

original: de ltar yang dag par gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin log na /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag par gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin log na /
translated: Thus, if the nature of singularity and multiplicity is reversed,

original: gzugs brnyan ltar dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi tshogs ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ltar dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi tshogs ldog pa yin te /
translated: Like a reflection, the nature of an entity is reversed.

original: de de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is its nature.

original: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa yang dngos po nyid du rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa yang dngos po nyid du rung ba ma yin te /
translated: Also, a reflection and so on is not suitable as an entity.

original: 'di ltar bzhin nyid me long gi nang du zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar bzhin nyid me long gi nang du zhugs pa'am /
translated: Thus, is the reflection of the face in the mirror the face itself?

original: gzugs brnyan gzhan zhig der byung ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gzhan zhig der byung ba'am /
translated: Or is it another form?

original: me long la mig gi 'od gred  nas bzhin nyid mthong ba'am /
analyzed: me long la mig gi 'od gred  nas bzhin nyid mthong ba'am /
translated: Or is it the face itself seen by the light of the eye reflected in the mirror?

original: rnam par shes pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur grang na /
translated: Or is it consciousness itself?

original: de la re zhig gzugs gzhan zhig der 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig gzugs gzhan zhig der 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not another form,

original: lus can rnams thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir yul gcig pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus can rnams thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir yul gcig pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is illogical that embodied beings would have the same object because they are impeded.

original: me long la gred  pa'i 'od kyis bzhin mthong ba yang ma yin te /🔽'di ltar bzhin kha shar du bltas pa bzhin du gzugs brnyan nub tu bltas par snang ba la /
analyzed: me long la gred  pa'i 'od kyis bzhin mthong ba yang ma yin te / 'di ltar bzhin kha shar du bltas pa bzhin du gzugs brnyan nub tu bltas par snang ba la /
translated: It is not that the face is seen by the light reflected in the mirror,

original: bzhin chen po gzugs brnyan chung dur snang ba dang / chu 'gram la sogs pa'i ljon shing gyen du bltas pa rtse mo thur du bltas par snang ba la sogs pas rnam par mi mthun par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhin chen po gzugs brnyan chung dur snang ba dang / chu 'gram la sogs pa'i ljon shing gyen du bltas pa rtse mo thur du bltas par snang ba la sogs pas rnam par mi mthun par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reflection of the face appears to face west when the face faces east, the reflection of a large face appears small and the reflection of a tree growing on a riverbank appears to grow upside down.

original: rang gi bzhin nyid du zhugs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi bzhin nyid du zhugs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it enter into its own nature,

original: gong du thal ba'i skyon thams cad yod pa'i phyir dang / gzugs brnyan ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gong du thal ba'i skyon thams cad yod pa'i phyir dang / gzugs brnyan ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because all the faults of the above reductio would ensue, and because it would not be a reflection.

original: shes pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it consciousness itself,

original: @20a * // lus can ma yin pa yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @20a * // lus can ma yin pa yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not embodied and does not abide in a place.

original: 'di'i spros pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i spros pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos su blta bar bya'o //
translated: The elaborate version of this argument should be consulted in the Madhyamaka treatises.

original: de ltar na ngo bo nyid med de sems kyi snang ba tsam nyid du bstan pa 'dis chos la bdag med pa nyid du 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na ngo bo nyid med de sems kyi snang ba tsam nyid du bstan pa 'dis chos la bdag med pa nyid du 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, by this demonstration that there is no reality and that it is merely the appearance of mind, one enters into the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de skad du yang dbyig gnyen gyi zhal nas /
analyzed: de skad du yang dbyig gnyen gyi zhal nas /
translated: Thus, Vasubandhu says,

original: rnam par rig ba tsam nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos gang yang me dar rig nas 'jug go //
analyzed: rnam par rig ba tsam nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos gang yang me dar rig nas 'jug go //
translated: Having understood that consciousness only is the nature of phenomena such as form, and that there is no external object, one enters into the reality of consciousness only.

original: gal te chos rnams thams cad du med na rnam par rig pa tsam du ji ltar gzhag ce na /
analyzed: gal te chos rnams thams cad du med na rnam par rig pa tsam du ji ltar gzhag ce na /
translated: If all phenomena do not exist, how can you posit mere representations?

original: chos ni rnam pa thams cad du med pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: chos ni rnam pa thams cad du med pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Phenomena are not completely nonexistent.

original: gang byis pa rnams kyis chos rnams kyi rang bzhin kun du brtags pa'i bdag nyid des de dag med kyi /
analyzed: gang byis pa rnams kyis chos rnams kyi rang bzhin kun du brtags pa'i bdag nyid des de dag med kyi /
translated: They do not exist in the way that foolish beings imagine that phenomena exist, that is, as having an intrinsic nature.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul gang yin pa brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid kyis ni med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul gang yin pa brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid kyis ni med pa ma yin no //
translated: But they are not nonexistent in the way that the objects of the buddhas, which are inexpressible, are nonexistent.

original: don 'di gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud las kyang gsungs te /🔽dngos po thams cad dang bral pa //
analyzed: don 'di gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud las kyang gsungs te / dngos po thams cad dang bral pa //
translated: This point is also stated in the Guhyasamaja Tantra:🔽Free from all things,

original: phung po khams dang skye mched kyi //
analyzed: phung po khams dang skye mched kyi //
translated: Free from the aggregates, elements, and sense bases,

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam spangs pa //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam spangs pa //
translated: Free from the apprehended and the apprehender,

original: chos bdag med pa mnyam pa nyid //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa mnyam pa nyid //
translated: The equality of the selflessness of phenomena,

original: rang sems gdod nas ma skyes pa //
analyzed: rang sems gdod nas ma skyes pa //
translated: The primordially unborn mind itself

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Is the nature of emptiness.

original: zhes bya ba dang / lad kar gshegs pa las kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / lad kar gshegs pa las kyang /
translated: And in the Laṅkāvatāra Sūtra:🔽External reality does not exist

original: ji ltar byis pas rnam brtags ltar //🔽phyi rol don du yod ma yin //
analyzed: ji ltar byis pas rnam brtags ltar //🔽phyi rol don du yod ma yin //
translated: As it is imagined by the childish.

original: bag chags kyis ni dkrugs pa'i sems //
analyzed: bag chags kyis ni dkrugs pa'i sems //
translated: The mind, disturbed by latent impressions,

original: don ltar snang ba yang dag 'byung //
analyzed: don ltar snang ba yang dag 'byung //
translated: arises as if it were an object.🔽And in the Tattvasamgraha it is said:

original: zhes bya ba dang / tattva sam gra ha las kyang rigs kyi bu rang gi sems de ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag cing 'od gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / tattva sam gra ha las kyang rigs kyi bu rang gi sems de ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag cing 'od gsal ba yin te /
translated: “Son of noble family, that mind is naturally pure and luminous.

original: de la ji lta ji ltar brtags pa de lta de ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la ji lta ji ltar brtags pa de lta de ltar 'gyur te /
translated: It becomes just as it is imagined.

original: dper na snam bu dkar po la ston gyis kha bsgyur ba bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dper na snam bu dkar po la ston gyis kha bsgyur ba bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: For example, it is like a white cloth being dyed blue.

original: shin tu spros pas cho ga ste /
analyzed: shin tu spros pas cho ga ste /
translated: The ritual with extensive elaboration

original: da ni gnyug ma nyid brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni gnyug ma nyid brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now the innate nature will be described.

original: yul rnams ma lus sten byed pa //
analyzed: yul rnams ma lus sten byed pa //
translated: Engaging with all objects

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa des yul rnams la nye bar longs spyod pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa des yul rnams la nye bar longs spyod pa ste /
translated: means enjoying objects in that way.

original: de nyid gcig tu nges pa'i dka' thub bo //
analyzed: de nyid gcig tu nges pa'i dka' thub bo //
translated: That itself is the ascetic practice of certainty.

original: 'da' dka' ba ni 'dir gcig tu 'da' bar bya ba ma @20b yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'da' dka' ba ni 'dir gcig tu 'da' bar bya ba ma @20b yin pa'o //
translated: The difficult to transgress is not to be transgressed in any way.

original: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for “whatever” and so on,

original: las rnams thams cad ni lus la sogs pa'i las rnams te /
analyzed: las rnams thams cad ni lus la sogs pa'i las rnams te /
translated: all actions are the actions of the body and so on.

original: las de dag la shes rab ces bya ba thos pa dad bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung bas sbyar ba ste rnam par dpyad de bya ba'o //
analyzed: las de dag la shes rab ces bya ba thos pa dad bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung bas sbyar ba ste rnam par dpyad de bya ba'o //
translated: Those actions are called “wisdom” because they are applied by means of wisdom arisen from hearing, reflection, and meditation, that is, they are done after analysis.

original: de yang stong pa'i gnas su sbyar //
analyzed: de yang stong pa'i gnas su sbyar //
translated: And that is applied in the emptiness of the cause, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu la sogs pa stong pa nyid du sbyar pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu la sogs pa stong pa nyid du sbyar pa ste /
translated: That is, it is applied in the emptiness of the cause, etc.,

original: ye shes kyis bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyis bsgom par bya'o //
translated: and should be cultivated by means of intuition.

original: bdag gzhan zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gzhan zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “For the sake of self and other” means for the sake of oneself and others.

original: rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba la sogs pa la gzugs zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba la sogs pa la gzugs zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams so //
translated: “Non-conceptually” and so on. “Form” means things.

original: shes rab ni stod pa nyid de mtshungs pa ni gsal ba'i don yin la /
analyzed: shes rab ni stod pa nyid de mtshungs pa ni gsal ba'i don yin la /
translated: “Wisdom” means the same as “intuition.”

original: der rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems kyis sbyar te zhes bya ba snga ma dad 'brel to //
analyzed: der rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems kyis sbyar te zhes bya ba snga ma dad 'brel to //
translated: “Applied” is connected with the previous “with a non-conceptual mind.”

original: dogs med ni 'jigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dogs med ni 'jigs pa med pa'o //
translated: “Fearless” means without fear.

original: spyod pa ni rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ni rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: “Practice” means arrangement.

original: kun spyod ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ste bdag med pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rnam par gzhag pa nyid dka' thub bo //
analyzed: kun spyod ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ste bdag med pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rnam par gzhag pa nyid dka' thub bo //
translated: Conduct is the circle of the mandala, and the very arrangement of the mandala circle of selflessness is austerity.

original: shes rab thabs ni stong pa nyid nyi sems te /
analyzed: shes rab thabs ni stong pa nyid nyi sems te /
translated: Wisdom and means are the mind of emptiness and compassion, respectively.

original: de ma gtogs pa ni rnam pa gzhan du sems g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: de ma gtogs pa ni rnam pa gzhan du sems g-yo ba'o //
translated: Apart from those, the mind moves in other ways.

original: des pa ni dka' thub ces bya ba dang / ster ba zhes bu gnyi ga dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: des pa ni dka' thub ces bya ba dang / ster ba zhes bu gnyi ga dang sbyar ro //
translated: Gentleness is austerity, and giving is connected with both.

original: byang chub chen po ni yad dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /
analyzed: byang chub chen po ni yad dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /
translated: Great enlightenment is perfect enlightenment,

original: mchog tu zag pa med pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: mchog tu zag pa med pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: the supreme, undefiled bliss.

original: ster ba ni shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid kyi nges pa'i dka' thub des par ster ba'o //
analyzed: ster ba ni shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid kyi nges pa'i dka' thub des par ster ba'o //
translated: Giving is the bestowal of that by the austerity of certainty that is the nature of wisdom and means.

original: byang chub de yang brtson 'grus kyis 'thob par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub de yang brtson 'grus kyis 'thob par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that enlightenment is attained through effort, he says:

original: rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: non-conceptuality, and so on.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas rnam par mi rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas rnam par mi rtog pa yin la /
translated: Non-conceptuality is free from conceptuality.🔽

original: des dngos po rnams kyi rjes su 'gro zhing 'jug pa'i dang tshul gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: des dngos po rnams kyi rjes su 'gro zhing 'jug pa'i dang tshul gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has the mode of operation of following after and engaging with things is so-called.

original: rnal 'byor pa ni de lta bur gyur ba'i sgrub pa po ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni de lta bur gyur ba'i sgrub pa po ste /
translated: The yogi/nī is the practitioner who is like that.

original: mngon par brtson pa ni byang chub tu 'bad pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par brtson pa ni byang chub tu 'bad pa'o //
translated: Exertion is striving for enlightenment.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni phud po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni phud po la sogs pa'o //
translated: All means the rest, etc.

original: 'byung ba ni yang dag pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba ni yang dag pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: Emergence is the limit of reality.

original: don dam pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Up to the nature of the ultimate.

original: ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is it?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: Wisdom is emptiness.

original: pha rol ni @21a * //
analyzed: pha rol ni @21a * //
translated: The limit is the end.

original: mtha' ste / rang bzhin med pa'i mtha' der phyin pa ni son pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' ste / rang bzhin med pa'i mtha' der phyin pa ni son pa'o //
translated: Arriving at that end which is the absence of intrinsic reality is reaching.

original: yang na pha rol gyi sgras ni snyoms par 'jug par brjod par bya la /
analyzed: yang na pha rol gyi sgras ni snyoms par 'jug par brjod par bya la /
translated: Alternatively, the word “limit” should be taken to mean meditative equipoise.

original: de nyid ni shes rab ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid ni shes rab ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: That itself is the meaning of “wisdom.”

original: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: When, etc.

original: 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas shing byung bas na 'dus byas te phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas shing byung bas na 'dus byas te phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The term “conditioned” refers to the aggregates, etc., because they are produced and arise from causes and conditions.

original: tshul ni de'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: tshul ni de'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The term “mode” refers to their form.

original: rnam par mi rtog sems kyis zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang bral ba'i sems gang rnams kyi yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog sems kyis zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang bral ba'i sems gang rnams kyi yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The phrase “with a nonconceptual mind” means that it is so called because it belongs to those whose minds are free from conceptualization.

original: me long lta bur rab shes pa //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: me long lta bur rab shes pa // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is to be known as a mirror.

original: rab shes ni shes rab ste me long ni me long can no //
analyzed: rab shes ni shes rab ste me long ni me long can no //
translated: The term “to be known” means to be known by wisdom. The term “mirror” means a mirror.

original: lta bu ni 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: lta bu ni 'dra ba ste /
translated: The term “like” means similar.

original: 'di ltar 'dus byas kyi tshul rnams shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dus byas kyi tshul rnams shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad na /
translated: Thus, when the modes of the conditioned are investigated by wisdom,

original: gsal zhing ro gcig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsal zhing ro gcig par 'gyur te /
translated: they become clear and of one taste,

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa dbyer med pa nyid do //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa dbyer med pa nyid do //
translated: because the conventional and ultimate truths are inseparable.

original: des 'di skad du shes rab kyi tshul gang gis 'dus byas kyi tshul de dang de gang yin pa blta bar bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des 'di skad du shes rab kyi tshul gang gis 'dus byas kyi tshul de dang de gang yin pa blta bar bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is what is meant by the statement, “The mode of wisdom by which one should investigate the modes of the conditioned.”

original: des ni shes rab bsten pa yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des ni shes rab bsten pa yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: That is the reliance on wisdom.

original: shes rab ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi blo'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi blo'o //
translated: Wisdom is the mind that has the nature of hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: bsten pa ni 'dus byas kyi tshul rnams sam thabs yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: bsten pa ni 'dus byas kyi tshul rnams sam thabs yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Reliance is to be seen as the methods or the modes of the conditioned.

original: blo des ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dpyad na thabs rnams kyis kyang don ji lta ba bzhin du rnyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: blo des ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dpyad na thabs rnams kyis kyang don ji lta ba bzhin du rnyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if one analyzes things as they are with that mind, one will find the meaning as it is through the methods.

original: des na blo dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa po thams cad bsgrub par nus so zhes bya bar dgongs so //🔽kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag dbyer med par rtogs pa 'di nyid dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir glog dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: des na blo dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa po thams cad bsgrub par nus so zhes bya bar dgongs so // kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag dbyer med par rtogs pa 'di nyid dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir glog dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: Therefore, it is intended that all wise practitioners are able to accomplish it.🔽In order to teach just this realization of the inseparability of the conventional and the ultimate through an example, he says “like lightning” and so on.

original: glog dang chu bur zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi rtag pa nyid bstan pas stong pa nyid la 'jug pa ston pa yin la /
analyzed: glog dang chu bur zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi rtag pa nyid bstan pas stong pa nyid la 'jug pa ston pa yin la /
translated: Here, “lightning” and “bubbles” teach impermanence, and thus they teach the entry into emptiness.

original: lhag mas ni dngos su ston to //
analyzed: lhag mas ni dngos su ston to //
translated: The rest is self-evident.

original: smin zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi gzhir gyur pa'i kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: smin zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi gzhir gyur pa'i kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: “ Ripened” refers to the store-consciousness which is the basis of the latent impressions of action and the afflictions.

original: sgyu ma zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i ra skyes dang glang po che dang rta la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i ra skyes dang glang po che dang rta la sogs pa ste /
translated: “ Illusion” refers to the magical creations of elephants, horses, etc.

original: de dag rnam pa du mar snang yang don dam par yod pa ma yin pa lo //
analyzed: de dag rnam pa du mar snang yang don dam par yod pa ma yin pa lo //
translated: Although they appear in many forms, they do not exist ultimately.

original: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni @21b thams cad la sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni @21b thams cad la sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The word “like” is to be applied to all of these.

original: ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: 'dus byas kyi tshul rnams so //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi tshul rnams so //
translated: The modes of the conditioned.

original: 'di dag gi don ni sngar bstan mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di dag gi don ni sngar bstan mod kyi /
translated: The meaning of this has already been explained.

original: 'di ltar yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dgag par mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dgag par mdzad pa yin te /
translated: However, it is also a refutation of cause and effect,

original: 'dus byas kyi tshul rnams don dam par rgyu dang 'bras bu'i de dos po dang bral zhing rgyu dang rkyen la brten te skyes pa'i mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi tshul rnams don dam par rgyu dang 'bras bu'i de dos po dang bral zhing rgyu dang rkyen la brten te skyes pa'i mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: because the modes of the conditioned are devoid of the nature of cause and effect ultimately, and are characterized by being born in dependence on causes and conditions.

original: shes rab ces bya ba ni thos pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi shes rab ste /
analyzed: shes rab ces bya ba ni thos pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi shes rab ste /
translated: Wisdom is the wisdom that has hearing, etc. as its nature.

original: rab kyi sgras ni rab tu rnams par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab kyi sgras ni rab tu rnams par 'byed pa'o //
translated: The word “supreme” means “supremely discerning.”

original: brten pa ni de la nye bar brten pa'o //
analyzed: brten pa ni de la nye bar brten pa'o //
translated: “Relying” means relying on that.

original: de ni gtso bo yin par brjod ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni gtso bo yin par brjod ces bya ba la /
translated: It is said to be the chief.

original: 'gro ba de ltar gang gis mthong ba de ni don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas gsal bar byas pas na gtso bo'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba de ltar gang gis mthong ba de ni don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas gsal bar byas pas na gtso bo'o //
translated: One who sees the world in that way is the chief, because one is illuminated by knowing the meaning as it is.

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdu bar gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdu bar gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The summary is stated in “That is . . . ” and so forth.

original: gang du'ang zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas dad 'dus ma byas dag ste /
analyzed: gang du'ang zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas dad 'dus ma byas dag ste /
translated: “ Anywhere” refers to the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: de dag gang la'ang mngon par zhen pa med cing gnas pa med pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gang la'ang mngon par zhen pa med cing gnas pa med pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: One who has no attachment and no abode anywhere is called that.

original: ci ste 'di dag rang bzhin med pa yin na ji ltar don byed par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste 'di dag rang bzhin med pa yin na ji ltar don byed par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If these do not exist intrinsically, how can they perform a function?

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang dag 'byung mod kyi zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bur 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang dag 'byung mod kyi zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bur 'byung ba ste /
translated: Thus and so forth. It is indeed means that it arises like an illusion.

original: mod kyi zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mi mthun pa'i rkyen don dam par med mod kyi sgyu ma lta bur bya ba byed pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mod kyi zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mi mthun pa'i rkyen don dam par med mod kyi sgyu ma lta bur bya ba byed pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The word indeed indicates that although adverse conditions do not exist ultimately, they function like an illusion.

original: longs spyod khyad 'phags skye 'gyur zhes bya ba las dang nyon mongs pa las 'phags pas khyad 'phags te /
analyzed: longs spyod khyad 'phags skye 'gyur zhes bya ba las dang nyon mongs pa las 'phags pas khyad 'phags te /
translated: The enjoyment that arises is superior, because it is superior to karma and afflictions.

original: de sems can rnams kyi yang dag pa'i spyod pa ni longs spyod do //
analyzed: de sems can rnams kyi yang dag pa'i spyod pa ni longs spyod do //
translated: The enjoyment of sentient beings is their correct practice.

original: skye 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tshig gi phrad ni /
analyzed: skye 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tshig gi phrad ni /
translated: The word arises

original: de 'di'i yin no zhes mthar thug pa'i don to //
analyzed: de 'di'i yin no zhes mthar thug pa'i don to //
translated: means this is its end.

original: ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does it arise?

original: bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: It is said happiness and so forth.

original: bde ba chen po'i tshul khyad par du 'phags pa'i longs spyod des 'gro ba thams cad mgron du gnyer ba de ni yongs su 'gyur bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i tshul khyad par du 'phags pa'i longs spyod des 'gro ba thams cad mgron du gnyer ba de ni yongs su 'gyur bzhin pa'o //
translated: By that superior enjoyment of the method of great bliss, all beings are invited as guests, and that is the transformation.

original: ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'bras bu khyad 'phags te /
analyzed: 'bras bu khyad 'phags te /
translated: The result is superior.

original: bde ba chen po'i tshul gyi bdag nyid do //🔽de dag gis ni 'di skad du phung po la sogs pa 'di dag don dam par snying po med pa las @22a * //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i tshul gyi bdag nyid do // de dag gis ni 'di skad du phung po la sogs pa 'di dag don dam par snying po med pa las @22a * //
translated: It is the nature of great bliss.🔽They say this: “Why not accept that from these aggregates, etc.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi 'bras bu'i snying po chu shing ltar 'thob par 'gyur ba ci'i phyir na 'dod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi 'bras bu'i snying po chu shing ltar 'thob par 'gyur ba ci'i phyir na 'dod par mi bya ste /
translated: which are devoid of an ultimate essence, the essence of the result, the benefit of self and other, is obtained, like the plantain?

original: 'dod par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should accept it.

original: yang na longs spyod khyad 'phags zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas rnams so //
analyzed: yang na longs spyod khyad 'phags zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas rnams so //
translated: Alternatively, the superior enjoyment is the conditioned things.

original: skye 'gyur ba ni rjes su mthun par skye ba ste /
analyzed: skye 'gyur ba ni rjes su mthun par skye ba ste /
translated: The arising is the arising in conformity with the result.

original: 'bras bu'i khyad par rnams so //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i khyad par rnams so //
translated: The superior result is the special result.

original: khyad par ni khyad par du bya ba ste bye brag go //
analyzed: khyad par ni khyad par du bya ba ste bye brag go //
translated: The special is the object of special, i.e., the particular.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bde ba yongs su gyur bzhin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bde ba yongs su gyur bzhin zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is like the transformation of bliss.

original: ji ltar yongs su ma dag pa'i phung po las ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'byung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su ma dag pa'i phung po las ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'byung ste /
translated: Just as the mass of suffering arises from the impure aggregates,

original: 'khor ba sdug bsngal phung po ste //
analyzed: 'khor ba sdug bsngal phung po ste //
translated: The aggregates are the mass of suffering in cyclic existence.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de nyid bdag med pas yongs su sbyangs pa'i lha'i gzugs kyis ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don nus pa'i bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du skye bar blta ste /
analyzed: de nyid bdag med pas yongs su sbyangs pa'i lha'i gzugs kyis ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don nus pa'i bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du skye bar blta ste /
translated: But when that very [mind] is purified by the practice of selflessness, it is born in the nature of great bliss, which is able to accomplish the aims of self and other, in the form of a deity.

original: dper na skyur rtsi'i shing 'o mas bcu ba la sogs pa byas na 'bras bu mngar po nyid du skye ba ltar /
analyzed: dper na skyur rtsi'i shing 'o mas bcu ba la sogs pa byas na 'bras bu mngar po nyid du skye ba ltar /
translated: For example, when the sour fruit tree is treated with milk, etc., its fruit is born in a sweet nature.

original: mngon par 'du bya ba'i khyad par can gyi 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba'i khyad par can gyi 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it generates a special result through a special application.

original: snying po med pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snying po med pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very lack of essence,

original: brtan g-yo'i dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: brtan g-yo'i dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, the entities of the animate and inanimate world, and so on.

original: sgom pa khyad par can gang zhig / ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sgom pa khyad par can gang zhig / ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: That special meditation, and so on.

original: 'di snyam du gzugs la sogs par mngon par zhen pas ni sdug bsngal nyid sgrub la /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gzugs la sogs par mngon par zhen pas ni sdug bsngal nyid sgrub la /
translated: By the adherence to form, etc., suffering is produced.

original: de nyid bdag med par sbyangs pas ni khyad par can gyi 'bras bu bde ba chen po skye bar 'gyur ba la nyes pa ci zhig yod snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: de nyid bdag med par sbyangs pas ni khyad par can gyi 'bras bu bde ba chen po skye bar 'gyur ba la nyes pa ci zhig yod snyam du dgongs so //
translated: What is the fault in the arising of the special result, great bliss, through the purification of that very [mind] as selfless?

original: yid 'od ni yid kyi bde ba yin la bde ba ni lus kyi bde ba'o //
analyzed: yid 'od ni yid kyi bde ba yin la bde ba ni lus kyi bde ba'o //
translated: Mental light is mental bliss, and bliss is bodily bliss.

original: rgyu ni yul rnams te ;
analyzed: rgyu ni yul rnams te ;
translated: The cause is the objects.

original: bsgrub pa ni bdag med pa'i lha'i rnam pas spyad ba byas pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa ni bdag med pa'i lha'i rnam pas spyad ba byas pa'o //
