translated: The practice is the performance of the conduct by means of the form of a deity who is selfless.

original: 'bras bu ni bla na med pa'i bde ba chen po ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni bla na med pa'i bde ba chen po ste /
translated: The result is unsurpassed great bliss.

original: don du gnyer ba ni rgyur nye bar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: don du gnyer ba ni rgyur nye bar 'gro ba'o //
translated: The pursuit is the cause.

original: lha mo ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: lha mo ni bod pa'o //
translated: The goddess is the object.

original: de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nye bar bsdu ba bstan te /
analyzed: de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nye bar bsdu ba bstan te /
translated: Therefore, and so on, teaches the summary.

original: 'gro ba thams cad stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid gang yin pa rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i sku de ni kun du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid gang yin pa rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i sku de ni kun du 'gro ba ste /
translated: The body of the great vajra holder, who is the identity of wisdom and method inseparable emptiness and compassion, is all-pervading.

original: mchod pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i longs spyod kyis mngon du bya ba'o //
analyzed: mchod pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i longs spyod kyis mngon du bya ba'o //
translated: Worship is the enjoyment of the five sense objects.

original: des na bde bas bde ba sgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na bde bas bde ba sgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, happiness is accomplished by happiness.

original: de ma gtogs par bde ba nyid med par @22b bstan pa'i phyir dka' thub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ma gtogs par bde ba nyid med par @22b bstan pa'i phyir dka' thub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to show that there is no happiness apart from that, he says, “Austerities, etc.”

original: dka' thub ni me lnga bstan pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dka' thub ni me lnga bstan pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Austerities are the worship of the five fires, etc.

original: sdom pa ni kha zas sdom pa'o //
analyzed: sdom pa ni kha zas sdom pa'o //
translated: Vows are the vow of food.

original: mi bzad pa ni ri'i kha nas mchong ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi bzad pa ni ri'i kha nas mchong ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Intolerable are jumping off a cliff, etc.

original: lus bskams pa ni lus kyi sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: lus bskams pa ni lus kyi sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Drying up the body is the suffering of the body.

original: sdug bsngal ni yid kyi sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni yid kyi sdug bsngal te /
translated: Suffering is the suffering of the mind.

original: dngos grub gzhan du gyur pa ni yongs su shes par bya ba'i don gyi dngos grub las nyams pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub gzhan du gyur pa ni yongs su shes par bya ba'i don gyi dngos grub las nyams pa'o //
translated: The transformation of power is the loss of the power of understanding the meaning.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas gsungs pa /
translated: He speaks of the transformation of power in terms of the following:

original: lus dang sems ni brtan gyur na //
analyzed: lus dang sems ni brtan gyur na //
translated: When the body and mind are firm,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: etc.

original: de bde bas brten par byas na bde ba'i 'bras bu mngon par 'dod pa brtan pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bde bas brten par byas na bde ba'i 'bras bu mngon par 'dod pa brtan pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one relies on it with happiness, the result of happiness will be firm, which is the desired goal.

original: ldog pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: ldog pa gsungs pa /
translated: The reversal is stated:

original: sdug bsngal gyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: By suffering, etc.

original: g-yos pa ni brtsams pa'i don la nyams pa'o //
analyzed: g-yos pa ni brtsams pa'i don la nyams pa'o //
translated: Agitation is the failure of the goal that was begun.

original: de yang ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de yang ci zhig ce na /
translated: And what is that?

original: shin tu 'gog pa ste 'gog pa'i 'dras bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shin tu 'gog pa ste 'gog pa'i 'dras bur 'gyur ro //
translated: It is complete cessation, which is the result of cessation.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: gzhan du dus min 'chi ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan du dus min 'chi ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Otherwise, untimely death, etc.

original: thabs ma yin pas 'bras bu don du gnyer bas gang gi tshe ma grub pa de'i tshe dam pa'i chos la brnyas pas dus ma yin par srog zad par 'gyur te dmyal bar sreg par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thabs ma yin pas 'bras bu don du gnyer bas gang gi tshe ma grub pa de'i tshe dam pa'i chos la brnyas pas dus ma yin par srog zad par 'gyur te dmyal bar sreg par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By improper means means that one who seeks results will, when not successful, destroy life unseasonably by despising the holy Dharma, and will be burned in hell.

original: des pa ni gdon mi za ba'o //
analyzed: des pa ni gdon mi za ba'o //
translated: That is the meaning. Certainly means without doubt.

original: mkha' 'gro kun dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ston pa pos rim par phye ba yongs su rdzogs par bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro kun dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ston pa pos rim par phye ba yongs su rdzogs par bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By all dakinis, etc., the teacher shows that the chapter is complete.

original: de kho na nyid snang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de kho na nyid snang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the Illuminating Reality, etc.,

original: de kho na nyid dam pa ni rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba'i bdag nyid chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid dam pa ni rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba'i bdag nyid chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'o //
translated: the supreme reality is the selflessness of persons and phenomena, which is the subject and object of expression.

original: snang ba ni nges shing gtan la phab pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba ni nges shing gtan la phab pa'o //
translated: Illumination is ascertainment and determination.

original: yul ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams te /
analyzed: yul ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams te /
translated: The object is the objects such as form.

original: der 'jug pa ni rab tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: der 'jug pa ni rab tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: Engaging there is entering.

original: de'i ye shes ni rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de'i ye shes ni rtog pa ste /
translated: The wisdom of that is the thought.

original: rim par phye ba ni brjod par bya ba'i don de dag ston pa'i gzhung gi tshogs yin la de nyid dang po'o //
analyzed: rim par phye ba ni brjod par bya ba'i don de dag ston pa'i gzhung gi tshogs yin la de nyid dang po'o //
translated: The divisions are the collection of texts that teach those topics to be expressed.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhes bya ba'i rnam par bshad pa las le'u dang po'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhes bya ba'i rnam par bshad pa las le'u dang po'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the first chapter of the commentary on the glorious Vajradaka, the great king of tantras.

original: // / de nas zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid snang ba dam pa'i yul la 'jug pa'i ye shes kyi 'og tu'o //
analyzed: // / de nas zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid snang ba dam pa'i yul la 'jug pa'i ye shes kyi 'og tu'o //
translated: Then, after the wisdom that engages the object of the supreme illumination of reality,🔽the queens

original: btsun mo rnams kyis @23a * //🔽gsol to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: btsun mo rnams kyis @23a * //🔽gsol to zhes bya ba la /
translated: said.

original: shin tu yang mchod pa'i phyir dbyung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i don btsun mo nyid kyis zhu bar bya'i gzhan gyis ni ma yin pas so //
analyzed: shin tu yang mchod pa'i phyir dbyung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i don btsun mo nyid kyis zhu bar bya'i gzhan gyis ni ma yin pas so //
translated: Because of the great worship, the queen herself should request the meaning of not to be taken out, and not another.

original: mchod pa ni phyi dang gsad ba'i mchod pas mnyes par byas pa'o //
analyzed: mchod pa ni phyi dang gsad ba'i mchod pas mnyes par byas pa'o //
translated: Worship is pleasing by means of outer and inner worship.

original: phyag bya ba ni de'i 'og tu sems kyis khyad par can du 'dzin pa dang / lus kyis langs te yan lag lnga sa la 'dud pa dang / 'dud do zhes ngag tu brjod pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: phyag bya ba ni de'i 'og tu sems kyis khyad par can du 'dzin pa dang / lus kyis langs te yan lag lnga sa la 'dud pa dang / 'dud do zhes ngag tu brjod pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Salutation is by means of the mind holding it as special, by means of the body rising and bowing the five limbs to the ground, and by means of speech uttering I bow.

original: gsol to zhes bya ba ni lan tshva'i sgra la sogs pa ltar don du ma dang 'brel ba'i phyir mang po'i tshig tu blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsol to zhes bya ba ni lan tshva'i sgra la sogs pa ltar don du ma dang 'brel ba'i phyir mang po'i tshig tu blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word request should be seen as a plural word because it is related to many meanings, like the word salt.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: gdug pa rnams zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa sun 'byin par byed pas na gdug pa ste /
analyzed: gdug pa rnams zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa sun 'byin par byed pas na gdug pa ste /
translated: The vicious are so called because they cause harm to the body and so forth.

original: de rnams so sor 'joms par byed pa'i snying po de ni gdug pa can gyi snying po ste he ru ka'i sngags so //

analyzed: rnal 'byor ma drug gi go cha'i sngags ni rdo rje phag mo'i rnal 'byor la gnas te /
translated: The mantra of the armor of the six yoginis is taught for one abiding in the yoga of Vajravarahi.

original: bzlas pa bstan pa'i phyir sna tshogs padma zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bzlas pa bstan pa'i phyir sna tshogs padma zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the recitation, [the Bhagavān] declares various lotuses, and so on.

original: 'dir rlung dang me dang chu dang dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du ri rab de'i steng du sna tshogs padma dang / sna tshogs rdo rje la rdo rje ra ba dang dra ba'i nang du chos kyi 'byung gnas der sna tshogs padma dang rdo rje'i steng du rnam par snang mdzad las byung ba'i khang bu brtsegs par sna tshogs padma'i lte ba la nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su
analyzed: 'dir rlung dang me dang chu dang dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du ri rab de'i steng du sna tshogs padma dang / sna tshogs rdo rje la rdo rje ra ba dang dra ba'i nang du chos kyi 'byung gnas der sna tshogs padma dang rdo rje'i steng du rnam par snang mdzad las byung ba'i khang bu brtsegs par sna tshogs padma'i lte ba la nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su
translated: In that, on top of the variegated lotus and vajra, is the palace arisen from Vairocana. In the center of the variegated lotus, in the center of a sun maṇḍala,

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / a'a li k'a li sbyor ba la sogs pas 'og nas 'byung ba ltar bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / a'a li k'a li sbyor ba la sogs pas 'og nas 'byung ba ltar bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: in the center of a moon maṇḍala, one should accomplish the union of the vowels and consonants, and so on, as it is explained below.

original: sna tshogs padma'i nyi dkyil la //
analyzed: sna tshogs padma'i nyi dkyil la //
translated: On the variegated lotus and sun maṇḍala,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni rdo rje ni rab dang dra ba bstan par 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni rdo rje ni rab dang dra ba bstan par 'gyur la /
translated: and so on. In one verse, the vajra fence and net are explained.

original: chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi nang du yang sna tshogs padma dang rdo rje bsgom mo zhes zur gyis ston to //
analyzed: chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi nang du yang sna tshogs padma dang rdo rje bsgom mo zhes zur gyis ston to //
translated: Also, within the source of phenomena, one should meditate on the variegated lotus and vajra.

original: 'o zhes bya ba ni nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'o zhes bya ba ni nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word indeed has the meaning of just.

original: 'od zer sna tshogs 'bar ba las //
analyzed: 'od zer sna tshogs 'bar ba las //
translated: From the blazing of variegated light rays,

original: mkha' 'gro ma yi 'khor spro ba //🔽zhes bya ba ni sa bon gyi de nyid las mkha' @25a * //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma yi 'khor spro ba // zhes bya ba ni sa bon gyi de nyid las mkha' @25a * //
translated: the retinue of dakinis is emanated.

original: 'gro ma gzugs sna tshogs spro ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ma gzugs sna tshogs spro ba'o //
translated: This is the emanation of the various forms of dakinis from the reality of the seed syllable.

original: zhal gcig phyag gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni khang bu brtsegs pa'i nang du sgrub thabs kyi rim pas rim pa ltar yi ge hr'i: las bskyed pa'i rdo rje phag mo bsgom par bstan te /
analyzed: zhal gcig phyag gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni khang bu brtsegs pa'i nang du sgrub thabs kyi rim pas rim pa ltar yi ge hr'i: las bskyed pa'i rdo rje phag mo bsgom par bstan te /
translated: With one face, two arms, and so on, it is taught that within the tiered palace, one should meditate on Vajravārāhī generated from the syllable hriḥ, in the sequence of the sādhana ritual.🔽This is the recitation: Oṃ, I generate the ascertainment of the mind.

original: 'dis ni aom tsitta pra ti be dham ka ro mi /🔽aom po nghi tsitta autp'a da y'a mi /
analyzed: 'dis ni aom tsitta pra ti be dham ka ro mi / aom po nghi tsitta autp'a da y'a mi /

original: aom tshhthi badzra a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom tshhthi badzra a'atma ko& ham /

original: aom ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ra sta th'a aa ham /
analyzed: aom ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ra sta th'a aa ham /
translated: Oṃ, I pay homage to the vajra body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas.🔽O

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags lnga'i don mngon par byang chub pa lnga ston pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags lnga'i don mngon par byang chub pa lnga ston pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the five mantras is the teaching of the five manifest enlightenments.

original: mdung gi dbyibs can zhes bya ba ni phyed krung bcas pas gnas pa'i phyir ro //🔽'jigs pa dag kyang 'jigs par mdzad //
analyzed: mdung gi dbyibs can zhes bya ba ni phyed krung bcas pas gnas pa'i phyir ro // 'jigs pa dag kyang 'jigs par mdzad //
translated: The spear-shaped is the half-lotus posture.

original: ces bya ba la 'jigs pa ni bde ba la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la 'jigs pa ni bde ba la sogs pa yin la /
translated: The frightened are the fears, such as of pleasure, etc.

original: de dag kyang 'jigs par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'jigs par mdzad pa ste /
translated: Those are also frightened,

original: phyag na gri dang thod pa bsnams par bsgom mo //
analyzed: phyag na gri dang thod pa bsnams par bsgom mo //
translated: and one should meditate on the hand-held knife and skull-cup.

original: mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya ba ni man ngag gis na 'og nas 'byung ba'i rab tu gtum mo la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya ba ni man ngag gis na 'og nas 'byung ba'i rab tu gtum mo la sogs pa ste /
translated: The dakinis are the fierce fire below, etc., according to the esoteric instructions,

original: de dag dpa' bo dang bral bar dkyil 'khor ba'i lhar gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag dpa' bo dang bral bar dkyil 'khor ba'i lhar gzung bar bya'o //
translated: and one should hold them as deities of the mandala, free from the heroes.

original: yan lag la dgod pa la sogs pa cho ga rdzogs pa ni ltag 'og tu blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag la dgod pa la sogs pa cho ga rdzogs pa ni ltag 'og tu blta bar bya'o //
translated: The complete rite of the placement in the limbs, etc., should be understood in reverse order.

original: mkha' 'gro kun dang mnyam sbyor ba //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro kun dang mnyam sbyor ba //
translated: The union with all dakinis

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gror rab tu grags //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gror rab tu grags //
translated: is renowned as the vajra dakini.

original: zhes bya bas ni rdo rje phag mo sgom pa pos rdo rje mkha' 'gro lta bur blta'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni rdo rje phag mo sgom pa pos rdo rje mkha' 'gro lta bur blta'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By this, the meaning is that the meditator on Vajravārāhī should view her as like Vajradākinī.

original: da ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i sngags gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i sngags gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the mantra of Vajradākinī is stated:

original: sngon bsags zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sngon nyid yi ge ka ste /
analyzed: sngon bsags zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sngon nyid yi ge ka ste /
translated: “Previously accumulated” and so on. Previously is the letter ka.

original: mtha' ni de'i mthar ro //
analyzed: mtha' ni de'i mthar ro //
translated: The end is at the end of that.

original: ma gnyis dang aar sbyar ba ni brtsi ba med pas te lung gi don to //
analyzed: ma gnyis dang aar sbyar ba ni brtsi ba med pas te lung gi don to //
translated: The two mas joined with ar are without value, the meaning of the scripture.

original: mtha' der ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: mtha' der ci zhig ce na /
translated: What at the end of that?

original: me dang bcas pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: me dang bcas pa zhes pa ste /
translated: “Along with fire.”

original: me ni ra'o //
analyzed: me ni ra'o //
translated: Fire is ra.

original: des na ka ra zhes 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na ka ra zhes 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus it becomes kara.

original: lan gnyis bzlas zhes bya bas ni 'das ma thag pa'i sngags gnyis su bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: lan gnyis bzlas zhes bya bas ni 'das ma thag pa'i sngags gnyis su bzlas pa'o //
translated: “Repeated twice” means repeated twice with the immediately preceding mantra.

original: des ni sngags kyi tshig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni sngags kyi tshig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus it becomes the mantra.

original: tha mal pa'i tshig gi don brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: tha mal pa'i tshig gi don brjod par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the ordinary words should be stated.

original: sngon bsags las zhes bya ba ni mtshams med pa lnga la sogs pa'i las so //
analyzed: sngon bsags las zhes bya ba ni mtshams med pa lnga la sogs pa'i las so //
translated: “Previously accumulated karma” is the karma of the five acts of immediate retribution and so on.

original: de nyid me dang bcas pa ste //
analyzed: de nyid me dang bcas pa ste //
translated: That itself is along with fire.

original: me ltar rnam par smin pa rtsub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me ltar rnam par smin pa rtsub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its ripening is as harsh as fire.

original: de mthar byed pa ni mthar bya'o //
analyzed: de mthar byed pa ni mthar bya'o //
translated: One should bring that to an end.

original: lan gnyis zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i tshig yin te yang @25b dang yang du'o //
analyzed: lan gnyis zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i tshig yin te yang @25b dang yang du'o //
translated: Twice means the verbal form of the word again and again.

original: bzlas zhes bya ba ni byos shig byos shig pa ste /
analyzed: bzlas zhes bya ba ni byos shig byos shig pa ste /
translated: Recite means do it, do it.

original: las kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa rdzogs par byas la /
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa rdzogs par byas la /
translated: Having completed the karmamudra and so on,

original: de dag lhan cig tu snyoms par 'jug pa'i las la gnas nas sngon gyi las mthar bya bya byos shig pa ste /
analyzed: de dag lhan cig tu snyoms par 'jug pa'i las la gnas nas sngon gyi las mthar bya bya byos shig pa ste /
translated: one should abide in the act of union with them and bring to an end the previous karma.

original: smad par mi bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: smad par mi bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should not disparage it.

original: yang na 'dir byos shig byos shig ces sbyar bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dir byos shig byos shig ces sbyar bar mi bya ste /
translated: Or else, here one should not apply do it, do it.

original: sngon bsags pa'i las de mi mthun pa'i phyogs tsam zhig tu bstan par bya'o //🔽ku ru ku ru sems dpa' bral //
analyzed: sngon bsags pa'i las de mi mthun pa'i phyogs tsam zhig tu bstan par bya'o // ku ru ku ru sems dpa' bral //
translated: That previously accumulated karma should be taught as merely a counteragent.🔽KURUKULLA

original: zhes bya ba la ku ru ku ru zhes bya ba ni sngags ku ru ku ru'i bzlas pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la ku ru ku ru zhes bya ba ni sngags ku ru ku ru'i bzlas pa ste /
translated: In the mantra KURUKULLA, KURUKULLA is the recitation of the mantra KURUKULLA.

original: sngags kyi tshig de'i don gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi tshig de'i don gyis shig pa'o //
translated: One should understand the meaning of that mantra.

original: ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is it?

original: sems dpa' ste gzung ba la sogs pa'i blo dang bral bar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' ste gzung ba la sogs pa'i blo dang bral bar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Be free of the mind of apprehender and so forth.

original: tshig gi don brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: tshig gi don brjod par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the words should be stated.

original: de la sems dpa' ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems dpa' ni bod pa'o //
translated: Therein, hero is liberated.

original: bral ba ni dbye ba'o //
analyzed: bral ba ni dbye ba'o //
translated: Free is separated.

original: ku ru ni byos shig pa ste /
analyzed: ku ru ni byos shig pa ste /
translated: Do is make.

original: las ngan pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba chags pa dang bral bar byos shig pa'o //
analyzed: las ngan pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba chags pa dang bral bar byos shig pa'o //
translated: Make free of attachment, the root of all evil actions.

original: ral pa gya gyu bandha gsal //
analyzed: ral pa gya gyu bandha gsal //
translated: The hair is curly, bound, and clear.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: bandha zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi tshig ste /
analyzed: bandha zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi tshig ste /
translated: The word bound is a mantra word.

original: de'i don ni bcings pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don ni bcings pa'o //
translated: Its meaning is bound.

original: ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig ce na /
translated: What?

original: ral pa gya gyu ste skra'i tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rtse mo li zhing 'khyil pa dang / gsal ba ste mthon por bcings pa ga la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: ral pa gya gyu ste skra'i tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rtse mo li zhing 'khyil pa dang / gsal ba ste mthon por bcings pa ga la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The hair is curly, the tips of the inconceivable mass of hair are curled and twisted, and bound high, clear, and lofty. Where that exists, it is called that.

original: bstod pa'o // yang na ral pa gsal ba ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: bstod pa'o // yang na ral pa gsal ba ni bod pa'o //
translated: It is a praise. Or, the clear hair is liberated.

original: gya gyu ni gya gyu can sdang ba rnams chings shig pa'o //
analyzed: gya gyu ni gya gyu can sdang ba rnams chings shig pa'o //
translated: The curls are the crooked, bind the crooked, the hateful.

original: sngar bzlas pa ni len gnyis su bzlas pa ste /
analyzed: sngar bzlas pa ni len gnyis su bzlas pa ste /
translated: The repetition of the former is the double repetition of bandha.

original: des na bandha bandha zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na bandha bandha zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it becomes bandha bandha.

original: cig shos brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: cig shos brjod par bya ste /
translated: The other one is to be stated.

original: ral pa gya gyu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi tshogs rnams so //
analyzed: ral pa gya gyu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi tshogs rnams so //
translated: The disheveled hair is the collection of the families of the Tathagatas.

original: don dam par rang bzhin med bzhin du kun rdzob tu du mar snang bas na gya gyu ste bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: don dam par rang bzhin med bzhin du kun rdzob tu du mar snang bas na gya gyu ste bstan par bya'o //
translated: Since they appear as many in the conventional, although ultimately they are without intrinsic reality, they are disheveled and are to be taught.

original: bcings pa ni gcig tu bya ba ste /
analyzed: bcings pa ni gcig tu bya ba ste /
translated: The binding is the unification.

original: don dam par bdag med pa'i 'khor los de dag bsdus te /
analyzed: don dam par bdag med pa'i 'khor los de dag bsdus te /
translated: Having gathered them with the wheel of selflessness, ultimately,

original: ston pa nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: the Teacher himself is taught.

original: de ltar na ral pa gya gyu bcings zhes bya ba dman pa'i tshig gis dor thabs kyi bstod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ral pa gya gyu bcings zhes bya ba dman pa'i tshig gis dor thabs kyi bstod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the disheveled hair bound is a praise in the form of a dismissal with the words of a low-caste person.

original: gsal zhes bya ba ni khyad par du bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: gsal zhes bya ba ni khyad par du bya ba'i don te /
translated: The word “clearly” has the meaning of a particular.

original: ji ltar ral pa spyi bo'i steng na gnas pa ltar sangs rgyas rnams gus pa dang @26a * //
analyzed: ji ltar ral pa spyi bo'i steng na gnas pa ltar sangs rgyas rnams gus pa dang @26a * //
translated: Just as the hair is placed above the head, so the Buddhas are to be taught with respect,

original: bcas pas spyi bos blangs te bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bcas pas spyi bos blangs te bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: having taken them on the head. This is the meaning.

original: slar bzlas pa ni yang dang yang du goms par bya'o //
analyzed: slar bzlas pa ni yang dang yang du goms par bya'o //
translated: The repetition is for the purpose of repeated practice.

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams phyag dang zhal la sogs pa mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i tshul gyis bsgoms pas ni 'khor ba nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams phyag dang zhal la sogs pa mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i tshul gyis bsgoms pas ni 'khor ba nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one meditates on the Tathagatas in a manner that has the characteristics of hands, faces, etc., then one will be in cyclic existence.

original: 'dir gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir gsungs pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The world, etc.

original: gzugs dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni gzung ba la sogs dang bral bas ngo bo nyid med par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni gzung ba la sogs dang bral bas ngo bo nyid med par bya'o //
translated: Free from form means that one should understand that the nature of the Tathagatas is essenceless, since they are free from the apprehended object, etc.

original: des ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the point of that?

original: 'jig rten skrag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten skrag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The world is frightened,

original: dngos por mngon par zhen pa rnams yid la gdung zhing skrag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos por mngon par zhen pa rnams yid la gdung zhing skrag par 'gyur ro //
translated: and those who are attached to entities will be distressed and frightened.

original: de la ci zhig bya zhe na brdzun zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽tshad mas dpyad na ngo bo nyid med bzhin du yang 'jig rten skrag pa spang ba'i phyir kun rdzob tu ji ltar snang ba bzhin /
analyzed: de la ci zhig bya zhe na brdzun zhes bya ba gsungs te / tshad mas dpyad na ngo bo nyid med bzhin du yang 'jig rten skrag pa spang ba'i phyir kun rdzob tu ji ltar snang ba bzhin /
translated: What should be done about that? It is said, It is false.

original: yong ngo zhes bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: yong ngo zhes bstan par bya'o //
translated: Even though, when examined by a valid cognition, they are essenceless, in order to abandon the world's fear, one should teach that they exist conventionally, just as they appear.

original: de nyid kyis na /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na /
translated: Therefore,

original: dam pa de ni lan gnyis bzla //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dam pa de ni lan gnyis bzla // zhes gsungs so //
translated: that mantra is recited twice.

original: sngags kyi tshig gi don brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: sngags kyi tshig gi don brjod par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the mantra should be stated.🔽False is ālikāli.

original: brdzun pa ni a'a li k'a li ste /
analyzed: brdzun pa ni a'a li k'a li ste /
translated: Be frightened, be frightened, of the cattle, of the birds, of the cattle-like foolish people.🔽Recite twice means that it is recited twice.🔽Thus, it becomes trāsaya trāsaya.🔽How should one be frightened?

original: phyugs la bya la phyugs dang 'dra ba'i skye bo blun po rnams tr'a sa ya ste skrag par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: phyugs la bya la phyugs dang 'dra ba'i skye bo blun po rnams tr'a sa ya ste skrag par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Be frightened, be frightened, of the cattle, of the birds, of the cattle-like foolish people.🔽Recite twice means that it is recited twice.🔽Thus, it becomes trāsaya trāsaya.🔽How should one be frightened?🔽Be frightened, be frightened, of the cattle, of the birds, of the cattle-like foolish people.🔽Recite twice means that it is recited twice.

original: lan gnyis bzla zhes bya bas ni tr'a sa ya tr'a sa ya //
analyzed: lan gnyis bzla zhes bya bas ni tr'a sa ya tr'a sa ya //
translated: Thus, it becomes trāsaya trāsaya.🔽How should one be frightened?🔽Be frightened, be frightened, of the cattle, of the birds, of the cattle-like foolish people.🔽Recite twice means that it is recited twice.

original: zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it becomes trāsaya trāsaya.🔽How should one be frightened?

original: ji ltar skrag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar skrag par bya zhe na /
translated: Be frightened, be frightened, of the cattle, of the birds, of the cattle-like foolish people.🔽Recite twice means that it is recited twice.

original: gzugs dang bral ba ste sdang ba dang bral bar bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang bral ba ste sdang ba dang bral bar bya ba'i bar du'o //

analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blos sgra'i @29b mchog 'don pa la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: with a very pure mind, one utters the supreme sound. That is what it is called.

original: au sgra la zhon zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni h'um h'um zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: au sgra la zhon zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni h'um h'um zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Mounting the sound of u and so on, it becomes hum hum.

original: gzhan brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan brjod par bya ste /
translated: Another explanation is as follows:

original: au sgra la zhon zhes bya ba na thabs kyi cha'o //
analyzed: au sgra la zhon zhes bya ba na thabs kyi cha'o //
translated: Mounting the sound of u is the method aspect.

original: dum bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi cha'o //
analyzed: dum bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi cha'o //
translated: The pieces and so forth are the wisdom part.

original: phat ces bya ba la sogs pa ni sgra ji bzhin no //
analyzed: phat ces bya ba la sogs pa ni sgra ji bzhin no //
translated: The phat and so forth are as the words [indicate].

original: bsgrub pa ni sv'a h'a /🔽zhes mthar brjod pa'o //🔽cha ni aa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa ni sv'a h'a / zhes mthar brjod pa'o // cha ni aa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment is the svāhā at the end.🔽The parts are the vowels beginning with a.

original: cha min ni ka la sogs pa'i yi ge'o //
analyzed: cha min ni ka la sogs pa'i yi ge'o //
translated: The non-parts are the consonants beginning with ka.

original: mang po ni sngags kyi tshogs rnams so //
analyzed: mang po ni sngags kyi tshogs rnams so //
translated: The many are the collections of mantras.

original: de ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: de ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: What are they like?

original: me tog tshogs kyi phreng bas zin //
analyzed: me tog tshogs kyi phreng bas zin //
translated: Seized by the garland of flower collections.🔽Just as various flowers are strung on a garland, so many mantra collections are expanded.🔽It is like this: Oṃ kara kara kuru kuru bandha bandha trāsaya trāsaya🔽kṣobhaya kṣobhaya🔽 Translation: The pieces and so forth are the wisdom part.🔽The phat and so forth are as the words [indicate].🔽The accomplishment is the svāhā at the end.🔽The parts are the vowels beginning with a.🔽The non-parts are the consonants beginning with ka.🔽The many are the collections of mantras.🔽What are they like?🔽Seized by the garland of flower collections.

original: zhes bya ba la ji ltar me tog sna tshogs phreng bas brgyus pa ltar sngags kyi tshogs du ma spel ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la ji ltar me tog sna tshogs phreng bas brgyus pa ltar sngags kyi tshogs du ma spel ba ste /
translated: Just as various flowers are strung on a garland, so many mantra collections are expanded.

original: 'di ltar aom ka ra ka ra ku ru ku ru bandha bandha tr'a sa ya tr'a sa ya /
analyzed: 'di ltar aom ka ra ka ra ku ru ku ru bandha bandha tr'a sa ya tr'a sa ya /
translated: It is like this: Oṃ kara kara kuru kuru bandha bandha trāsaya trāsaya

original: ksho bha ya ksho bha ya /
analyzed: ksho bha ya ksho bha ya /
translated: kṣobhaya kṣobhaya

original: hroom hroom hra: hra: phem phem phat phat da ha da ha pa tsa pa tsa baksha baksha ba sa ru dhi ra aantra m'a l'a ba lam bi ne gri gna grihna sa pta p'a t'a la ga ta bhu dzam ga sarbam b'a tardza ya tardza ya a'a kaddhya
analyzed: hroom hroom hra: hra: phem phem phat phat da ha da ha pa tsa pa tsa baksha baksha ba sa ru dhi ra aantra m'a l'a ba lam bi ne gri gna grihna sa pta p'a t'a la ga ta bhu dzam ga sarbam b'a tardza ya tardza ya a'a kaddhya
translated: Hrom hrom hrah hrah, phem phem phat phat, daha daha, pacha pacha, vaksha vaksha, vasarudhiramala-valmivine, grihnam grihnam, sapta-patala-gatabhujam, ghamsarva-mbavatrayaya, tarjayaya, akaddhy

original: a'a kaddhya / hrim hrim /
analyzed: a'a kaddhya / hrim hrim /
translated: akaddhya, hrim hrim,

original: dznyoom dznyoom kshm'am kshm'am ham ham him him h'um h'um /
analyzed: dznyoom dznyoom kshm'am kshm'am ham ham him him h'um h'um /
translated: jhom jhom, kshmam kshmam, ham ham, him him, hum hum,

original: ki li ki li /🔽si li si li /
analyzed: ki li ki li / si li si li /
translated: kili kili,🔽sili sili,

original: tsi li tsi li /
analyzed: tsi li tsi li /
translated: cili cili,

original: dhi li dhi li /
analyzed: dhi li dhi li /
translated: dili dili,

original: h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
translated: hum hum phat phat svaha.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: thog mar aom ste sv'a h'i mtha' //
analyzed: thog mar aom ste sv'a h'i mtha' //
translated: First Om, and finally svaha.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for those and so forth,

original: lha mo sgyur ma he zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: lha mo sgyur ma he zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
translated: the cow-faced goddess is the Tibetan word for cow.

original: thams cad ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i 'gro ba kun no //
analyzed: thams cad ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i 'gro ba kun no //
translated: All means all the moving and unmoving world.

original: de dag gi dngos grub ni de dag bcing ba la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa dang sangs rgyas nyid la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub bo //
analyzed: de dag gi dngos grub ni de dag bcing ba la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa dang sangs rgyas nyid la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub bo //
translated: Their powers are mundane powers such as binding and so forth, and supramundane powers such as Buddhahood and so forth.

original: ster ba ni sngags 'dis sgrub pa po rnams la dngos grub de dag bsgrub cing bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: ster ba ni sngags 'dis sgrub pa po rnams la dngos grub de dag bsgrub cing bskyed pa'o //
translated: Granting is the accomplishment and production of those powers for the practitioners by this mantra.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngags kyi mthu gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngags kyi mthu gsungs te /
translated: This is the power of the mantra, as stated by “this” and so forth.

original: 'jig rten khams kun g-yos gyur cing //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams kun g-yos gyur cing //
translated: The entire world system shakes

original: zhes bya ba ni thos pa la sogs pa'i shes rab kyis gzhig pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thos pa la sogs pa'i shes rab kyis gzhig pa'o //
translated: is destroyed by the wisdom of hearing and so forth.

original: skrag pa ni chos nyid mngon du byas pa'o //
analyzed: skrag pa ni chos nyid mngon du byas pa'o //
translated: Terrified is the actualization of reality.

original: byang chub tu ni mngon par sangs rgyas zhes pa ni chos kyi de kho na nyid mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub tu ni mngon par sangs rgyas zhes pa ni chos kyi de kho na nyid mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
translated: Enlightened is the direct realization of the reality of phenomena.

original: tshig gi don gyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: tshig gi don gyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: This is the result of the meaning of the words.

original: ri bo thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas ni sngags kyi 'bras bu bstan te /
analyzed: ri bo thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas ni sngags kyi 'bras bu bstan te /
translated: The result of the mantra is taught by “all mountains” and so forth.

original: btul ba la sogs @30a * //
analyzed: btul ba la sogs @30a * //
translated: Taming and so forth

original: pa'i tshig gsum ni lus la sogs pa gsum dang sbyar te /
analyzed: pa'i tshig gsum ni lus la sogs pa gsum dang sbyar te /
translated: The three phrases “the body, speech, and mind” are to be applied to the three, body and so forth.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: da ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i sgrub thabs brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i sgrub thabs brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, one should state the means of achieving Vajradaka.

original: snying gar nyi ma la gnas pa'i h'um gi 'od zer gyis bla ma dang rje btsun mkha' 'gro ma'i tshogs dang bcas pa'i rdo rje mkha' 'gro blta ste /🔽de'i 'od las byung ba'i me tog la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: snying gar nyi ma la gnas pa'i h'um gi 'od zer gyis bla ma dang rje btsun mkha' 'gro ma'i tshogs dang bcas pa'i rdo rje mkha' 'gro blta ste / de'i 'od las byung ba'i me tog la sogs pa nas /
translated: One should visualize Vajradaka together with the guru and the host of the Venerable Dakinis, by the light rays of the Hum located on the sun in the heart.

original: bdud rtsi lnga'i bar gyi mchod pas yang dag par mchod la /
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga'i bar gyi mchod pas yang dag par mchod la /
translated: One should make perfect offerings to them with the flowers and so forth arisen from their light, up to the five nectars.

original: de dag gi spyan sngar /🔽sangs rgyas thams cad bdag la dgongs //
analyzed: de dag gi spyan sngar / sangs rgyas thams cad bdag la dgongs //
translated: In their presence,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa la na gsum brjod pas sdom pa bzung nas /🔽ao sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dharm'a: sva bh'a ba shuddho& ham /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa la na gsum brjod pas sdom pa bzung nas / ao sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dharm'a: sva bh'a ba shuddho& ham /
translated: one should recite the three verses beginning with “All Buddhas consider me,” and take the vows.🔽Then one should recite “Om svabhava shuddha sarva dharma svabhava shuddho ham,”

original: zhes brjod la chos thams cad bdag med par mos nas /
analyzed: zhes brjod la chos thams cad bdag med par mos nas /
translated: and imagine that all phenomena are selfless.

original: aom badzra shuddha: sarba dharm'a badzra shuddho& ham /🔽zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra shuddha: sarba dharm'a badzra shuddho& ham / zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Say: Om vajra-shuddha sarva-dharma vajra-shuddho 'ham.

original: de nas sna tshogs padma'i steng du h'um las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte bar de nyid kyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i 'od las byung ba'i rdo rje'i ra ba la sogs pa bsgoms la /
analyzed: de nas sna tshogs padma'i steng du h'um las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte bar de nyid kyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i 'od las byung ba'i rdo rje'i ra ba la sogs pa bsgoms la /
translated: Then, on a multicolored lotus, from a hum arises a multicolored vajra cross. In its center, from the light of its consecration, meditate on a vajra fence and so forth.

original: der yam yongs su gyur pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du ram las byung ba'i ma'i dkyil 'khor /
analyzed: der yam yongs su gyur pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du ram las byung ba'i ma'i dkyil 'khor /
translated: There, from a yaṃ arises a wind mandala. On that, from raṃ arises a fire mandala.

original: de'i steng du bam las byung ba'i chu'i dkyil 'khor /
analyzed: de'i steng du bam las byung ba'i chu'i dkyil 'khor /
translated: On that, from vaṃ arises a water mandala.

original: de'i steng du lam las byung ba'i sa'i dkyil 'khor la ri rgyal lhun po bltas la /
analyzed: de'i steng du lam las byung ba'i sa'i dkyil 'khor la ri rgyal lhun po bltas la /
translated: On that, from laṃ arises an earth mandala. On that, visualize Mount Meru, the king of mountains.

original: der chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi nang du chud par sna tshogs padma dang / rdo rje'i lte ba la rnam par snang mdzad yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i khang bu brtsegs pa gru bzhi la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can rdo rje dang padma dang 'khor lo'i phreng bas bskor ba'i padma rim pa gsum la nyi ma'i gdan sum cu rtsa bdun
analyzed: der chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi nang du chud par sna tshogs padma dang / rdo rje'i lte ba la rnam par snang mdzad yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i khang bu brtsegs pa gru bzhi la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can rdo rje dang padma dang 'khor lo'i phreng bas bskor ba'i padma rim pa gsum la nyi ma'i gdan sum cu rtsa bdun
translated: Inside that, within the source of phenomena, is a multicolored lotus and a vajra center, upon which is a palace arisen from the transformation of Vairocana, having the characteristics of four sides and so on, surrounded by a vajra, lotus, and wheel fence, with thirty-seven sun seats upon three tiers of lotuses.

original: gyis mnan pa bsgoms te /
analyzed: gyis mnan pa bsgoms te /
translated: Meditate on that.

original: de'i dbus kyi gdan la rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du aa la sogs pa dang ka la sogs pa zhugs pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis la h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje'i lta bar de nyid kyis byin gyis brlabs pa de dag yongs su gyur pa las
analyzed: de'i dbus kyi gdan la rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du aa la sogs pa dang ka la sogs pa zhugs pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis la h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje'i lta bar de nyid kyis byin gyis brlabs pa de dag yongs su gyur pa las
translated: On the central seat, upon two moon maṇḍalas, which are the entry of the vowels and consonants, respectively, is a hūṃ, from which arises a vajra cross marked with hūṃs.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gror bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gror bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Those transform into Vajraḍāka.

original: aom tsitta pra ti be dham ka ro mi //
analyzed: aom tsitta pra ti be dham ka ro mi //
translated: oṃ citta-prativedhaṃ kuru

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa mngon par byang chub pa lnga'i sngags dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa mngon par byang chub pa lnga'i sngags dang sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, one should apply the mantras of the five manifest enlightenments.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji lta bu zhig ce na /🔽sku mdog sngon po @30b mche ba yid tsam gtsigs shing khro ba dang bcas pa sngon po dang / dkar po dang / ser po dang / dmar po'i mdog can gyi rtsa ba dang / g-yas dang / rgyab dang / g-yon gyi zhal bzhi dang ldan pa 'bar ba'i rdo rje dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji lta bu zhig ce na / sku mdog sngon po @30b mche ba yid tsam gtsigs shing khro ba dang bcas pa sngon po dang / dkar po dang / ser po dang / dmar po'i mdog can gyi rtsa ba dang / g-yas dang / rgyab dang / g-yon gyi zhal bzhi dang ldan pa 'bar ba'i rdo rje dang /
translated: What is the Bhagavat like?🔽 He has a blue body, slightly bared fangs, and a wrathful face that is blue, white, yellow, and red, with four faces, the front, right, back, and left, adorned with six hands holding a blazing vajra,

original: gshol dang / mnga' dang / kha tv'am ga dang / thod pa dang / gzhu rnams bsnams pa'i phyag drug gis brgyan cing thod pa'i phreng ba'i dbu rgyan can skra kham pa gyen du 'bar ba spyan gsum pa nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la bdud bzhi g-yas brkyang gis gnas pas mnan te bzhugs pa /
analyzed: gshol dang / mnga' dang / kha tv'am ga dang / thod pa dang / gzhu rnams bsnams pa'i phyag drug gis brgyan cing thod pa'i phreng ba'i dbu rgyan can skra kham pa gyen du 'bar ba spyan gsum pa nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la bdud bzhi g-yas brkyang gis gnas pas mnan te bzhugs pa /
translated: a plow, a sword, a khaṭvāṅga, and a bow, with a head ornament of a garland of skulls, hair blazing upward, three eyes, and standing on the circle of the sun with his right leg extended, trampling the four māras.

original: zhal bzhi'i smin mtshams nas h'um bzhi'i sngags 'phro zhing shes rab sku mdog dmar mo phyag na zangs gri dang thod pa bsnams pa la dga' pas kun du 'khyud pa'o //
analyzed: zhal bzhi'i smin mtshams nas h'um bzhi'i sngags 'phro zhing shes rab sku mdog dmar mo phyag na zangs gri dang thod pa bsnams pa la dga' pas kun du 'khyud pa'o //
translated: With great delight, he embraces the red Prajna, who holds a copper knife and a skull-cup.

original: shar gyi 'dab ma la ltung byed ma sku mdog sngo ser phyag bzhi na thod pa dang / rdo rje dang dril bu dang / kha tv'am ga bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: shar gyi 'dab ma la ltung byed ma sku mdog sngo ser phyag bzhi na thod pa dang / rdo rje dang dril bu dang / kha tv'am ga bsnams pa'o //
translated: In the eastern petal is Parashu, blue-yellow in color, with four hands holding a skull-cup, a vajra, a bell, and a khaṭvāṅga.

original: byang du gsod byed ma mdog ljang ser /
analyzed: byang du gsod byed ma mdog ljang ser /
translated: In the north is Marichi, green-yellow in color,

original: phyag bzhi na rde'u chung dang / thod pa dang / kha tv'am ga dang / zhags pa bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: phyag bzhi na rde'u chung dang / thod pa dang / kha tv'am ga dang / zhags pa bsnams pa'o //
translated: with four hands holding a small drum, a skull-cup, a khaṭvāṅga, and a noose.

original: nub tu 'gugs byed ma mdog dmar ser phyag bzhin mda' dang / sna tshogs padma dang / gzhu dang thod pa bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: nub tu 'gugs byed ma mdog dmar ser phyag bzhin mda' dang / sna tshogs padma dang / gzhu dang thod pa bsnams pa'o //
translated: In the west is Akarṣiṇī, red-yellow in color, with four hands holding an arrow, a variegated lotus, a bow, and a skull-cup.

original: lhor gar gyi dbang phyug ma mdog dkar ser phyag bzhi na dan dang / thong pa dang / mdung rtse gsum dang / rin po che bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: lhor gar gyi dbang phyug ma mdog dkar ser phyag bzhi na dan dang / thong pa dang / mdung rtse gsum dang / rin po che bsnams pa'o //
translated: In the south is Nartaneswari, white-yellow in color, with four hands holding a banner, a spear, a trident, and a jewel.

original: de dag gi thod par rim bzhin du glang po che dang / khyi dang mi dang ba lang rnams blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi thod par rim bzhin du glang po che dang / khyi dang mi dang ba lang rnams blta bar bya'o //
translated: In their skulls, one should visualize, in order, an elephant, a dog, a human being, and an ox.

original: de dag kun kyang zhal gcig spyan gsum pa skra kham pa gyen du 'bar zhing rgyan thams cad pa nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la g-yas brkyang gis bzhugs shing nyi ma'i 'od can no //
analyzed: de dag kun kyang zhal gcig spyan gsum pa skra kham pa gyen du 'bar zhing rgyan thams cad pa nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la g-yas brkyang gis bzhugs shing nyi ma'i 'od can no //
translated: All of them have one face, three eyes, tawny hair bristling upward, and all the ornaments. They stand on sun-disks in the pose of right leg extended, and they have the luster of the sun.

original: dbang ldan la sogs pa'i mtshams kyi 'dab ma rnams su bdud rtsi lnga'i thod par sangs rgyas kyi sku dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan la sogs pa'i mtshams kyi 'dab ma rnams su bdud rtsi lnga'i thod par sangs rgyas kyi sku dang ldan pa'o //
translated: On the petals in the quarters beginning with the northeast, in skull-bowls filled with the five ambrosias, are the forms of the Buddhas.

original: de'i phyir rol padma 'dab ma brgyad rdo rje sngon po'i phreng bas bskor ba ni thugs kyi 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rol padma 'dab ma brgyad rdo rje sngon po'i phreng bas bskor ba ni thugs kyi 'khor lo ste /
translated: Outside of that, the wheel of mind is an eight-petaled lotus surrounded by a garland of blue vajras.

original: de'i shar phyogs kyi rtsibs su pulli ra ma la yar rab tu gtum mo la thod pa'i dum bu can gyis 'khyud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i shar phyogs kyi rtsibs su pulli ra ma la yar rab tu gtum mo la thod pa'i dum bu can gyis 'khyud pa'o //
translated: On the petal in the east, in Pulliramalaya, is Caṇḍālī, embraced by Kapālasphoṭa.

original: byang du dz'a landha ra gtum pa'i mig can ma dang keng rus chen po'o //
analyzed: byang du dz'a landha ra gtum pa'i mig can ma dang keng rus chen po'o //
translated: In the north, in Jālandhara, is Caṇḍākṣī, with Mahāśmaśāna.

original: nub tu audyan du 'od ldan ma dang keng rus @31a * //
analyzed: nub tu audyan du 'od ldan ma dang keng rus @31a * //
translated: In the west, in Oḍḍiyāna, is the goddess Radiant and the skeleton.

original: so ; / lhor aarbu dar sna chen ma dang mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa'o //
analyzed: so ; / lhor aarbu dar sna chen ma dang mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa'o //
translated: In the south, in Arbuda, is the goddess Great Nose and the one with bared fangs.

original: me mtshams su go d'a ba rir dpa' bo'i blo ma dang lha'i dgra'o //
analyzed: me mtshams su go d'a ba rir dpa' bo'i blo ma dang lha'i dgra'o //
translated: In the southeast, in Godāvarī, is the goddess Heroine and the enemy of gods.

original: bden bral du r'a me shva rir mi'u thung ma dang 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: bden bral du r'a me shva rir mi'u thung ma dang 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: In the southwest, in Rāmeśvarī, is the goddess Dwarf and the immeasurable light.

original: rlung mtshams su de b'i ko tir lang ka'i dbang phyug ma dang rdo rje'i 'od do //
analyzed: rlung mtshams su de b'i ko tir lang ka'i dbang phyug ma dang rdo rje'i 'od do //
translated: In the northwest, in Devakōṭṭa, is the goddess Queen of Laṅkā and the vajra light.

original: dbang ldan du m'a la bar shing grib ma dang rdo rje'i lus so //
analyzed: dbang ldan du m'a la bar shing grib ma dang rdo rje'i lus so //
translated: In the northeast, in Mālava, is the goddess Tree Shade and the vajra body.

original: de'i phyi rol padma dmar po'i phreng bas bskor ba'i padma dmar po ni gsung gi 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol padma dmar po'i phreng bas bskor ba'i padma dmar po ni gsung gi 'khor lo ste /
translated: Outside of that, the wheel of speech is a garland of red lotuses.

analyzed: bden bral du lam p'a kar shin tu bzang mo dang rdo rje bzang po'o //

analyzed: de'i phyi rol 'khor lo dkar po'i phreng bas bskor ba'i padma dkar po ni sku'i 'khor lo ste /

analyzed: de'i shar du pre ta pu rir 'khor lo'i shugs can ma dang stobs po che'o //

analyzed: nub tu soo r'ashtar glang sna ma dang rta mgrin no //

analyzed: lhor gser gling du 'khor lo'i go cha ma dang nam mkha'i snying po'o //

analyzed: me mtshams su na ga rar shin tu dpa' mo dang dpal he ru ka'o //

analyzed: rlung mtshams su ma ror 'khor los sgyur ma dang rnam par snang mdzad do //

analyzed: dbang ldan du ku lu tar brtson chen mo dang rdo rje sems dpa' 'o //

translated: The faculties of faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration and wisdom are respectively the heroines Vira, Kumbha, Karnika, Vana and

analyzed: lamp'a ka ste mgrin par shin tu bzang mo ste rol pa ma'o //

translated: “Earthquake” means the earth cracks and is wounded.

original: dmyal bar btang ba ni dmyal bar bkri ba'o //🔽byol song gi mngal du spo ba ni mi las byol song du bya'o //
analyzed: dmyal bar btang ba ni dmyal bar bkri ba'o // byol song gi mngal du spo ba ni mi las byol song du bya'o //
translated: “To be sent to hell” means to be led to hell.🔽“To be transferred to the womb of an animal” means to be born as an animal from a human.

original: skyes pa bud med du bya ba ni mtshan ma bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: skyes pa bud med du bya ba ni mtshan ma bsgyur ba'o //
translated: “To be a woman” means to change the sex.

original: mngal na gnas pa 'byung ba la sogs pa ni grags par zad do //
analyzed: mngal na gnas pa 'byung ba la sogs pa ni grags par zad do //
translated: “To be born in the womb” and so on are well known.

original: mtshon bcing ba zhes bya ba ni mtshon cha kha rdal ba ste /
analyzed: mtshon bcing ba zhes bya ba ni mtshon cha kha rdal ba ste /
translated: “To be bound with weapons” means to be bound with weapons.

original: 'ching du gzhug pa zhes bya ba dang yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'ching du gzhug pa zhes bya ba dang yang sbyar ro //
translated: “To be bound” is also applied.

original: byas pa chud gzan pa ni 'bad pa 'bras bu med par bya ba'o //
analyzed: byas pa chud gzan pa ni 'bad pa 'bras bu med par bya ba'o //
translated: “To waste what is done” means to make effort fruitless.

original: gcer bu ni gos med par bya'o //
analyzed: gcer bu ni gos med par bya'o //
translated: “Naked” means to be without clothes.

original: bha ga dang bshang ba'i lcags sgrog ces bya ba la /
analyzed: bha ga dang bshang ba'i lcags sgrog ces bya ba la /
translated: The “fetters of the bhaga and excrement” are as follows.

original: bha ga ni rdo rje dang padma'o //
analyzed: bha ga ni rdo rje dang padma'o //
translated: The bhaga is the vajra and lotus.

original: @34b bshang ba ni bshang ba'i lam ste de dag phan tshun 'byar nas dbral dka' ba ni lcags sgrog go //
analyzed: @34b bshang ba ni bshang ba'i lam ste de dag phan tshun 'byar nas dbral dka' ba ni lcags sgrog go //
translated: Excrement is the anus. They are fetters because they are difficult to separate, since they are stuck together.

original: bha ga dang bshang ba'i smra ba dang / dgod du gzhug pa dang / khrag dang khu ba dbab pa'i nang dang gzhom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bha ga dang bshang ba'i smra ba dang / dgod du gzhug pa dang / khrag dang khu ba dbab pa'i nang dang gzhom pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: “The bhaga and excrement, speech, laughter, blood, semen, and the internal and external destruction” are as follows.

original: smra ba dan dgod du gzhug pa ni mtshan ma rdol ba'o //
analyzed: smra ba dan dgod du gzhug pa ni mtshan ma rdol ba'o //
translated: Speech and laughter are the bursting of the sexual organ.

original: khrag dang lu ba dbab pa ni tshabs cher 'dzag pa ste de nyid nad do //
analyzed: khrag dang lu ba dbab pa ni tshabs cher 'dzag pa ste de nyid nad do //
translated: The emission of blood and semen is a heavy flow, which is a disease.

original: gzhom pa ni bha ga la sogs pa yon por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzhom pa ni bha ga la sogs pa yon por gyur pa'o //
translated: Destruction is the perversion of the bhaga, and so on.

original: khrag la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: khrag la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: Blood, and so on, are easy to understand.

original: mya ngan ni yid kyi gdung ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan ni yid kyi gdung ba'o //
translated: Sorrow is mental anguish.

original: sdug bsngal ni lus kyi gdung ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni lus kyi gdung ba'o //
translated: Pain is physical anguish.

original: btags pa ni dbyug pa la sogs pas brdung ba'o //
analyzed: btags pa ni dbyug pa la sogs pas brdung ba'o //
translated: Punishment is beating with a stick, and so on.

original: bcing ba ni btson rar gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: bcing ba ni btson rar gzhug pa'o //
translated: Bondage is being put in prison.

original: dum bur bya ba ni rkang lag breg pa'o //
analyzed: dum bur bya ba ni rkang lag breg pa'o //
translated: Cutting into pieces is cutting off the limbs.

original: lus thams cad phye mar bya ba ni gru mo dang khu tshur gyis brdeg pa'o //
analyzed: lus thams cad phye mar bya ba ni gru mo dang khu tshur gyis brdeg pa'o //
translated: Crushing the body is beating with the elbows and fists.

original: gzer ba ni glo bur du rgyal po la sogs pa'i chad pas gcad pa'o //
analyzed: gzer ba ni glo bur du rgyal po la sogs pa'i chad pas gcad pa'o //
translated: Piercing is suddenly cutting with the punishment of a king, and so on.

original: thams cad chags pa ni skye bo dga' bar bya ba'o //🔽dgug pa ni dga' ba'i 'og tu mdun du dgug pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad chags pa ni skye bo dga' bar bya ba'o // dgug pa ni dga' ba'i 'og tu mdun du dgug pa'o //
translated: All attachment is pleasing people.🔽Summoning is summoning in front after pleasing.

original: gzhug pa ni bkug gi 'og tu dbang du bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhug pa ni bkug gi 'og tu dbang du bya ba'o //
translated: Entering is bringing under control after summoning.

original: bskyod pa ni gzhan du bkri ba'o //
analyzed: bskyod pa ni gzhan du bkri ba'o //
translated: Shaking is leading elsewhere.

original: gar la sogs pa ni grags par zad do //
analyzed: gar la sogs pa ni grags par zad do //
translated: Dancing and so on are well known.

original: mi rnams ni lhag par smra ba dang byol song la sogs pa lan 'ga' smrar gzhug pa ni mang du smrar gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: mi rnams ni lhag par smra ba dang byol song la sogs pa lan 'ga' smrar gzhug pa ni mang du smrar gzhug pa'o //
translated: Humans are those who speak excessively. Animals and so on are those who sometimes speak.

original: ltas ngan ni sngon med pa'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: ltas ngan ni sngon med pa'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: Bad omens are inauspicious signs.

original: bstan pa ni snang ba'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ni snang ba'o //
translated: Teaching is illumination.🔽Attainment is acquisition.

original: thob pa ni rnyed pa ste de dag dbang du bya ba'i las la sbyar ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: thob pa ni rnyed pa ste de dag dbang du bya ba'i las la sbyar ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those are called the activities of bringing them under control.

original: lha thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lha thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: All the gods, etc.

original: 'byung po ni yid dags so //
analyzed: 'byung po ni yid dags so //
translated: Spirits are the gandharvas.

original: ma mo ni ma mo bdun no //
analyzed: ma mo ni ma mo bdun no //
translated: The mothers are the seven mātarīs.

original: 'dul byed ni 'byung po'i gtso bo'o //
analyzed: 'dul byed ni 'byung po'i gtso bo'o //
translated: The tamer is the chief of the spirits.

original: mchog sbyin ni nor sbyin no //
analyzed: mchog sbyin ni nor sbyin no //
translated: The giver of boons is Kubera.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i las bya ba ni lha la sogs pa de dag sna tshogs su sprul pa'o //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i las bya ba ni lha la sogs pa de dag sna tshogs su sprul pa'o // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba ni /
translated: The all-knowing is the one who acts in various emanations as gods, etc.

original: 'khor ba la chags ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba la chags ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: The dispassionate of all the Tathāgatas is the one who is free from attachment to saṃsāra.

original: byad chud sems dpa' thams cad kyi 'khor ba'i skyo ba bsal ba ni lam shes pa nyid la sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: byad chud sems dpa' thams cad kyi 'khor ba'i skyo ba bsal ba ni lam shes pa nyid la sbyar ba'o //
translated: The dispelled weariness of saṃsāra of all the Bodhisattvas is the one who is applied to the knowledge of the path.

original: 'di de zhes bya la /
analyzed: 'di de zhes bya la /
translated: This is this.

original: 'di ni las brgya pa rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni las brgya pa rdzogs pa'o //
translated: This concludes the One Hundred Acts.

original: de ni de ltar te rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni de ltar te rim pa'o //
translated: That is thus, meaning in this order.

original: sngags kyi rgyal po 'di nyid ces bya ba ni ka ra ka ra la @35a * //🔽sogs pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: sngags kyi rgyal po 'di nyid ces bya ba ni ka ra ka ra la @35a * // sogs pa'i sngags so //
translated: This very king of mantras is the mantra beginning with kara kara.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sdud pa po'i rang bzo spong ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sdud pa po'i rang bzo spong ba'o //
translated: This and so on is the refutation of the author's own invention by the compiler.

original: sgyu ma kun dang mnyam sbyor ba //
analyzed: sgyu ma kun dang mnyam sbyor ba //
translated: One is united with all illusions.
